5:13.race_name: Come Racing Again 30th May Veterans' Handicap

runners.name: Danzan
runners.comment: Hard to win with but reliable and this weaker than he's used to; each-way shout at least
runners.spotlight: Getting on for two years since his last win but he's a reliable sort and should be sharper with last month's reappearance behind him; each-way claims at least.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: That was fantastic. Danzan has been second a lot of times but it's no fault of his own and he was suited by the strong pace - Tim Easterby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a grand little horse, we didn't win with him last year but he ran really well. He ran a cracker at Doncaster and he's one for all the good sprint handicaps. I don't think he wants the ground too firm and he'll probably keep the blinkers on. 03-05-21

runners.name: Ancient Times
runners.comment: Two good 5f runs this year; easy 6f no problem; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Ended his losing run with a ready success at Doncaster last month (5f, good to firm); similar form when second at Goodwood three weeks ago; no problem with an easy 6f and he's more appealing than most.

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: Two turf wins this year & ran well over C&D 12 days ago; not at best on Monday; contender
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins this spring (5f, good at Pontefract and 6f, good to firm at Doncaster) and also ran well over C&D 12 days ago; form dipped at Redcar on Monday; drawn widest but still likely to give a good account.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent all-weather horse and has won at Newcastle and Southwell this month and been second twice. He may switch back to turf but dry ground is quite important to him. When he's right he tries very hard and he's the sort who's important to the yard because he can win two or three a year and if every horse did that you'd have an awful lot of winners. He's entered at Newcastle on Friday. 20-03-24

runners.name: Arecibo
runners.comment: Over four years since last win; not found his best form this year and others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Smart sprinter in his prime but last win was four years ago and he's finished down the field in four runs this season; return to 6f in his favour but don't need much encouragement to look elsewhere.

quotes.race: WSG Sports Signage Handicap
quotes.quote: Arecibo loved the ground and he was down in class so he was entitled to win like that - Frankie Dettori, jockey.

runners.name: Vince Lombardi
runners.comment: On a losing run but he's on a dangerous mark and should be at peak fitness; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Over two years since his last win but he's down in the weights and he should be at concert pitch after two runs this season; slower than good to firm probably ideal.

stable_tour.quote: He's really interesting. He came here with some foot problems, but our farriers have done an amazing job sorting that. He's got some solid sprint handicap form and his owner James Finch, who also has Andaleep, loves pot-hunting in the Sunday Series and the Racing League, so that's where we'll aim. 02-05-24

runners.name: Roundhay Park

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr J D Gordon

runners.comment: Latest 6th came from a poor draw/track position in a race that's working out; contender
runners.spotlight: Rated 16lb higher this time last year and often acquitted himself with credit in good company; yet to find his best form this season but he was racing away from the main action at Haydock last time in a race that's working out well; has C&D form and should make a bold bid.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Trophy Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit shocked, but Roundhay Park does turn up every time and tries his heart out. It's lovely getting on such genuine horses. I was doing a rain dance last night as he does like it with a bit of soft in the ground. He's so genuine and kept on finding - Faye McManoman, jockey.

quotes.race: QTS Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was very relaxed today. He sometimes gets wound up but he came up yesterday and he's been very relaxed. He was given a great ride by Faye as there was no panic and no rush - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Novice Auction Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was a bit buzzy so I'll give him a bit of a break now - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse and has been a great servant for the yard. He was second in the Shergar Cup Sprint Cup years back under Hayley Turner and was a top-class handicapper in his heyday. He finished last of 11 at York on Friday and hasn't shown it in his last two starts but the handicapper has just got him high enough. He's a little bit older now and we could do with a bit of help from the handicapper. 27-07-22

runners.name: Ramon Di Loria
runners.comment: Flopped last time and 5lb higher here; still feasibly treated on recent best though
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins this spring, the latest off 5lb lower at Ayr last month; failed to fire over 7f three weeks ago but no surprise to see him bounce back quickly.

quotes.race: Foley's Bar & Off Licence Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Ramon Di Loria ran well at Dundalk. He is a good ground horse, Ronan gave him a lovely ride and I think he'll go forward from here - Tracey Collins, trainer.

runners.name: Beauzon
runners.comment: Ran well on turf at Leicester two weeks ago; up 2lb in a stronger race today
runners.spotlight: Best known for his exploits on AW but he ran well for second at Leicester two weeks ago (6f, good to firm); 2lb higher in a deeper race but still feasibly treated on this winter's AW best.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beauzon is a nice horse - we've always liked him. He had a bad draw at Beverley last time and he ran quite a good race from there. It's an advantage to be on the fence here - David Nolan, jockey.

2:50.race_name: Wishing Jill Metcalfe Happy 60th Birthday Handicap

runners.name: Zephlyn
runners.comment: First turf victory over C&D 12 days ago; up 3lb but another bold showing is on the cards
runners.spotlight: Is enjoying a very good season and notched his first victory on turf over C&D 12 days ago; up 3lb but another bold showing is on the cards.

quotes.race: Hillcrest Who Cares Wins Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't ride Zephyln last time and it was very tactical. It's not the way he needs riding. The favourite and second favourite got the run of the race at Ayr and it turned into a sprint. He's a horse you need to be going flat out from the get go - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Captain Potter
runners.comment: C&D scorer; head second in Newcastle h'cap 22 days ago; a likely player off same mark
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer who comes here on the back of a good second of four, beaten only a head, in 2m Newcastle handicap 22 days ago; a likely player off the same mark for yard among the winners.

stable_tour.quote: He won a maiden hurdle at Sedgefield and then next time they went far too slow for him. We've given him a break and he's going to come back and have a go on the Flat over two miles as he wants a trip. He started off on the Flat and he's done all right since coming here. 03-04-24

runners.name: Red Force One
runners.breeder: K A Bartlett & J M Beever
runners.comment: Has beaten just one rival in handicaps at Southwell/C&D this term; lots more is needed
runners.spotlight: A three-time 1m6f/2m scorer in 2024 but he's beaten just one rival in handicaps at Southwell and over C&D this term; he needs to take a big step forward.

quotes.race: Sky Bet UK's No.1 Betting App Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't worried about running Red Force One again quickly as he's as fresh as paint - Phil Kirby, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Summer Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't the original plan to be that far back but they went a strong pace early on. Red Force One stayed on well and will jump a fence - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Wellchild Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the headgear has done Red Force One good, and the mile and a quarter helps too. I was a bit worried about the ground but he battled well on it. The leader went a nice pace and I kept him in my sights - Martin Harley, jockey.

runners.name: Cosmic Soul
runners.owner: M Lee, D Lee, C Jolley & P Neville

prev_owners.owner: M Lee, D Lee & P Neville

runners.comment: Is 0-14 and a below-par eighth at Newcastle in December; needs to hit the ground running
runners.spotlight: Is 0-14 and he came in a below-par eighth of 11 in 2m Newcastle handicap in December; he needs to hit the ground running on his return.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go back hurdling providing the ground doesn't get too heavy. We've been scratching our heads because he hasn't replicated his good homework on the track. We've sorted a few little issues and he's in great nick. 11-12-24

runners.name: Quercus Robur
runners.comment: Ended a losing run at Pontefract last month; can go well again despite 2lb rise
runners.spotlight: Capitalised on a reduced mark when ending a losing run in 2m5f handicap at Pontefract last month; he can go well again despite a 2lb rise.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't go that quick and it can't turn into a sprint with Quercus Robur, he needs everything to go smooth. The drop back in trip didn't suit him last time. Back up to two miles today was ideal. He's a bit quirky, going down to the start he was a bit reluctant but you just have to kid him into races a little bit - Kevin Stott, jockey.

runners.name: Zooks
runners.comment: In good form, third at Wolverhampton 25 days ago; ought to be in the shake-up once more
runners.spotlight: Finally opened her account at Chelmsford (1m5f) in February and has continued in good form, third of six in 1m6f Wolverhampton handicap 25 days ago; she ought to be in the shake-up once more.

runners.name: Lillistar
runners.comment: Yet to win but a very good hurdling second at Sedgefield latest; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Yet to register a victory but she arrives on the back of a very good hurdling second at Sedgefield (2m4f) 11 days ago; possibilities if translating that form back to the Flat.

4:05.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap

runners.name: Betweenthesticks
runners.owner: J A Swinburne & Mrs Ruth A Carr
runners.comment: Solid fourth in Ripon h'cap 15 days ago when caught wide; he can go well eased 1lb here
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways at Nottingham (5f) in April and posted a solid fourth of eight in 5f Ripon handicap 15 days ago when caught wide; he can go well eased 1lb here.

stable_tour.quote: He's a straightforward sprinter who nearly always goes over the minimum trip. He had a busy time last year, running 12 times between May and October and winning twice. He doesn't want extremes of going and I fully expect him to win again soon. 09-04-25

runners.name: Dandy Fitz
runners.comment: C&D scorer; good second at Southwell in September; yard is going well so needs considering
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer who signed off for 2024 with a good second in 5f Southwell handicap in September; yard is going well so needs considering despite an eight-month absence.

runners.name: Match Play
runners.comment: Comes here in decent nick, fourth at Hamilton eight days ago; he ought to be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: It's now 11 outings since his last victory but he comes here in decent nick, blinkered when fourth of eight in 5f Hamilton handicap eight days ago; he ought to be thereabouts.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with him at Leicester, he came home well and will step up to six furlongs at York. 10-05-22

runners.name: Without Flaw
runners.comment: Suffered poor run when close sixth over C&D 12 days ago; big shout off an unchanged mark
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing sequence but she has returned in excellent form, suffering a poor run when a close sixth of 15 to Irish Dancer over C&D 12 days ago; big shout off an unchanged mark.

runners.name: Irish Dancer
runners.comment: Breakthrough success over C&D 12 days ago; up 4lb but respected in current mood
runners.spotlight: Tongue tied when gaining his breakthrough success in 15-runner handicap over C&D 12 days ago; up 4lb but respected in his current mood.

runners.name: Mrs Bagerran
runners.comment: Not disgraced after four months off when eighth over C&D 12 days ago; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2023 but she wasn't disgraced after four months off when eighth of 15 to Irish Dancer over C&D 12 days ago; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: She won twice for us over 5f in 2023, both times at Musselburgh, and was placed there three times last season. She loves sharp tracks like Musselburgh and Catterick. She's down to a winnable mark of 48 and I'm hopeful she'll be able to win again and pick up prize-money throughout the year. She goes really well for claimers and likes quickish ground. 21-05-25

runners.name: Synergism
runners.comment: Major step forward when scoring at Wolverhampton on h'cap debut; very much the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Son of Soldier Hollow took a major step forward on his handicap debut when scoring at Wolverhampton (9.5f) on his return last month; up 7lb but appeals as a typical improver for this yard stepping up further in trip and very much the one to beat.

runners.name: Salaria
runners.comment: Still a maiden but solid third at Beverley latest; should go well again, upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but she's proving a reliable sort and (with cheekpieces on) posted a solid third of nine in 1m2f Beverley handicap 30 days ago; should go well again, upped in distance.

runners.name: Call Me Audrey
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in 1m4f handicap at Beverley last time; hard to warm to
runners.spotlight: Seems a poor maiden on balance and she failed to beat a rival in 1m4f handicap at Beverley last time, having hung badly left on the first bend; hard to warm to.

runners.name: Grizzieblanca
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 51 & Mrs E Burke
runners.comment: Good fourth at Beverley (1m2f) 11 days ago; possibilities in her bid for a maiden victory
runners.spotlight: Maiden who took a step forward on her second go in handicap company when fourth of nine at Beverley (1m2f) 11 days ago; possibilities on her first go over 1m4f.

runners.name: Yellow Dream
runners.comment: Beat only one at Carlisle five days ago; visor added and could still do better here
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior filly; failed to build on earlier promise when beating only one on her handicap debut at Carlisle (1m) five days ago; turned out quickly here with a visor added and could still do better.

runners.name: Hype Merchant
runners.comment: Good fifth for his new yard at Ripon latest; player with return to 7f a likely plus
runners.spotlight: Proved a reliable maiden for David Loughnane and he posted a good staying-on fifth of ten for his new yard in 6f Ripon handicap six days ago; this return to 7f promises to suit so he's a player.

runners.name: Wondrous Ways
runners.comment: Course winner; very slowly away when sixth at Redcar latest; remains one to consider
runners.spotlight: Course winner who was very slowly away when only sixth of eight in 1m Redcar handicap 23 days ago; she remains one to consider.

runners.name: Eye On The Prize
runners.comment: Creditable fifth in 1m Ripon handicap 15 days ago; possibilities off a 2lb lower mark
runners.spotlight: Expert Eye filly; resumed from seven months off with a creditable fifth of nine in 1m Ripon handicap 15 days ago; possibilities off a 2lb lower mark.

runners.name: Unthinkable
runners.comment: Scored at Beverley last May but below form since; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Scored at Beverley (5f) last May but below form since and she failed to beat a rival in 6f Hamilton handicap 20 days ago; others appeal more.

1:40.race_name: Pennine Brewing Company Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Cant Chant
runners.comment: 250-1 when well held on belated debut last month
runners.spotlight: 250-1 when well held on belated debut at Ayr (1m, good) 26 days ago.

runners.name: Champion Again Ole
runners.breeder: Watership Down Stud And W S Farish Snr
runners.comment: Caught eye with late headway when 8l fourth on 6f AW debut; will improve for top yard
runners.spotlight: 250,000gns yearling who was beaten 8l when fourth of 12 on his 6f Kempton debut 19 days ago but caught the eye with some late headway and rates a sure-fire improver now stepping up to 7f.

runners.name: Watch And Shoot
runners.comment: Well bred; promise when third on 7f AW debut 22 days ago; can be expected to improve
runners.spotlight: Â£170,000 yearling who is a brother to some smart winners and performed to a fair level when third of five on 7f Newcastle debut 22 days ago; can be expected to improve and go well.

runners.name: Wicklow Way
runners.comment: Showed a bit when fifth over C&D 12 days ago but probably more one for longer term
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on his 1m Wetherby debut when fifth (Dorothy May sixth) of ten over C&D (good to firm) 12 days ago but probably more one for handicaps after this.

runners.name: Dorothy May
runners.comment: Finished 1l behind reopposing Wicklow Way when sixth over C&D 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Offered more than on debut when sixth (Wicklow Way 1l ahead in fifth) over C&D 12 days ago but it's likely we won't see the best of her until she's handicapping.

runners.name: Highfield Sunshine
runners.comment: Sets the standard on reappearance second but possibly vulnerable to an improver
runners.spotlight: Matched the pick of her three efforts as a juvenile when 5l second in 7f Thirsk maiden (good) on reappearance; that sets the standard but might prove vulnerable to an improver.

3:35.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Farandaway
runners.comment: Fading eighth in 5f Thirsk h'cap on his return; needs considering back in novice company
runners.spotlight: Runner-up four times at two and he shaped as if the run would bring him on when a fading eighth of ten in 5f Thirsk handicap on his return last month; he needs considering back in novice company.

runners.name: Memphisatmidnight
runners.comment: Only fourth of five at Hamilton latest; may still do better though
runners.spotlight: Son of Dandy Man failed to build on his debut promise when only fourth of five in 5f Hamilton novice 20 days ago; he may still do better, especially once qualified for handicaps.

runners.name: Reservardo
runners.comment: Promising second first two runs but below-par third at Southwell final run; the form pick
runners.spotlight: Profitable colt; shaped well when second in 5f maidens at Windsor and Ripon on his first two runs but hindered by a slow start when a below-par third in 5f Southwell novice later in the autumn; rates the form pick here and merits serious consideration for his in-form yard.

runners.name: Zubaru
runners.comment: Off seven months before runner-up at Doncaster week ago; open to more progress
runners.spotlight: Zoustar gelding; has gone with promise on both his starts, returning from seven months off (had wind surgery) with runner-up in 6f Doncaster novice a week ago; he's open to more progress so looks a big player.

runners.name: Nad Alshiba Snow
runners.comment: Good second at Lingfield in August for Michael Appleby; not discounted on her yard debut
runners.spotlight: Daughter of Oasis Dream signed off for Michael Appleby with a good second of seven in 5f AW Lingfield novice in August; subsequently changed hands for 18,000gns and can't be discounted on stable/seasonal debut.

1:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +5yds and 2.05, 3.15, 3.45 & 4.20 +3yds)

runners.name: Pellitory
runners.comment: Failed to back up his reappearance win last time and is on a difficult mark
runners.spotlight: Both starts this term over 7f at Newmarket; always behind in Listed grade last time, failing to back up the form of his reappearance win in conditions race, for which he went up 17lb; on a difficult mark.

quotes.race: bet365 EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pellitory is a massive horse who has done all his work with Wimbledon Hawkeye [stable companion]. We've had this race planned the whole season and you get here and think it's a strong race but it was a learning curve today to see whether we were a handicapper or a bit better. He's got a French Guineas entry and we'll think about it but he's a lovely horse with a great future - James Owen, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big horse who's 16.2 hands. He had quite a few runs as a two-year-old, learning all the time, and James Doyle really liked him when he rode him to win at Doncaster last time. He's done quite a bit of his work with Wimbledon Hawkeye and I think he's really smart. We were probably getting him wrong as he's more of a 7f horse than a mile performer, and he'll start back in a nice handicap or a Listed race, probably at one of those early Newmarket meetings. I hope he's more than just a handicapper. 01-01-25

runners.name: Star Anthem
runners.comment: Ran well at Group level last term; came up short in handicap on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive RPRs last season, latterly at Group level; came up short in Ascot handicap (behind Power Fizz) on reappearance but may fare better with the outing under his belt; dropped 2lb.

quotes.race: Reduce Household Bills With The Eco Scheme EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Star Anthem ran super for the first time at Newbury and the form of that race has worked out really well and he took a nice step forward there. He was very at home on the track and the ground and we like the way he's progressing. He's a really strong, well-grown colt and I'm pleased we've managed to get two positive runs into him. We'll let him keep his strength now and hopefully he'll be good enough to go to Ascot. At the moment five furlongs is far enough, he hits the line well, so I'd be looking at the Windsor Castle or the Norfolk - Clive Cox, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Bath last season and ran well when eighth in the Coventry Stakes, considering it was good to firm ground and he'd prefer it softer. He came back in the autumn and made the frame in a couple of Group races. He's strengthened up a lot since then and I'd hope he could be one to follow. 17-04-25

runners.name: Mr Chaplin
runners.comment: Sole handicap attempt resulted in 7f win at Glorious Goodwood; interesting back here
runners.spotlight: Campaigned only on good/firmer; gelded since last run (creditable Listed effort); record of 2-6 in 2024 featured a 7f success, despite traffic issues, at Glorious Goodwood in sole handicap attempt; interesting back here, despite being 8lb higher.

runners.name: Uncle Don
runners.comment: Reappearance effort suggests he's ready for a crack at this new trip; could go well
runners.spotlight: Peak sprint form when eyecatching second in Ayr Listed event; Newmarket reappearance effort (rallying fifth) suggests he's ready for a crack at this new trip; could go well.

runners.name: So Darn Hot
runners.comment: Quite a progressive sprinter; latest effort suggests he's worth a go at 7f
runners.spotlight: Quite a progressive sprinter on turf/AW, winning three times; suffered bad luck on Good Friday, then ran creditably at Newmarket returned to grass, shaping as if this new trip is worth exploring; in the mix.

quotes.race: BetMGM AWC 3 Year Old Trial Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't expect So Darn Hot to win like that. He was essentially carrying 12lb more than last time and I wasn't sure Lingfield would suit him. He didn't have any cover, which wasn't ideal, but he's by Too Darn Hot and his progeny love a good fight - Kevin Philippart De Foy, trainer.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: So Darn Hot has definitely sharpened up and was a bit cautious of the ground early on, but he's had no problem with that. He's very game and he felt the other horse come to him and found another gear. There'll be more to come next year. He's done really well over six months. He just wasn't there for his debut at Salisbury, but he's going from strength to strength - Benoit de la Sayette, jockey.

runners.name: Power Fizz
runners.comment: 3-3 when making the running; not sure to get his own way but otherwise an improving colt
runners.spotlight: Developing into a useful 7f colt; justified favouritism at Ascot (good to firm) most recently, taking his record when making the running to 3-3; went very close over C&D the time before; not sure to get his own way in this big field but otherwise an improving sort who warrants respect.

runners.name: Principality
runners.comment: 1-1 at Goodwood; return to this venue may spark an upsurge in his form
runners.spotlight: Limitations have become rather exposed over 6f but he's 1-1 at Goodwood (novice win) and the return to this venue, combined with new trip, may spark an upsurge in his form; second run for new yard.

runners.name: Yankee Dude
runners.breeder: Noralla Ltd,Empire B/S & Mrs J Dwyer
runners.comment: Handicap debutant; progressive last term and form has substance; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Progress over 7f as a 2yo comprised a promising effort on turf and two AW wins; form has received several boosts; Ethan Jones takes off a handy 5lb on handicap/seasonal debut; one to consider.

quotes.race: Pete Worlock 60th Birthday / EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Yankee Dude has a very nice pedigree and we've always liked him. He ran very well first time in a very good race at Yarmouth, and he'd stepped forward quite a bit. All of mine, I've made sure they'd improve quite a lot for their first runs. He's still quite raw and green but Ed [Greatrex, jockey] was very taken with him and they were pretty sure the second was a black-type horse, so he looks nice. I'll get him back and take a view as to whether we look to something similar with a penalty or to put him for something better - Warren Greatrex, trainer.

runners.name: Bob Mali
runners.comment: Chance may depend on what the weather does (seems to need ground softer than good)
runners.spotlight: Below-par favourite on good ground last time; raced on softer otherwise, proving progressive in his 6f attempts (well held in Group 3 event over 7f); chance may depend on what the weather does.

quotes.race: British EBF Joan Snow Memorial Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We bought Bob Mali for only 16,000euros and he's from a stallion we're growing to love. He's three from three now and that race was worth nearly 13,000GBP to the winner. He's really exciting. He showed a bit of greenness, but in a nice way it means there's more to come. He'll be aimed at the Horris Hill Stakes. Ollie's keen to run him and we aren't afraid to have a crack - Founding partner Owen Haly.

runners.name: Brighton Boy
runners.comment: Prominent in betting for the C&D nursery won by Mr Chaplin; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Below par when prominent in betting for the C&D nursery won by Mr Chaplin but is worth another crack at this trip; fairly useful over 6f otherwise last season, winning twice; gelded since last run (creditable effort in sales race); not ruled out.

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I don't think everyone would've won on Brighton Boy and he wasn't concentrating on what he should've been on. He's a big horse and we'll get our heads together as he's got a pretty bright future ahead of him - Anna Lisa Balding, wife of trainer.

runners.name: Miss Nightfall
runners.comment: Ran creditably in series final over C&D when last seen, taking record to 32132; solid
runners.spotlight: Appears to handle any ground; ran creditably in valuable series final over C&D when last seen eight months ago, taking record to 32132 and finishing one place in front of Shes Perfect who has strongly advertised the form since, most recently at Classic level; solid claims.

runners.name: Majestic Wave
runners.comment: Ex-Irish colt who can be opposed on the balance of his form for new stable
runners.spotlight: Maiden success in final 2yo start in Ireland; can be opposed on the balance of his form for new stable and there's also a question mark over the course (seemed to not handle Goodwood last time).

quotes.race: Arkle Bar Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: I thought Majestic Wave ran lovely at Naas. I didn't know if he was a 6f or 7f horse, he's probably somewhere in the middle. I think the stiff just shy of six suited him today and a little bit of ease in the ground - John O'Donoghue, trainer.

runners.name: Silver Ghost
runners.comment: Opened her account in Newmarket handicap last time; may build on that success
runners.spotlight: Opened her account in Newmarket handicap (7f, good) on 2,000 Guineas day and the form has received a couple of boosts since; now upped in class but may build on the win and show further improvement.

quotes.race: Aston Martin "Confined" Handicap (Which Have Won No More Than One Race)
quotes.quote: This was always after Newbury and I would say most of the yard would have been on. We'll look for some nicer handicaps Silver Ghost after that - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

runners.name: Cyclonite
runners.comment: Finished nicely at Chester last time, taking record this year to 3333; place claims
runners.spotlight: Consistent over 6f, mostly on AW; finished nicely at Chester most recently, showing he's as effective back on turf and taking record this year to 3333; ready for another go at 7f and again has place claims.

quotes.race: JPS Ceilings And Partitions Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I've always liked Cyclonite, but he's just taken a while to get going and learn the game. I think he's done it a bit easier than it looked, to be honest. He's a nice-looking colt and he's a May foal, so he's definitely one who will keep on improving. I did think he was ready to go and win earlier on in the season, but things just didn't go his way for whatever reason - James Ferguson, trainer.

runners.name: Best Rate
runners.comment: Looked unlucky in the rough race at York won by Rare Change; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Looked unlucky (might have won with a smoother passage) dropped back to 7f in rough race at York ten days ago, taking form figures over this distance to 312; ties in closely with Rare Change on that effort; appears to have a useful handicap in him.

runners.name: Rare Change
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: Mrs J Woods And K Lawrence
runners.comment: In great form, being 2-2 this term; collared Best Rate on the line at York latest
runners.spotlight: Maiden last term and was gelded after final run; two from two this season, the latest win at York (7f, good to firm) where he had a better trip than several of his rivals and collared Best Rate on the line; may need similar luck in this big field but otherwise a contender in great form.

quotes.race: Conundrum HR Consulting Handicap
quotes.quote: Rare Change threatened in nurseries last year to take himself to the next level and he's done that. He needed to today. We were markedly up in grade but did it really well. I thought it was very close but I was in the right place - Hector Crouch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We've always held him in high regard and he ran a blinder at Glorious Goodwood when third in a 6f nursery. Oisin Murphy felt he may have ridden him wrong on the day but he competed well in a very good nursery. He was only sixth at Doncaster last Friday, so he's frustrating, but talented, and we're going to have to figure out how to win with him. 18-09-24

runners.name: Tuco Salamanca
runners.comment: Solid operator this year; ran well in big field at Ascot most recently; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Solid operator (form figures 111442, mostly on AW) this year; eyecatcher on Good Friday then ran well (second of 16, again over 6f) at Ascot on the return to turf; versatile, having won at up to 8.5f, and looks set for another good run.

2:05.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Cocked Hat Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
2:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +5yds and 2.05, 3.15, 3.45 & 4.20 +3yds)

runners.name: Amiloc
runners.comment: Plenty of stamina in useful pedigree but unbeaten in his three races at 7f/1m, here latest
runners.spotlight: Group 1 Eclipse entry over 1m2f; has plenty of stamina in his useful pedigree but unbeaten in his three races at 7f/1m; latest was a good conditions stakes at this track (1m, good) three weeks ago in which he had to work hard to reel in the leaders but ended up just over 3l clear; leading form claims and he's a mouth-watering prospect for this sort of distance.

runners.name: Basalt
runners.breeder: A Stroud, T Stewart & J Hanly
runners.comment: Third of 5 in Pontefract Listed race (1m, soft) as 2yo; open to progress, which is needed
runners.spotlight: Comfortable winner at Newcastle (1m, AW) in September and improved again when 7l third of five in Listed race at Pontefract (1m, soft) in October; should stay at least 1m2f and open to further progress, which is needed.

runners.name: Opportunity
runners.comment: Won Haydock novice (good); Derby entry with plenty of potential and no shortage of stamina
runners.spotlight: By Frankel out of dual 1m2f Group 1 winner Izzi Top; made a promising debut at Nottingham (1m, soft) in October and built on that substantially when always close up but delivered late to justify favouritism in a novice at Haydock (near 1m4f, good) four weeks ago; this Derby entry has plenty of potential and no shortage of stamina.

quotes.race: Darley EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: William [Haggas, trainer] has said Opportunity was a bit of a sleeper at home, but he always thought he had an engine. He looked to be going nowhere but then he just took off. I haven't spoken to the team yet, but I would say we'll have a look at a Derby trial after that. Maybe Chester might suit him, but we'll leave it to William - Richard Brown, advisor to Wathnan Racing.

runners.name: Palazzo Blu
runners.comment: Well related and progressing but others might show a bit more dash than him in this
runners.spotlight: No match for the winner when a staying-on second in novice at Yarmouth (1m2f, good) in April but he won his starts either side, latest when staying on strongly to assert late on as 5-4 favourite in a novice at Southwell (1m4f, AW); well related and progressing but others might show a bit more dash than him in this company.

runners.name: Seaplane
runners.owner: Ben Arbib, Sir Martyn Arbib & Aziz Kheir
runners.comment: Fourth of eight in Group 1 Futurity at Doncaster (1m, soft); had wind surgery last month
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the stable's dual 1m6f Group 2 winner Sumo Sam; like him, he's shown he goes well on soft ground, in his case when easily making all in a Newmarket maiden (7f) before his front-running fourth of eight when tongue tied in the Group 1 Futurity at Doncaster (1m); had wind surgery early last month; should stay well but may need a lot of rain.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai British EBF "Confined" Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings) (2 Runs Or Less)
quotes.quote: Seaplane is a really nice horse who appreciated the ground and we may well have a look at the Futurity at Doncaster after that - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Sir Dinadan
runners.comment: 12-1 fourth of 5 in Gr3 Classic Trial at Sandown (1m2f, good) and may have needed the run
runners.spotlight: Irish Derby entry; big improvement in his three-race 2yo career, on final start winning by 8l from the front when 5-6 in a novice at Pontefract (1m2f, soft); 12-1, best form when just over 3l fourth of five in Group 3 Classic Trial at Sandown (1m2f, good) on reappearance, unable to stay with them from 2f out; may have needed that race and could still be major player.

runners.name: Too Soon
runners.comment: Won well at Epsom (8.5f, heavy) as a 2yo and 4th in Newmarket Group 3 (1m2f, good to soft)
runners.spotlight: Showed promise here on debut; asserted in grand style in a conditions stakes at Epsom (8.5f, heavy) in September and better form when fourth of seven in Group 3 at Newmarket (1m2f, good to soft) 13 days later; not certain to get this far but should still be open to improvement.

runners.name: Tycoon
runners.comment: Striking late headway in good company last August; made all at 4-9 in 1m2f Windsor maiden
runners.spotlight: Made striking late headway in good company at Sandown (7f, good) last August and duly had no problems when making all at 4-9 in a maiden at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) last month on second outing; clear bottom of these on ratings but could still prove capable of a lot better.

3:15.race_name: BetGoodwin Height Of Fashion Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
3:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +5yds and 2.05, 3.15, 3.45 & 4.20 +3yds)

runners.name: Janey Mackers
runners.comment: Chance may depend on what the weather does; showed her biggest promise on soft
runners.spotlight: Gained her emphatic 2yo success on soft ground and failed to confirm that promise in Newmarket Listed event under faster conditions (good to firm) on reappearance; chance may depend on what the weather does.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We always regarded Janey Mackers quite a bit, but it was really eyecatching. It's the race I started Wonderful Tonight in and she finished third. You can't get too carried away, but that's her last run of the season and she'll have to be entered in the nice middle-distance races next year. I'm not sure we'll enter in the 1,000 Guineas but I'm pretty sure she'll be entered in the Diane and the Oaks. I've had a lot of success with the sire New Bay and she was good from day one at the sales - David Menuisier, trainer.

runners.name: Manila Thriller
runners.comment: Has the worst chance at the weights and also has stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Exposed filly who has registered her wins in 7f seller and 1m handicap; has the worst chance at the weights in this hotter company and also has stamina to prove back up in distance.

quotes.race: Chester Selling Stakes (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Manila Thriller is a nice, big filly who was green first time out like some of mine can be, but we felt she could improve. It was a really nice pot and it was better than winning any novice. On a more conventional track she'll have a bit more speed, but she should hopefully be a nice filly to win a couple of novices with - Jack Channon, trainer.

runners.name: Music Piece
runners.comment: Ran well at Sandown on reappearance, despite the race not panning out favourably
runners.spotlight: Promise on soft ground last September featured a Haydock win; ran well on bare figures at Sandown (1m2f, good) on reappearance, despite the race not panning out favourably (winner dictated); remains of interest.

runners.name: Never Let Go
runners.comment: Sound efforts in handicaps this term; faces a stiffer task on these terms
runners.spotlight: Sound efforts in handicaps at Wetherby (7f) and Haydock (1m) this season, taking form figures to 6132; however, faces a stiffer assignment on these terms upped in distance/class.

runners.name: Perfect Your Craft
runners.comment: Successful at Salisbury in sole 2yo start; brings potential and looks interesting
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in 2yo novice event at Salisbury (1m, heavy; edged ahead close home) that her trainer has won several times, most notably with high-class Bluestocking; brings potential and looks interesting.

stable_tour.quote: She's done well over the winter and will probably go for a trial. The ground will be important as she wants a bit of juice. Her win on her debut at Salisbury came on heavy and she learned plenty that day. She'll stay very well. 28-04-25

runners.name: Queen Of Thieves
runners.comment: Perhaps best to forgive latest effort; this sister to Cracksman retains potential
runners.spotlight: Finished last of seven in the Cheshire Oaks but was perhaps feeling the effects of a busy spell (that was her third start in just under four weeks); scored by a wide margin at Yarmouth (11.5f, good to firm) the time before and this sister to Cracksman retains potential.

quotes.race: Weekend Winners On Sky Sports Racing Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Queen Of Thieves is learning and has progressed a lot since Newbury. I don't see the point in handicapping fillies like her, so we might be bold and have a crack at something like the Cheshire Oaks. Hopefully we might run into a place because she stays well. She tries and she's genuine, which is half the battle, and we've had luck getting fillies placed in the race who stay well - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Rhapsody
runners.comment: Form of her 2yo win has plenty of substance; should step up on AW reappearance effort
runners.spotlight: Posted a very solid win at Yarmouth (good to soft) in sole 2yo start, the next two home being subsequent dual scorers (including in Nell Gwyn); could have done with stronger pace in AW event (again over 1m) on reappearance; this Ghaiyyath filly commands respect with progress still likely.

runners.name: Star Of Light
runners.comment: Has carried head high in both runs this term; first-time headgear may help
runners.spotlight: Stablemate of Queen Of Thieves; recorded an AW success in sole 2yo outing; has carried head high and failed to make the expected progress in two runs this term; however, first-time headgear may prove beneficial.

runners.name: Trad Jazz
runners.comment: Comfortably held last time but was 2-2 previously and may do better still
runners.spotlight: Comfortably held in similar event at Newmarket (1m2f) on 1,000 Guineas day; however, she was 2-2 previously (both wins on Kempton AW) and is in excellent hands so may do better still; not written off.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission "Confined" Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Trad Jazz would run well. We don't turn the screw on these 2yos at home and we're learning as we go along this season with it being our first year, so a lot of that was natural ability, and she was professional. She's appreciated the surface and the mile. What she's beat I don't know, but it was a nice performance. We're treating the juveniles as 3yo types. They're horses for the future, so every run is progressive. She's going to come on a lot for that run - James Owen, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly who won on her debut at Kempton. I was going to run her at the back end in a Newmarket Listed race but she just wasn't quite right, so we decided to give her a break and she's done very well back at the stud. She's from a real staying family and I think she can make up into a really nice three-year-old. 01-01-25

runners.name: Victoria Harbour
runners.comment: Game winner at Wetherby last time; bred to do much better still; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Recorded a game front-running success at Wetherby (1m2f, good to firm) four weeks ago, building on her debut effort; bred to do much better still, being from a good family that has served her connections well; one to consider.

quotes.race: Vertu Mazda York Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Karl [Burke, trainer] said to jump out and to sit wherever Victoria Harbour is travelling. I landed in front and thought I'd sit there and try to control the pace. She was tough in front and did it well - Pierre-Louis Jamin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

4:20.race_name: Darley British EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
4:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +5yds and 2.05, 3.15, 3.45 & 4.20 +3yds)

runners.name: Thankyou Baroness
runners.comment: Faces a difficult task off top weight on 4yo reappearance
runners.spotlight: Sole older runner in the field; showed some promise on AW last autumn but this looks a difficult task off top weight on 4yo reappearance; handicaps are likely to be more suitable shortly.

runners.name: Stateira
runners.comment: AW form has substance; again incurs a penalty but can't be dismissed
runners.spotlight: Promise on AW comprises a win over 7f and good third over 1m; the form has substance; dam's side suggests she'll be as effective upped further in trip; again incurs a penalty but can't be dismissed.

quotes.race: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB)
quotes.quote: That was impressive. We've liked Stateira's work at home and she was very professional throughout. We managed to get a nice position from a decent draw. I was able to follow the horse in front like a piece of work and she's gone and done it quite smartly. She's a lovely big type who is built like a colt and has a great head on her and she's going to come on from that today as well - Nicola Currie, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Alibey
runners.comment: Golden Horn half-sister to two winners, out of Listed scorer; interesting debutante
runners.spotlight: Golden Horn half-sister to two winners, notably Young And Fun (7f 2yo; RPR 82); dam 1m-1m4f scorer (including Listed; 107), closely related to Gold Cup winner Courage Mon Ami; major connections; interesting debutante.

runners.name: Liberate
runners.comment: Twice-raced filly who has possibilities with further progress plausible
runners.spotlight: Good fourth, despite still seeming green, at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW; Mythical Bird second) on seasonal debut; this twice-raced filly has possibilities with further progress plausible.

runners.name: Llangynin Lass

prev_owners.owner: R K & Mrs J M R Arrowsmith

runners.comment: Brings the worst form; hood applied
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form, having been soundly beaten in both runs; fitting of hood needs to make a big difference.

runners.name: Mahogany Bay
runners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier & S E Sangster
runners.comment: Reappearance effort has worked out well; went close on AW since; leading player
runners.spotlight: Solid reappearance effort at Newmarket (1m) in a race that's worked out well; nearly opened her account in Wolverhampton event (8.5f, AW) since; leading player provided she stays this new trip.

runners.name: Mythical Bird
runners.comment: Went close in AW event on reappearance, taking record to 6322; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Hung left but went very close in Wolverhampton maiden (9.5f, AW) on seasonal debut, taking form figures to 6322; showed promise at Glorious Goodwood in sole turf attempt (debut); solid claims.

runners.name: Rose Cotton
runners.owner: Hasmonean Racing, C Fahy And Marchants
runners.comment: 39,000gns 2yo; New Bay half-sister to a Flat/hurdle winner; market helpful
runners.spotlight: 39,000gns 2yo; New Bay half-sister to 1m3f Flat (RPR 86) and 2m1f hurdle winner Polyphonic, out of French 7f-1m1f winner (including Group 3; 109); market instructive.

runners.name: Song Brocade
runners.comment: Has a useful pedigree and represents notable connections; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: Sister to Listed-placed 7f/9.4f winner Fleur De Chine (RPR 103), half-sister to Listed-placed 1m2f AW 2yo winner Empress Wu (100); dam 1m 2yo winner (89), sister to 1m4f Group 1 winner Madame Chiang; notable connections; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Empress Of All
runners.comment: Nicely bred; duly showed clear promise with close second in AW maiden; respected
runners.spotlight: Related to two middle-distance Group 1 winners for her connections; duly showed clear promise with close second in 1m2f AW maiden at Chelmsford, having started favourite; again wears hood; respected with progress on the cards.

runners.name: Lieutenant Lily
runners.comment: Close second in latest Kempton run but this looks a tougher assignment
runners.spotlight: Both outings on Kempton AW, better effort when close second over 1m3f latest; faces a tougher assignment in this field but could take another step forward; tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: I Can Imagine
runners.comment: Frame possibilities on best Irish effort; second start for new stable
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who was hindered by clipping heels and almost falling when last seen (stable debut); best effort (runner-up over 1m) gives her frame possibilities, provided the new trip is no issue.

3:45.race_name: BetGoodwin Download The App Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
3:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +5yds and 2.05, 3.15, 3.45 & 4.20 +3yds)

runners.name: Loughville
runners.comment: Better than ever this term; major rise in the weights requires better still though
runners.spotlight: Had three handicap wins in 2024 and better than ever this term when close up in a useful 1m6f handicap at Musselburgh and third of ten in 1m4f Listed race here; major rise in the weights requires better still though.

runners.name: Bluegrass

prev_owners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Pretty useful hurdling last term with this headgear; probably has a lofty Flat mark
runners.spotlight: Pretty useful in a productive hurdling campaign last term with this headgear; however, his minor honours in 1m2f Irish Group races in 2022 see him on a lofty mark for this first Flat race in 952 days.

quotes.race: PH Betts (Holdings) Ltd Silver Cup Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We might run Bluegrass in some nice handicaps on the Flat in the summer. He's fairly straightforward, he's very lazy at home. He's had a few wind operations and he runs in a tongue-tie for a reason - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

quotes.race: Robert Case Memorial Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bluegrass has a bit of class about him but I don't know if the track really suited him. It's great that he's got his head in front and he was rated high enough to be competitive in a maiden hurdle. We'll go back handicapping after that - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Bluegrass never really got into his stride last day but he can improve a bit more. He's a very relaxed horse - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's one of those Galileo colts with a lot of speed on the dam's side. She won the Commonwealth Cup and the Sprint Cup at Haydock, but he's got the Galileo stamina. He was still green when he ran in the Zetland and you'll see a more mature horse this year. He could go to the Derrinstown, and we'll take it from there. 19-04-22

runners.name: Miller Spirit
runners.comment: Tremendously progressive 2024 on Flat, notably in the mud; tailed off (good) last month
runners.spotlight: Five wins in a tremendously progressive 2024 on Flat, with the first two of those at this track (one 1m6f) and the others in the mud; tailing off at Epsom last month reinforces doubts whether good ground is his ideal.

quotes.race: Betfred Apprentices' Derby Handicap
quotes.quote: The ground is key to Miller Spirit and he loves that bit of give in it. We knew after he went well there last time that we had to come back for this. He's a nice horse but is very big, so was always going to improve from what he did last year - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: No Hurdles With Emplas Jump Jockeys Derby Handicap (For Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: It went smoothly. Tom Queally has ridden the horse and he gave me plenty of helpful tips. The plan was to get a lead, Miller Spirit kept responding well for pressure and he hit the line well - David Noonan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: French Master
runners.comment: Continued improvement when second on handicap debut at Newmarket (1m4f, good) last time
runners.spotlight: Scored last term in 1m4f novice events at Doncaster (good) in July and Kempton (AW; by 6l at 8-13) in October; continued his improvement when second of seven on handicap debut at Newmarket (1m4f, good) three weeks ago and no shock if he can carry on the good work now upped to 1m6f.

runners.name: Master Builder
runners.comment: Reappeared with a good second of 11 at Epsom last month despite his step back down to 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Progressive over 1m6f on varied ground last August-October and reappeared with a good second of 11 at Epsom last month despite a return to 1m4f; should be set for another big run.

quotes.race: Betfair Plays Different Handicap
quotes.quote: Master Builder did something really nice in the Melrose and we were quite confident that with a bit of cut in the ground, he would improve again. He switches off easily and quickly and they went very fast early on, so I wasn't too worried. You could see he was picking up the bridle and travelling better than anything else - David Menuisier, trainer.

runners.name: All In You
runners.comment: French Flat/hurdles winner; back to Flat with others seeming to have more solid claims
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced in France on Flat and over hurdles, winner twice in both spheres; 20-1 fifth of nine in handicap hurdle at Newbury (2m) in March on yard debut but back to Flat with others seeming to have more solid claims.

runners.name: Steel Tiger
runners.comment: Return to 1m6f should be fine and he's a player if the AW form is transferred
runners.spotlight: Best turf form was on heavy going, but runner-up on good and good to soft at start of career; won a 1m4f novice at Newcastle in December and by a short head in 1m6f handicap at Chelmsford in April, before another good AW run back at 1m4f recently; return to 1m6f should be fine and he's a player if the AW form is transferred.

runners.name: Anzac Day
runners.comment: Long layoff before latest start; new trip interesting for handicap debut; headgear goes on
runners.spotlight: Emphatic winner of a 1m2f maiden at Newmarket (1m2f, soft) in October 2023 on second start; belated reappearance (1m2f, AW) last month looked satisfactory, except for his rider weighing in light, and there's plenty about him and his pedigree which makes this new trip look interesting for handicap debut; headgear is also enlisted.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Anzac Day had run an encouraging first race at Goodwood and Andrew Balding said he had moved forward from that. He was out on the wing and had no cover so did well in the circumstances - James Doyle, rider.

runners.name: Ocean Of Dreams

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Second at Ascot (upped to 1m4f) two weeks ago and gave encouragement for 1m6f today
runners.spotlight: Three races for Aidan O'Brien, showing best form on debut (1m, heavy; scored impressively); three handicap runs with cheekpieces for his new connections and he was back near his best when second of ten at Ascot latest; stepped up to 1m4f that day and gave encouragement for 1m6f today.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ocean Of Dreams just needed two belts and he was gone. I was very impressed and I think he has Classic potential - Seamie Heffernan, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won at Leopardstown impressively and he's getting ready for the Ballysax. He's working lovely and he's a bit of a baby as he's only had one run. He seems a lovely horse. He has a very good pedigree - he goes back to Urban Sea. I think he's a type for a Derby trial, no doubt about that. 03-04-24

runners.name: Dancing In Paris
runners.breeder: Thierry De La Heronniere Et Al
runners.comment: Did well last spring/summer; creditable fourth 13 days ago; could make a serious impact
runners.spotlight: Did well at 1m4f-2m last spring/summer, including here, and back from 198 days off with creditable fourth at Newcastle 13 days ago; several stablemates have surged back to winning form recently and, having been 22-1 for that latest start, he too could be set to make a serious impact.

quotes.race: Stuey Weston & Friends Getting Out Handicap
quotes.quote: Dancing In Paris didn't really come down the hill at Lingfield and took a while to get going today, but he was strong at the line. It's been a long trip to get him to relax in his races and he's stayed this time. He'll need a break and we chanced our arm today - Ian Williams, trainer.

runners.name: Story Horse
runners.comment: Tenaciously made all at Newmarket (1m6f, good to firm) to make it 2-2 under Saffie Osborne
runners.spotlight: Immediately back to best with his two runs this season, tenaciously making all for a short-head win at Newmarket (1m6f, good to firm) on latest; that made it 2-2 under Saffie Osborne; 5lb higher today; big question to answer were the ground softer than good but he otherwise looks set to run well.

quotes.race: Betfred Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: The key ingredient in a racehorse is that will to win, and Story Horse has it. We tried the Cesarewitch last year and that was too far. I do think he'll get two miles dropped in though. He can run in those nice staying handicaps through the season. He likes fast ground, he had a nice weight today and the way the race worked out with the tailwind helped him too - William Knight, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Stayers Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It was a really nice, straightforward performance. Story Horse was unlucky not to win the last day as he was very impressive at Lingfield. It was nice to see him get his head in front and I had a very smooth trip round. It couldn't have been easier - Saffie Osborne, jockey.

runners.name: Torcello
runners.comment: Wins have got more infrequent; good mark if on song but this 11yo is a renowned mud lover
runners.spotlight: Often front-runner but not on last four outings; his wins have got more infrequent and the latest (2024 reappearance) was in just a three-runner race; has a good mark if on song but this 11yo is a renowned mud lover.

quotes.race: Howden Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: If we had that shower we were forecast then they would have struggled to catch Torcello but it has just dried back a bit and it is a bit tacky. I thought he was going to hang on but I'm happy with the run. He didn't run well at Doncaster as it was horrible, tacky ground that day and he didn't like it at all. He always runs well here as he likes these straight tracks. Sharp tracks like Goodwood he can't get into a rhythm but around here he can - Shaun Lycett, trainer.

quotes.race: Dawn Saunders Birthday Celebration Handicap
quotes.quote: We've been all over the country trying to get this ground for Torcello and he's a good horse when he gets it - Shaun Lycett, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys General Stud Book Online Handicap
quotes.quote: Torcello is a progressive horse and hopefully he will now get a penalty for the Old Rowley Cup - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Equine Supplements You Can Trust Handicap
quotes.quote: Torcello is by an Irish Derby winner and is related to some two-milers so it was no surprise he needed every yard - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +5yds and 2.05, 3.15, 3.45 & 4.20 +3yds)

runners.name: Xanthe
runners.comment: Ascot win on debut & ran well for 6th at Royal Ascot (Group 2) when last seen; tough mark
runners.spotlight: Mixed messages from the form of her debut win at Ascot 12 months ago (5f, good); only run out of the places late on in the Group 2 Queen Mary at Royal Ascot when last seen 339 days ago; unexposed but couldn't say she was obviously ahead of her opening mark.

runners.name: Rubys Profit
runners.comment: Looks an improved filly this year; 3lb higher than for Chester second; early pace an asset
runners.spotlight: Showed ability as a 2yo but she's an improved model in 2025, making all at Wolverhampton on her reappearance in April and then going close off an 11lb higher mark at Chester 17 days ago (both 5f); another 3lb higher today but she's on the up and her speed will remain a big asset at sharp tracks.

runners.name: Kinetic Force
runners.comment: Bolted up at Bath on return to turf in April; poor draw at Chester latest; high in weights
runners.spotlight: 2yo debut winner; fitted with a tongue tie for his return to turf at Bath last month and routed his rivals with an impressive front-running display (5f, good to firm); hit with a 12lb rise for that but a wide stall looked the bigger problem at Chester last time, using up early energy to get a good position but forced gradually wider as the race went on; this track should be more to his liking but others may have more juice in their mark.

runners.name: Carrados
runners.comment: Useful 2yo, incl here, and won well on AW return last month; headgear on for h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Promise in defeat as a 2yo, including when second in a 6f maiden at the big summer meeting here (good to firm); absent for nine months prior to a front-running success at Wolverhampton last month (5f; more impressive than the winning margin might suggest); cheekpieces added for his handicap debut; opening mark looks manageable; interesting.

runners.name: Naanas Sparkle
runners.comment: AW win last year; promising third on reappearance but others look better treated
runners.spotlight: 6f AW win as a 2yo; solid third of ten at Thirsk on his reappearance last month (5f, good to firm); others look better treated.

runners.name: Mademoiselle
runners.comment: Ended 2024 on the up but this looks a stiff mark on her return from a nine-month absence
runners.spotlight: She had threatened better prior to getting off the mark at Thirsk last summer (5f, good; made all); game effort when defying a penalty at Southwell three weeks later; hit with a 5lb rise for that and, with other pace to contend with, she looks vulnerable on her return from nine months off.

stable_tour.quote: She's a Blue Point filly owned by Amo Racing and is a really neat, sharp and strong juvenile. We've been delighted with her early work and although we'll learn a lot more about her in a couple of weeks, she's one we really like. 29-03-24

runners.name: Captain Kinsella
runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm

prev_owners.owner: Optimumracing Co Uk & Andrew P Bell

runners.comment: Two AW wins in December; valid excuses the last twice; may do better and a lively outsider
runners.spotlight: Looked a real handful when tailed off on his first two starts but he's been transformed by a gelding operation and showed useful form in winning twice on Tapeta in December; unable to give his running at Sandown last month having seen no daylight and then he was pitched in too deep at York last week; this is more realistic and he appeals as being capable of better granted a suitable set up; lively outsider.

runners.name: Desdemona
runners.comment: 3l defeat of Kinetic Force when last seen ten months ago; sold 11,000gns since; tough task
runners.spotlight: Improved with each run for Tom Clover last year, getting off the mark with a front-running 3l defeat of Kinetic Force at Lingfield (5f, good to firm; tongue tied first time); sold for 11,000gns last September; in a hot race on her stable debut.

runners.name: Cressida Wildes
runners.comment: Good second at Yarmouth latest (new visor) but 3lb higher against better opposition today
runners.spotlight: Exposed filly but she ran right up to her best when second at Yarmouth ten days ago (5f, good to firm; visored first time); a 3lb rise in stronger company would seem likely to find her out though.

runners.name: Rock Hunter
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & Lds Bloodstock

prev_owners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & D De Souza

runners.comment: Promising early 2yo but form has levelled off; better than result both AW runs this year
runners.spotlight: Looked promising early last season but his progress has levelled off now; both AW runs this year suggest he retains ability though and returning to 5f should suit.

runners.name: Star Chorus
runners.comment: 5f AW win in January but fluffed the start and never featured at Sandown last month
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the sixth attempt when landing a 5f handicap at Southwell in January; missed the break and never featured at Sandown four weeks ago; dropped 4lb but this might prove too competitive.

runners.name: Miss Show Down
runners.comment: Finished with a flourish to win a Bath nursery last September; type to progress further
runners.spotlight: Her two standout efforts last season came at Bath, notably when finishing with a real flourish to land a 5f nursery (good) when last seen in September; that form looks solid and a 4lb rise shouldn't be beyond her this year; the suitability of this sharper track has to be taken on trust but there could be a lot of pace on and she's more interesting than many.

stable_tour.quote: She was progressive last year and ended her season by winning at Bath over five furlongs. She'll want quick ground. 17-04-25

runners.name: Walnut
runners.comment: Two AW runs, making all at Chelmsford last month (5f); unexposed but other pace on show
runners.spotlight: Promising debut (6f, AW) in March when he was too free early on; put that experience to good use when making all at Chelmsford last month (5f) and the runner-up gives the form a solid look; unexposed but there will be much more early pace to deal with in this field.

2:35.race_name: James Reid 60th Birthday EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
2:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 1.30 +5yds and 2.05, 3.15, 3.45 & 4.20 +3yds)

runners.name: Blue Nguru
runners.comment: Blue Point filly; sibling to two winners, out of a 6f 2yo scorer; likely type
runners.spotlight: Blue Point filly; sibling to US 1m turf winner Rastafara (including stakes) and 7f 2yo winner Spirit Of Nguru (RPR 95); dam Listed-placed 6f 2yo scorer (98); looks a likely type.

runners.name: Coming Attraction
runners.comment: 340,000gns yearling; by Dark Angel out of a 5f 2yo Listed scorer; potentially useful
runners.spotlight: 340,000gns yearling; by Dark Angel; sister to 7f winner Bua (RPR 104), out of 5f 2yo winner (including Listed; 104); major stable; this newcomer looks potentially useful.

runners.name: Ealhswith
runners.comment: From a family that has served her connections well; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Ardad half-sister to Listed-placed 1m4f/1m6f AW winner Pappano (RPR 99), out of 1m 2yo winner (75); from a family that has served her connections well; possibilities.

runners.name: Indigo Dawn
runners.comment: 75,000gns 2yo; by Nando Parrado; major connections; interesting debutante
runners.spotlight: 10,000euros then resold Â£16,000 yearling, 75,000gns 2yo; Nando Parrado half-sister to Italian 1m-1m4f winner Scatola Chiusa (including 2yo), out of maiden (RPR 44) half-sister to Group-placed 6f 2yo winner Unlit; major connections; interesting debutante.

runners.name: Lady Cassien
runners.comment: Shaped nicely, running-on third, in 5f contest at Southwell; sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Kodiac filly who shaped nicely, running-on third, in 5f AW contest at Southwell; sets just an ordinary standard but could well record a higher figure upped to 6f with the experience under her belt; respected.

runners.name: Supreme Diamond
runners.owner: Angelica Spence, A D Spence & I Madueke
runners.comment: Could go well in this scenario on second start; sire won the Richmond over C&D
runners.spotlight: From the first crop of Supremacy, who won the 2020 Richmond Stakes over C&D for this stable; recorded a modest RPR over 5f at Ascot but may do much better in this scenario with the outing under her belt.

3:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.8) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 4.40 +28yds)

runners.name: Starlust
runners.comment: Won at the Breeders' Cup; carries 5lb penalty but leading claims if at the top of his game
runners.spotlight: Two wins at York (5f, good to soft) last year before fine third in the Group 1 Nunthorpe there (5f, good to firm) and he won the Grade 1 Breeders' Cup Turf Sprint (5f, firm) in November; lacks a recent run and carries a 5lb penalty but holds leading claims if returning at the top of his game.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Sprint (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Starlust is used to five furlongs where they blaze away and he'll probably go back to that trip - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: Prevagen Breeders' Cup Turf Sprint (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Starlust is a really tough horse and that shone through. He's not had a break all year and has been at it since Dubai in March. He had a tough trip in the Abbaye but today he was very good. Rossa gets better by the month and today he was at his very best - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: Coolmore Wootton Bassett Nunthorpe Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Starlust loves it here - it's a good place to enjoy it! I don't know what we'll do next, he's in the Flying Five, but he's run a terrific race and I'm really pleased with him. He's a big horse and he's going to get bigger and stronger as he gets older so there's plenty to look forward to - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: John Smith's City Walls Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was very pleasing - Starlust seems to enjoy the track. Everything went very smoothly and we're very happy with that performance. He seems to be getting quicker as he gets older and is turning into a real professional sprinter. I'll leave it to Ralph (Beckett), but I'm sure he's earned his place in the Nunthorpe if they wish to go there - Hector Crouch, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Daily Handicap
quotes.quote: My biggest problem was getting Starlust to travel in the first two furlongs, but once he got into his proper stride I was then taking him back at the two-furlong pole as he was full of running. There was plenty left in the tank and he's got loads of ability. I imagine Ralph [Beckett, trainer] dropped him back to five just to sharpen him up for Ascot and that'll do him the world of good confidence-wise. He's got bundles of speed and put a decent field to bed easily - Rossa Ryan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission Sirenia Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It's always nice to win a Group race. This wasn't my idea, it was Jim Hay's racing manager Alex Cole. It was his suggestion to run here and he was bang on. Starlust is entered in the Group 2 Mill Reef Stakes on September 23. That race comes quite quick, but we'll see - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (for horses In Bands B, C And D) (Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Rossa (Ryan, jockey) was confident Starlust would leave his debut run behind. He showed plenty of pace and relaxed well, I wouldn't be looking beyond 6f for now - Hector Crouch, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

stable_tour.quote: They went a furious pace in the Breeders' Cup Sprint and that really helps him. That's the way he likes being ridden and he was too close to the pace in Hong Kong. He had a nice break, is training well and I'm pretty optimistic about him. His early season targets are the Temple Stakes and then the King Charles III at Royal Ascot. 28-04-25

runners.name: American Affair
runners.comment: 2-2 this year and this highly progressive 5yo could take the rise in grade in his stride
runners.spotlight: 2-2 this season with 5f handicap wins at Musselburgh (good to soft) and York (good to firm); did it nicely in a big field last week and this highly progressive 5yo could take the rise in grade in his stride.

quotes.race: Lindum York Handicap
quotes.quote: It's probably American Affair's last go in a handicap. He's done nothing but improve and started off last year in the mid-70s, but the more racing he's had the sharper he's got. He just shuts down when he hits the front and is still quite raw. Jim said we'd learn a lot more about him today as there's no easy five-furlong race here. He's proved he's up to going to the next level - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Scottish Sprint Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We probably have to go into Group races. There's the King Charles over five furlongs at Ascot, which would be okay. I don't think we'll go to Newmarket but American Affair is a good horse and he's maturing - Jim Goldie, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Portland (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: American Affair has done nothing but improve all year. Jim Goldie is some trainer. The last couple of races he's been running with the choke out and not really finishing. Jim said today to ride him ice cold, I got him to switch off and he finished really well. What will he be like next year with another winter on his back? He's still very babyish and raw - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet For The Fans Handicap
quotes.quote: American Affair is a homebred and as he came off the box, I said to him, 'Your granny [Class Wan] won here' and we've had a few generations of this breed. From where he was drawn [13], Paul got the rail and kind of bossed it - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: American Affair is a work in progress but the uphill finish and the step up to seven played to his strengths. He's a big horse and there should be a lot more to come from him - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's very talented. We hoped he would bounce back the way he did at Musselburgh and he'll improve for it. We're excited. He'll probably go to York for a 5f handicap next but I've put him in the Temple Stakes and the King Charles at Royal Ascot. We'll probably stick to 5f at the moment. I think he's up to that class over five and he's a simpler ride over that trip. He appears very fast and seems to be comfortable at that pace. 07-05-25

runners.name: Law Of Average
runners.breeder: K A Bartlett & J M Beever
runners.comment: Three wins last season and could still have more to offer but he takes a leap in grade
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced front-runner who won three times last season (5f, good/good to firm) and could still have more to offer; however, he takes a leap in grade on this reappearance and has bundles to find.

runners.name: Rumstar
runners.comment: Career best to win Group 3 Palace House at Newmarket and major player on the back of that
runners.spotlight: 2yo Group 3 winner in October 2022 who posted his first win since in a Listed race at Ascot (5f, soft) last October; reappeared with a career best to win the Group 3 Palace House at Newmarket (5f, good) three weeks ago and he's a major player on the back of that performance.

quotes.race: Hong Kong Jockey Club World Pool Palace House Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We have been very much looking forward to running Rumstar. It seems to have been a long time since last October, waiting for him to get back on the track. He has been in fantastic form and looking great this year. It's great to be back and great to have him back winning in this company. I think we had him where we wanted him today and I think he is a stronger horse this year. I don't weight my horses but he seems heavier than he was last year and the year before - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: BetMGM Rous Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I'm just delighted I've found a race for Rumstar to win because it's been a long time since the Cornwallis. He's not been the luckiest and had a few training issues last year. I was concerned about the ground, but that was obviously a load of rubbish! I'm chuffed for the horse and chuffed for his owner Vincent Ward, who is sitting at home not very well - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Beaten-By-A-Length Free Bet Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Rumstar had been running well in Listed company and I take exception to anyone saying he came up short and was banging his head. He could go back for a Listed race, although there are no firm plans. He's not just a two-year-old - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Twilight Calls
runners.comment: 0-13 in Group/Listed races but each-way case can be made on his best form
runners.spotlight: Beaten in Group/Listed races on last 13 runs, last time fifth to Rumstar in the Palace House; however, he may have needed that seasonal and stable debut; has twice made the frame in the Group 1 King Charles III Stakes at Royal Ascot and went close in this race in 2022; not ruled out each-way.

quotes.race: Cazoo Temple Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Twilight Calls is getting better. He loves really rattling fast ground, but you can't blame the ground today. He wasn't totally lucky in-running but take nothing away from the winner. Adam [Kirby] said the faster they go the better and I think if Wesley Ward appears at Ascot, that shouldn't be a problem. They go a million miles an hour [in the King's Stand] and hopefully it will be firm ground as well - Henry Candy, trainer.

quotes.race: Price Promise At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Falls has matured since last year and must have fast ground and five furlongs. The plan is to bring him back for the Group 3 Palace Stakes on Guineas weekend - Henry Candy, trainer.

quotes.race: Moet & Chandon Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Calls was doing too much in a small field over 6f at Leicester last time and was suited by this drop back in trip - David Probert, jockey.

runners.name: Washington Heights
runners.comment: 6f Group 3 winner; yet to hit the same heights over 5f but he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Speedy sort over 6f who won the Group 3 Abernant at that trip at Newmarket (good) last April; beaten 4l by Rumstar when fourth in the Group 3 Palace House at Newmarket (5f, good) three weeks ago, when outpaced mid-race, but this may pan out more favourably and he's not ruled out.

quotes.race: Connaught Access Flooring Abernant Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We were looking forward to running Washington Heights today and he is a horse that tries very, very hard in his races. He has run loads of good races for us and probably just been a bit unlucky here and there. He had done well over the winter and we were really looking forward to this year. He was impressive when he won in Sweden last year and we were hoping he'd outrun his odds today. Tom has given him a great ride from the front and got the job done. Kevin is a fantastic trainer of fast horses and it looks like he's bought another nice one for us. He's in the Duke of York and Greenlands in Ireland and we could look at Royal Ascot further down the line. We will see what the boss says - Cosmo Charlton, racing manager for owners Hambleton Racing.

quotes.race: Bro Park Sprint Championship (Listed Race) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: All fairness goes to Simon Turner, who runs Hambleton Racing. They've supported this meeting and had success out here before. He came up with the idea and thankfully it's paid off.
