Washington Heights is so tough and genuine, he deserved to win one like that. He's been a bit unfortunate this year. He bumped into Shaquille at the start of the year and you've seen what he's gone on to do. He's had his day in the sun today. Thankfully we had a few owners out here as well who enjoyed it. He's been at the top table in these handicaps all year, so I'm sure there's more races in him - Adam Ryan, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Scaleby Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely run at Wetherby and Washington Heights has improved for it as he's quite laid back at home and he's obviously going to come on a lot for that fitness wise too, so we were hoping today that he was going to run a big race again - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a shade unlucky at York as the ground just went against him. If it had been a bit faster, he'd have taken some pegging back. His win in the Abernant proved he was up to Group class and that last run teed him up nicely for the big sprints. 10-06-24

runners.name: Electric Storm
runners.comment: Two-time Listed winner (including here); excuse at Longchamp latest, but needs career best
runners.spotlight: 6f fillies' Listed winner here (soft) last May and placed in Group 3 races subsequently; reappeared with Listed win against fillies and mares at Bath (5f, good to firm) in April and had an excuse (high draw) when below par behind Mgheera at Longchamp two weeks ago; however, needs a career best.

quotes.race: Whitsbury Manor Stud / British EBF Lansdown Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: We kept Electric Storm in training hoping she'd improve and it looks like it's possible. She's won two Listed races on extremely quick ground and another on very heavy, so she's definitely versatile. We'll look at Group races with her now. There's a Group 3 in France in three weeks [the Prix de Saint-Georges at Longchamp] or the Temple Stakes at Haydock. We'll look at one of those and see if we can do better than last year - James Tate, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF British Stallion Studs Cecil Frail (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Electric Storm had some developmental issues as a yearling so really she didn't train as a two-year-old and only stepped up her training midsummer as a three-year-old. She's got the speed for five but she stays seven, I think six is probably her ideal trip. I think there will be further improvement there. We have three four-year-old fillies by Night Of Thunder - Cloud Cover won on All-Weather Finals day, Royal Dress won a Listed race at Goodwood a couple of weeks ago and now this filly has won a Listed race too - James Tate, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet/Breeders Backing Racing EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Electric Storm is a sweet little thing but she was very green and didn't like the kickback. I loved her attitude inside the last 150yds, she really put her neck down to the floor for me, and she's definitely something for connections to look forward to - Ray Dawson, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Mgheera
runners.owner: Lord Lloyd Webber And Arthur Mitchell

prev_owners.owner: European Bloodstock Management & Mme Marie-Christelle Lacail

runners.comment: Travelled well to win French Group 3 on stable debut; could have more to offer for yard
runners.spotlight: French Listed winner (5f, good) last June who, following a 250,000euros sale, was better than ever on her recent stable and seasonal debut at Longchamp (5f, good to soft) when winning the Group 3 Prix de Saint-Georges; travelled well and found plenty, and could have more to offer for her new yard.

quotes.race: Prix de Saint-Georges (Group 3) (3yo+) (Sprint Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's quick ground out there and Mgheera loved it. Tom Marquand rode her at home and told me not to worry, she's got the action of a real fast-ground filly. Oisin [Murphy, jockey] nailed it. I was worried she was stuck behind [fourth home] Keran and that she wasn't going anywhere, but he wheeled out and got a lovely clean trip - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.name: Shes Quality
runners.comment: Second to Rumstar in the Group 3 Palace House and she might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Prominent-racer who won a Listed race by 3l in first-time blinkers (retained since) at Tipperary (5f, good) last September and reappeared with a good second to Rumstar in the Group 3 Palace House at Newmarket (5f, good) three weeks ago; this Irish challenger might not be far away.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Abergwaun Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: She's Quality is a filly with a lot of speed. She broke okay and I was in front soon enough, but I wasn't going to break her stride in first-time blinkers. She put it to the floor today on a fast track - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: She's Quality is a filly that was different class to those today. Hopefully she can continue to progress and should do her confidence a world of good - Billy Lee, rider

runners.name: Vadream
runners.comment: Fourth in Group 1 Sprint Cup over 6f here last September but losing run is up to 18 races
runners.spotlight: Fine fourth of 16 in the Group 1 Sprint Cup here (6f, good) last September and fair third in Listed race for fillies and mares at Newmarket (6f, good) three weeks ago; rain would be in her favour but her losing run is up to 18 races and she needs to raise her game.

quotes.race: Howden Palace House Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I'd be lying if I said that I wasn't delighted by the rain. Vadream just loves it. She's a very good filly but she has to have her conditions and she got them today. I'd say (the Duke of York Stakes) is unlikely and will come a bit soon, we'll just run her where the conditions are right - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Cammidge Trophy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Vadream has always been a very talented mare but she's not the most straightforward. But she's always improved with racing, which is one thing we learned last year, and that is why we've given her a few runs on the all-weather. She loves soft ground and she loves six furlongs. She's always threatened to do something like that. She was frustrating last year, she ran too many times on quick ground - we know her a lot better this year and we'll stick to a bit of cut. She's in the all-weather championships on Friday at Newcastle, which is probably the only all-weather track where you could run her and go with a big chance. She's the sort of filly who could run again quickly so we'll look at that. Then she'll have a break and have an entry at York and possibly in Ireland. I hope we have a wet summer! - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

quotes.race: John Guest Racing Bengough Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Vadream has always been a good filly and has been a bit unlucky this year. She's run in some proper races and hit the post a few times. This has been the plan for a long time and we felt it was a real chance for her to win a Group race - winning trainer Charlie Fellowes.

stable_tour.quote: I think she's run better this year than ever. She was just beaten a head in a Group 3 at Newmarket and has run really well in the Jubilee at Royal Ascot and the July Cup. The Flying Five has always been the plan, but she'll head to the Sprint Cup first, then go to the Curragh and Longchamp for the Prix de l'Abbaye. We really want her to be at least placed in a Group 1 and if it comes up soft she can do that. 11-09-24

Readers of this column will recall I've been a huge fan of Vadream from day one and, after a good three-year-old campaign when she won the Group 3 Bengough Stakes, things were rather quiet last season when she was placed in Group company without winning. However, she loves soft ground, and this spring has been right up her street as she won on her turf debut when taking the Listed Cammidge Trophy at Doncaster. Last time out at Newmarket the ground was still on the soft side and she delivered in the Group 3 Palace House Stakes in what looked a good race. I won't run her unless there is give in the ground and she will be entered for every 5f and 6f Group race throughout the season in the hope we will get her ground as she is a 20lb better filly on soft. She is not a difficult filly to keep fit ad she likes to be busy, so you can run her at the drop of a hat. I would love to think it would be soft at Royal Ascot with either the King's Stand or the Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Stakes as potential targets. If it came up soft on the opening day she would have a huge chance in the King's Stand. 28-05-23

runners.name: Grande Marques
runners.comment: Progressive 2yo last season, going close in two Group 3 races; each-way possible
runners.spotlight: Progressive 2yo last year, concluding with a close third in a Group 3 at Ayr (6f, good to firm) and good second in a Group 3 at Newmarket (5f, good to soft) when clear in the centre group; could improve for this month's reappearance fifth at Cork and she's an each-way possible.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Rated Race
quotes.quote: Grand Marques had a good run first time at the Curragh but she was too free in her two runs after that and got caught in no-mans-land at Naas last time, so she has had excuses. She won well and will step up in grade now - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

3:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.8) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 4.40 +28yds)

runners.name: Aint Nobody
runners.comment: Creditable Group 3 third to Big Mojo on reappearance and that run can perhaps be upgraded
runners.spotlight: Won last year's Windsor Castle at Royal Ascot (5f, good to firm); reappeared with good third to Big Mojo in Group 3 there (6f, good to firm), beaten just over 1l after making a big move from last to first and that performance can perhaps be upgraded; won on good to soft on debut; not ruled out for trainer who has won two of the last five runnings.

quotes.race: Windsor Castle Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It panned out perfectly. Obviously it was such a big field you don't know what's going to happen. After going 100 yards, I was following the American horse, getting a good lead and he was always going to bring me as far as I wanted, and Ain't Nobody was tough at the finish. He's a nice horse for the future, he's only a young horse on his second run, so plenty to look forward to - Jamie Spencer, rider.

runners.name: Arizona Blaze
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Dominant in French Group 3 last month; Irish challenger entitled to considerable respect
runners.spotlight: Plenty of good 2yo form, including 6f Group 3 win at the Curragh (good) and close second in the Grade 1 Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf Sprint (5f, firm); dominant in Group 3 Prix Sigy at Chantilly (5.5f, good to soft) last month and this Irish challenger is entitled to considerable respect.

quotes.race: Prix Sigy (Group 3) (3yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We thought this race might fit Arizona Blaze's schedule. Originally we had planned to go down the Guineas route with him and we ran him over seven at Leopardstown where he probably told us at that stage he wasn't going to stay a mile. He might take in a Group 2 at Haydock first, but his main target is the Commonwealth Cup at Royal Ascot. That's the 12th race of his career and he improves with every run - Adrian Murray, trainer.

quotes.race: Horse Racing Every Friday Until 11th April Race
quotes.quote: Lovely horse. Arizona Blaze Did nothing wrong last year and it was good to see him train on, I thought he looked a picture in the paddock, he's done well physically. He was always a big horse that was going to be better at three, hopefully he does that. There's only one Guineas and if he's going to stay a mile we'll have to try. If he doesn't stay he can always drop back to 6f - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Norfolk Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Arizona Blaze has run really good. He's versatile ground-wise. Five furlongs on quick ground is probably the sharpest he would want. Really proud of him, he ran a great race - David Egan, jockey.

quotes.race: GAIN Marble Hill Stakes (In Memory Of Theresa Marnane) (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Arizona Blaze was a bit keen early but after a furlong he relaxed and he saw out the trip well. He's learning all the time and he showed a lot more speed here on this quicker ground - David Egan, rider.

quotes.race: Castle Star And Alkumait At Capital Stud Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Arizona Blaze is a very nice horse with loads of improvement and hopefully we can build on this. The further he went the better he got. We will be aiming to go to Royal Ascot and we will see where we go in the meantime. He will improve on better ground - Adrian Murray, trainer.

runners.name: Big Mojo
runners.comment: Won Ascot Group 3 on reappearance and could still have more to offer; key player
runners.spotlight: Won the Group 3 Molecomb at Goodwood (5f, good to firm) last July and continued to show strong form; reappeared with half-length win in Group 3 Commonwealth Cup Trial at Ascot (6f, good to firm); unraced on slow ground; he could do with settling better and may need a bigger performance to follow up today, but he got the job done and could still have more to offer; key player.

quotes.race: eventmasters.co.uk Commonwealth Cup Trial Stakes (Group 3) (Registered As The Pavilion Stakes)
quotes.quote: I'd think the King Charles would be more likely. Training on is always a concern if you've got a decent two-year-old, but at home Big Mojo had been showing us he had. He's been working really well against some of the older horses - Mick Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Jaeger-Lecoultre Molecomb Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It's great, Big Mojo is an exciting horse and he's improved a lot since his debut. It's a nice way to break a maiden, in a Group 3 race, and he's a pro horse. He's only going to improve. He's got a lot of speed and I like him over six as well. He's a quality horse going forward, he's strong physically but mentally he's not there yet - Silvestre de Sousa, rider.

runners.name: Candy
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mr W C Wragg
runners.comment: Fair sixth to Big Mojo at Ascot on reappearance; could improve for that run but needs to
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won two nurseries in a row last September (6f, soft/good) before Listed win at Redcar (6f, soft); showed bright speed when fair sixth to Big Mojo on reappearance in Group 3 at Ascot (6f, good to firm) and could improve for that outing, but others have more substance to their claims.

quotes.race: William Hill Two Year Old Trophy (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Candy is growing and strengthening so I don't see why he shouldn't make a three-year-old but as he's in such good form at the moment if he comes out of this race well we'll have to look to see if there's anything for him - Richard Spencer, trainer.

quotes.race: Get Home Safe With Thistle Cabs EBF Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Candy is a lovely horse with a lovely attitude. I couldn't believe how well he picked up, he really quickened - George Wood, jockey.

runners.name: Dash Dizzy
runners.comment: 3rd of 6 in Middle Park & may have needed last month's return but claims aren't compelling
runners.spotlight: He was making just his third start when good third of six in Group 1 Middle Park at Newmarket (6f, soft) last September, beaten about 5l; remains lightly raced and may have needed last month's return, when eighth to Big Mojo in Ascot Group 3 (6f, good to firm), but his claims aren't compelling.

runners.name: Kullazain
runners.comment: Third in 5f Group 3 last October; unexposed and 6f could suit but he has plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Won in fine style at Sandown (5f, soft) last September on second start and creditable effort when 4l third of 11 in Group 3 Cornwallis at Newmarket (5f, good to soft) in October; unexposed and the step up to 6f could be a positive move, but he has plenty to find with the principals.

quotes.race: Madri Excepcional EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We liked Kullazain at the sales but he was a bit of a baby. He had sore shins and he was a bit behind so we've given him time, but we learnt a bit at Ripon and he was impressive here. He'll be better next year. He likes soft ground so I suppose we could think about something like the Cornwallis or a Listed race at Chantilly at the end of October - James Tate, trainer.

runners.name: Powerful Glory
runners.comment: Not a strong Group 2 he won at Newbury last September but unbeaten record can't be knocked
runners.spotlight: Impressive on debut at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) last August and made it 2-2 in Group 2 Mill Reef at Newbury (6f, heavy); that wasn't a strong race for the grade but his unbeaten record can't be knocked; connections were responsible for star 3yo sprinter Perfect Power in 2022; chance.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Mill Reef Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I thought I was in a bit of trouble. It's not easy out there but ability can get them through most ground, and I think he's got plenty of it. Everything Powerful Glory has shown has been speed but he's big and scopey as well and, if learns to relax and race right, there's no reason why he can't get further. At home there's nothing really we have to gallop with him, so I think he's pretty smart - Oisin Orr, rider.

quotes.race: Cure Leukaemia EBF "Newcomers" Maiden Stakes (For horses which have never run) (GBB/IRE Incentive)
quotes.quote: We do like Powerful Glory. He was my favourite breeze-up horse this year and I'm just delighted Sheikh Rashid bought him. You're a bit nervous when you've got a nice one and I thought they weren't quick enough to lead him. That was grand. He's a big, scopey lad. We gave him a little flick to see if we thought Ascot would be for him but he's still on the leg, he's still weak. Fair dos to Sheikh Rashid, he said do whatever you want with him and I said I'd give him a bit of time. He's in the Mill Reef Stakes and that's his target. He might go for the 5f race at Ayr as well, he's a very fast horse - Richard Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Symbol Of Honour
runners.comment: Listed winner at Newbury last Saturday and he's in excellent hands to continue to progress
runners.spotlight: Won two conditions races in a row at Meydan (6f, good/good to firm) early this year and bounced back from lesser run at Newmarket (7f, good) to win Listed race at Newbury (6f, good to firm) last Saturday; back up in grade today but he's in excellent hands to continue to progress; contender.

quotes.race: Highclere Castle Gin Carnarvon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dropping back to six furlongs has been the making of Symbol Of Honour. Physically and mentally he's doing well but where we go now I'm not sure. He's not a horse for the Jersey Stakes [over seven furlongs] because I don't think he saw that trip out last time. He's a strong traveller and it's good to get him back on track - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Wasl Stakes Sponsored By DP World (Conditions) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Symbol Of Honour had to dig really deep. I think he probably needed the race after a bit of a layoff but I really liked that when he got headed he battled back gamely. The five and six furlong races here, when they meet the intersection and the straight course, the race really starts and we just got caught a little flat-footed there. I think he's more a horse for six-seven furlongs, he's not a horse to drop down in distance - William Buick, jockey.

runners.name: Arabian Dusk
runners.comment: Group 2 winner last July; needs to improve on what she's shown this year (Group 3/Listed)
runners.spotlight: Won Group 2 at Newmarket (6f, good) last July and creditable third in Group 1 Cheveley Park (6f, soft) on final 2yo start; respectable efforts in fillies' Group 3/Listed races on her two outings this season but she hasn't shown enough to suggest she's the one to be on today.

quotes.race: Lanwades Stud Nell Gwyn Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: James Doyle [jockey] thought Arabian Dusk was going best at the Bushes but struggled up the hill. She'll probably drop back to six furlongs - Chris Wall, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Duchess Of Cambridge Stakes (Sponsored By bet365) (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: I'm not sure the Guineas will be the right trip for Arabian Dusk but she certainly wasn't stopping at the end of the race today - in fact she was looking for a bit of company and I think she would have gone again if she had been challenged in the last 50 yards. I think we'll stick to this trip for the moment and maybe look at the Lowther Stakes at York and Cheveley Park and see what we are like over the winter. The reality is she came here today as a maiden and now she has won that race we know she has a lot of ability with a great temperament. There is every reason to think she can keep advancing as the season progresses - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

runners.name: First Instinct
runners.comment: Listed fillies' winner at Cork last month; needs another step forward but not discounted
runners.spotlight: C&D novice winner (good to soft) who made it 3-5 with Listed fillies' win at Cork (5.5f, good) this month; she needs another step forward today but is in top hands and her dam was a Group 1 winner; not discounted.

quotes.race: Goffs Irish EBF Polonia Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Mr Haggas was bullish with First Instinct and thought she had a good chance. She jumped so fast coming out of the gates that I nearly came off, but she got into her stride really quick. Billie (Lee, on Town And Country) was coming quick, but I was pulling out more. I'd be happy at today's distance - Chris Hayes, jockey.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Â£40,000 EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: First Instinct has been faultless. I was a bit worried that the ground today might just blunt her speed but she fell asleep early - which was key I think - and showed that trademark turn of foot which she showed on her first run. I think she'll be even more effective on better ground - Tom Marquand, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

1:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.8) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 4.40 +28yds)

runners.name: Thunder Wonder
runners.comment: Easily made all at Musselburgh 2 starts ago but now 9lb higher; fair 4th at Sandown latest
runners.spotlight: Good-ground 2yo winner who easily made all in Musselburgh handicap (1m, good to soft) last month on his second start of the season; fair fourth under penalty at Sandown (1m, good) six days later but new mark has now kicked in and he's 9lb higher than at Musselburgh; further improvement needed.

runners.name: Afentiko
runners.comment: Lacks a recent run but this Listed runner-up has William Buick on board for reappearance
runners.spotlight: Two wins from first four starts (6f/7f, good/AW) before close Listed second at Bordeaux Le Bouscat (1m, heavy) last October; well beaten in Newbury Group 3 (7f, heavy) later that month and absent since; however, not written off with William Buick booked on his reappearance.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka, The Wonder Of Asia Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I felt Afentiko was a bit clumsy. I wanted to keep it fairly simple, he's a horse that is going to need plenty of time. He's going to be a seven furlong horse, he's got one of the biggest strides of a two-year-old that I've ever seen, or ever ridden. He's a lovely ride but just very babyish - Finley Marsh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Teroomm
runners.comment: 2 wins from his 3 starts; could have lots more to offer; one to consider on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Built upon the promise of sole 2yo run to win at Bath (1m, good to firm) last month and he followed up in a novice at Thirsk (1m, good to firm) where he came clear with a useful prospect; he could have lots more to offer for his top Newmarket trainer and is one to consider on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: His only run last year was promising and I liked the way he won at Bath on his return from a potentially tricky draw. We'll probably run him under a penalty and go from there but he could develop into a horse for something like the Britannia. 11-04-25

runners.name: King Casper
runners.breeder: Mount Coote Stud And Anthony Warrender
runners.comment: Won by 3l on handicap/seasonal debut at Newmarket and a 9lb rise may not stop him
runners.spotlight: Won here (7f, good to firm) last August on second start before a lesser run here (1m, good to soft) in September; displayed major improvement to make virtually all and win by 3l on last month's handicap and seasonal debut at Newmarket (1m, good) and a 9lb rise may not stop him today.

quotes.race: Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: We're thinking of the Britannia Handicap after that. King Casper got stuck in the mud at Haydock last year and we knew he was better than that - Chris Robertson, syndicate member.

stable_tour.quote: He's potentially a really progressive colt. His work has been really pleasing and he's filled into himself. I'd be hopeful he might make up into a Britannia horse. 09-04-25

runners.name: Sex On Fire
runners.comment: Won over C&D last month and also ran really well here last season; interesting
runners.spotlight: Went close on nursery debut here (6f, good) last July, which generated his best 2yo RPR, and he won over this C&D (good) in a first-time visor (retained since) last month; not beaten far when sixth of nine at Chester latest and the return to Haydock could be a major positive; interesting.

runners.name: Humam
runners.comment: Two-time AW winner; only sixth on good to firm at Ascot latest; may want slower ground
runners.spotlight: Promise on soft last autumn on first two starts; two AW wins since (7f/6f) and he may be suited by the step up to 1m but he's hard to fancy based on his recent sixth at Ascot (7f, good to firm); perhaps he needs slower ground.

runners.name: Transparent
runners.comment: 3l second to King Casper at Newmarket and now 7lb better off; faded at Goodwood yesterday
runners.spotlight: Two AW novice wins from first three starts (7f/1m) and again ran well when 3l second of ten to King Casper on last month's turf and handicap debut at Newmarket (1m, good); however, he faded into fifth of eight at Goodwood (1m) yesterday, with Fort George in second.

runners.name: Dixieland Blues
runners.breeder: Salabi Racing & Scea Ecurie De Montlehuc
runners.comment: AW novice winner; attractive pedigree provides hope he'll progress; possible contender
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first two starts (1m, AW) before winning a Southwell novice (1m, AW) last month; begins handicap life on a fair mark and his attractive pedigree provides hope that he'll progress; possible contender.

runners.name: Tilted Kilt
runners.breeder: Sun Bloodstock S A R L
runners.comment: Fair efforts this season but needs something extra to land this competitive handicap
runners.spotlight: Fair efforts in three handicaps this season (1m/1m2f, AW/good) but now 0-7 since winning on his debut last June and needs something extra if he's to land this competitive handicap.

runners.name: Fort George
runners.breeder: K A Bartlett & J M Beever
runners.comment: Won seasonal debut at Newmarket; got going too late when close at Goodwood yesterday
runners.spotlight: Gelded and returned with 1l win on handicap debut at Newmarket (1m, good) three weeks ago; came from the back of the field, for which he maybe deserves extra credit; respected up 5lb but he got going too late when beaten a neck at Goodwood (1m, good; 11-8 favourite) yesterday.

quotes.race: Betfred "The Classic Bookmaker" Handicap
quotes.quote: Fort George has shown the benefit of being gelded and got the job done today. He finished off well but if it ain't broke, don't fix it so we'll be sticking to the mile with him - Alex Cole, racing manager to Fitri Hay.

runners.name: Bowen Island
runners.comment: Off the mark at Beverley last month; just 2lb higher but this is a tougher assignment
runners.spotlight: Has often run well in defeat and he got off the mark at the seventh attempt when upped to 7.4f in Beverley handicap (good) last month; just 2lb higher today but that was a narrow win a small field and he needs another step forward in this hotter race.

runners.name: City Of God
runners.comment: 2nd in AW handicaps the last twice; those were small fields but form is working out nicely
runners.spotlight: Won at Southwell (1m, AW) in January on second start and runner-up in small-field AW handicaps the next twice (7f/1m; 5-4 each time); now 5lb higher and has been thrust into a hot race for his turf debut but his handicap form is working out very nicely; could go well for top northern yard.

runners.name: Our Mighty Mo
runners.comment: 7f nursery winner here; close fourth at Chester last time but he looks exposed
runners.spotlight: Prominent-racer who won nurseries at Hamilton (6f, heavy) and here (7f, soft) last September and he was a close fourth off this mark at Chester (7.5f, good) last time; however, he looks exposed and could be vulnerable.

quotes.race: Leisure Connect WiFi Approved Suppliers 2-Y-O Series Final Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Our Mighty Mo ran a really solid race last time out at York and we thought we'd come here with a real live chance. He's strengthened up all year and he stuck at it really well - James Cowley, trainer's assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Triple Double A
runners.comment: Completed hat-trick before good second at Nottingham; needs to find more now up in grade
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-3 in handicaps and in this headgear combination (all 1m, good to firm) when winning at Windsor on May 5; having shot up the weights he was a good second at Nottingham (1m, good to firm) a fortnight ago and further improvement can't be ruled out, but it's necessary now up in grade.

quotes.race: Cameron Smart Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Triple Double A is a son of Mohaather and was a bit immature last season. It was good placing by Hugo. He'll get a mile and a quarter, and a mile on a sharp, turning track like this was always going to expose his babyish antics, but he's getting it together - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

2:25.race_name: Betfred 'Nifty 50' British EBF Hedge Of Oak Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
2:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.8) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 4.40 +28yds)

runners.name: Ambiente Amigo
runners.comment: Listed win in April; couldn't live with See The Fire in York Group 2 since; this is easier
runners.spotlight: Her form has improved a notch this season, building on reappearance second in a warm handicap at Kempton (1m3f, AW) with a half-length win in Listed race at Nottingham (1m2f, good to firm; Francophone fourth); couldn't live with See The Fire in a York Group 2 last week but should find this a bit easier.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Nottinghamshire Oaks Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: This was the right race for Ambiente Amigo and it's great to pick up some more black type ? she'll be a broodmare down the line. We can have some good fun with her this season. If she's fine and hasn't lost too much weight, I wouldn't be frightened to run her again this weekend - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Amigo is a lovely filly and did well on the Flat. I hold her in high regard and she did it the right way while learning on the job. We'll probably go for something low key with her next time but we'll assess our options. We have a few juveniles who have won and are going down a similar route but it's a nice problem to have - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow @attheraces On Twitter EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C & D) (Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Amigo has come on leaps and bounds and the team has done a great job in keeping her relaxed. She has some lofty entries in the autumn and I'd imagine she'll step up in class next. She was a little keen early and we didn't go overly quick, so for her to pick up and quicken like she did was quite impressive - Hector Crouch, jockey.

runners.name: Diamond Rain
runners.comment: Listed winner at 3; has had only four runs, so there could be better to come this year
runners.spotlight: Won her first two starts last May, latterly a 1m2f Newbury Listed race on good; disappointed in the Ribblesdale at Royal Ascot (1m4f, good to firm) the following month but got her career back on track when fourth in 1m2f Doncaster Listed event (soft) in November; returns as a lightly raced filly from a top yard, who probably has more to offer.

quotes.race: Haras De Bouquetot Fillies' Trial Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely performance. It was a slightly messy race but Diamond Rain did get a lead which was nice and she's stepped up again. This is more of her trip and she doesn't feel like she's anywhere near the finished article. She has a few options and we'll see where she goes next - William Buick, jockey.

runners.name: Francophone
runners.comment: Listed winner last May; could be sharper for reappearance run behind Ambiente Amigo
runners.spotlight: Listed winner at Goodwood (1m2f, good) last May; respectable fourth of six to Ambiente Amigo on 1m2f Nottingham reappearance (good to firm) 25 days ago and she's 3lb better off at the weights with James Owen's filly; thereabouts for last year's winning connections.

quotes.race: William Hill Height Of Fashion Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: It was a bit of a gamble running Francophone back so quickly but she had come out of it in such good form that we took the chance and I'm delighted it's come off. It looked a good opportunity to get some bold black type and it's been a good week for the family as her aunt Madame Ambassador won a Listed race at Ayr on Wednesday. Whether she now steps up to a mile and a half for the Ribblesdale at Royal Ascot we'll have to see - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At Planet Sport Bet Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Francophone was impressive first time out, should have won second time at Goodwood - or got it in the stewards' room - and was a bit inexperienced at Doncaster. She's a huge filly and we put her away for the year. Hopefully that's going to pay off this year because I'd like to think she'll be back in black type company at some point soon - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Place Of Safety
runners.comment: Lightly raced filly from leading yard who was placed at Listed/Group 3 level last year
runners.spotlight: Placed at Listed/Group 3 level last year; disappointed in Newmarket Group 3 on final outing but has had only five starts and could resume her progress for her top stable in 2025.

runners.name: Running Lion
runners.comment: May have needed reappearance and is the potential class act in this if back near her best
runners.spotlight: Won Group 2 Duke of Cambridge at 2024 Royal Ascot (1m, good to firm) and ended her 4yo campaign with second to stablemate Friendly Soul in the Group 1 Prix de l'Opera at Longchamp (1m2f, very soft); shaped as if needing the run when well-held fifth (Secret Satire fourth) in Newmarket Group 2 on reappearance and a potential class act here if back to anywhere near her best.

quotes.race: Duke Of Cambridge Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Running Lion has been unlucky. Moves a bit soon in the Dahlia Stakes at Newmarket, gets boxed in at Epsom. We did decide, third time, Oisin, do what you want. He's drawn 11, go to the front, control it. It was perfect, because we got in a muddle in the last two races - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Upavon Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Running Lion had a bad experience in both the Oaks and French Oaks, when she got sunstroke and the wobbles. I haven't trained her hard for this and she's run a lovely race. I think we've got something to build on now - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Pretty Polly Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: It will be very interesting with Running Lion if she's more Prix de Diane (French Oaks) or if she's an Oaks mile-and-a-half filly. We'll have to give that a bit of thought. It's lovely to have a filly like this. It's testing ground out there and they've got to be able to handle it. Full marks for her doing it so well. The jockey's first reaction was to possibly stay at a mile and a quarter - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a nice performance. I thought Running Lion showed a great attitude and we'd be happy at a mile for the moment Oisin said, but a mile and a quarter would be no problem in the future. We're delighted with her and she's tough and genuine. We don't have to go anywhere in a hurry; we'll see how she is in the next couple of weeks and take it from there - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Sea Just In Time
runners.comment: Well held on all three attempts at Listed level, including for new yard 22 days ago
runners.spotlight: Maiden (1m2f) and novice (1m4f) winner for William Haggas last year but well held at Listed level for a third time when eighth on 1m4f Goodwood return for new yard 22 days ago; needs to have come on a lot in a short time.

quotes.race: Darley Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was nice. I thought Sea Just In Time did that well. We always thought she was nice and is well-rated, being a sister to Truthful and we had the older sister as well (Sea On Time) who sadly injured a tendon after winning a maiden when she looked nice. There is no rush to decide where she goes next, I'll leave that to William. I think she probably needs three weeks before she runs again and we could look for a Listed contest for her. There are lots of things later in the year like the Irish Oaks. Sea Of Class was second here before going on to win a Listed race and then on to win the Irish Oaks - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: This time last year William Haggas was talking about her as his Oaks filly and when she's good, she's very good. She has two blemishes on her record as well, but on her novice wins she looks a stakes performer. The Nottinghamshire Oaks will be her first target. The Turnbull family bought her and will breed from her eventually and getting black type will be key. 14-04-25

runners.name: Secret Satire
runners.comment: Won last year's Musidora; place in front of Running Lion when fourth on Newmarket return
runners.spotlight: Headstrong sort but success in the 2024 Musidora at York shows she's very useful; led until around 1f out when fourth in 1m1f Newmarket Group 2 on reappearance, with the reopposing Running Lion in fifth; likely to be in the shake-up.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Musidora Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Andrew was very hopeful Secret Satire had come on for her last run. She looked well and Oisin was confident, actually, when we legged him up. He hopped off and was very complimentary. That last Friday in May could definitely be an option. She looks like she'll get further and was overracing in the first half-mile. She's a gorgeous filly and the further she went the better she was. She really covers the ground and had her ears pricked - Anna-Lisa Balding, wife of trainer Andrew Balding.

runners.name: Tasmania
runners.owner: Gestuet Schlenderhan Gmbh U Co Kg
runners.comment: Classy in France as a 3yo but well held in Group 1 last June and off since
runners.spotlight: Third in the 2023 Prix de Diane and ended her time in France with a clearcut win in 1m2f Listed race on soft at Compiegne in October of that year; well-held sixth in Group 1 Pretty Polly at the Curragh (1m2f, yielding to soft) last June on her first run for Sir Mark Prescott and not seen since; the betting should provide more clues as to what's expected from her this afternoon.

quotes.race: Prix de Diane Longines (Group 1) (3yo Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Tasmania will have no problem staying a mile and a half in the future, but whether she can accelerate like that on deeper ground, I'm not sure - Francis Graffard, trainer.

4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.8) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 4.40 +28yds)

runners.name: Oxford Comma
runners.comment: Does not look well treated for handicap debut but last won in tidy style; Gold Cup entry
runners.spotlight: Won novice events over 1m2f last May and 1m4f last June and showed her staying powers to add a conditions stakes over 2m2f at Pontefract in October; latter would not be the most solid form (well beaten in a Group 2 and Listed race either side) and she therefore does not look well treated on this handicap debut, but she did do it in tidy style and has Ascot Gold Cup entry.

runners.name: Align The Stars
runners.comment: Respectable 4l seventh at Newmarket latest; this third go at about 2m now looks in order
runners.spotlight: Completed a handicap hat-trick last summer (second leg at this track) and ran well in Listed event on return; flopped next time and although 4l seventh at Newmarket three weeks ago was a sizeable recovery, he needs better than that; this third attempt at about 2m now looks in order.

quotes.race: Coral Summer Handicap
quotes.quote: Jason Hart galloped Align The Stars in July last year before he'd ever run and said he'll win the Ascot Gold Cup, and we're still bang on track.   He still hasn't really raced over a relentless mile and six furlongs and I think an emphasis on stamina in the St Leger is really going to take him to the next level. It will take another step up for him to be competitive, but I have enough faith in him that it's a realistic aim.  I think back to Subjectivist at the same part of his career and he went to the Leger and it was too sharp a test for him, but then he won a Group 1 in the Prix Royal Oak as a three-year-old - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Align The Stars is a huge horse who's bred to be top-class. We probably ran him more than we wanted to last year, chasing his Book 1 bonus. I've always hoped he would be a Group horse in time and I've not seen anything today that doesn't give me that confidence. If he went to Goodwood he'd have to come back to a mile and a half and Tony [Farmer, owner] is a big York man, so the Melrose has been on the radar for a long time - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Caballo De Mar
runners.comment: Second in Chester Cup (2m2f, good); up 5lb but another extremely bold show is on its way
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with two wins and started 2025 with three more; return to turf 15 days ago was an extremely bold show to be second of 15 in the Chester Cup (2m2f, good) and, despite a 5lb rise, another looks on its way.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Chester Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Caballo De Mar has run a great race. Callum [Shepherd] said he was riding almost with one rein most the way round as he didn't really love the track, but ran a monster race. He's got his whole future ahead of him in this sphere and he'll go to Royal Ascot now. We'll take a view where as the winner's a very good horse coming off the jumps and was well-handicapped - George Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Caballo De Mar has been a slow burner but has been well placed by George (Scott, trainer). He's uncomplicated and stayed on really well. He should stay further again - Daniel Muscutt, jockey.

runners.name: Emiyn
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs Et Al
runners.comment: Best known for his exploits at Chester, admittedly last winning any race in July 2023
runners.spotlight: Often ridden by Zak Wheatley; slow starts have been interfering with what used to be a front-running role; best known for exploits at Chester, admittedly last winning any race in July 2023; ran creditably off this mark in good handicaps both starts this term, sixth in the Chester Cup last time, but he was third in this race last year and may come up a bit short once again.

quotes.race: Duke Of Westminster Supporting The Chester Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Emiyn ran a cracking race. Turning in he was travelling well and he was probably looking for a gap. He likes it round here and we'll see what there is for him back here - Declan Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Deepbridge Watergate Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Emiyn is a nice horse who always runs well in nice races round here and we knew there was a big race in him. He got a drop of rain and that played a big part of it. The softer the better for him and if it was soft ground we'd have to consider the Cesarewitch. He's had a tough race there and we'd have to see how he comes out of it - Declan Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: Sheradann
runners.comment: 0-7 in Britain; reappearance forgiven; some stablemates have surged back to winning form
runners.spotlight: Three turf wins in France; 0-7 in Britain and the most competitive of those displays came when close up on the Kempton Polytrack (2m) late last year; reappearance over 1m4f can be forgiven and several stablemates have surged back to winning form recently.

runners.name: Humble Spark
runners.comment: Stamina remains unproven beyond 1m4f and none of his turf form is near this mark
runners.spotlight: Had a good winter on AW over 1m2f-1m4f and back to form on latest start, staying on over 1m4f; badly hampered when he tried 2m on penultimate outing and he failed to prove himself at 1m6f the time before; stamina therefore remains unproven and none of his turf form is near this mark.

stable_tour.quote: What a year he's had. He was coming in the Stayers' Handicap on his last run but we were hoping to get into the 1m2f race as that's his trip, but you'd say he was a player at the 2m race. His ability to switch off is impressive, especially on the all-weather. We're hoping to get him into the Northumberland Plate, so we'll probably go back to Newcastle on Saturday. He'll probably have to go up to get into it, and if not we'll get in the Vase on the same day. He's another with stall issues but we're getting around them. He's not showing signs of diminishing. He's interesting, he's not straightforward but I don't think good horses are. We've had a lot of fun with him. He's got a good pedigree and he's getting there. 07-05-25

runners.name: Gibside
runners.comment: Won Chester Plate (2m2f, good) with a strong late bid; may well have more to offer at 2m+
runners.spotlight: Won easily at York (soft) last October when back up to 2m; better form in two of his three starts this season, bouncing back to win the Chester Plate (2m2f, good) on latest with a strong late bid from the rear; 4lb higher today but may well have more to offer at 2m+.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Get Rewarded With Ladbucks Chester Plate Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: I was supposed to be a bit handier than that but Gibside didn't come away from the stalls very well so I thought to try and be brave and to see what happens. I was stuck where I was for a long time but he crept a few places forward and turning in he came really good. He's a super horse who is really versatile - ground and trip - and a bit of a yard favourite - Duran Fentiman, jockey.

1:15.race_name: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Hell Nook Handicap
1:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.8) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 4.40 +28yds)

runners.name: No Retreat
runners.comment: Never finished out of first three in seven runs in Britain/UAE; first run for George Scott
runners.spotlight: Spells in Britain and UAE have resulted in overall form figures of 3222212; gelded since last run; interesting on first outing for George Scott.

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I do 100 per cent feel for the punters that will have backed No Retreat and the connections of him too, but we are dealing with horses. They're live animals and have a mind of their own. He'd only run once before and quickened up smartly to go and win his race. He did lug into Hollie's horse, which is when I put my stick down, and then after that he gets a wobble on and spots the winning line. He goes right to try and avoid stepping on it, and then started to go left hand down and I was mindful of the turn. It's like he got spooked by the winning line. I'm not vigorous up to the line as I'm trying to stay on the horse - I'm trying to keep the partnership intact as best as I can. You can see right on the winning line he judders to a halt. That's what got us beat tonight. When you've got a wayward horse underneath you it's virtually impossible to be in full drive as you're mindful of coming off. These happened in the most crucial strides of the race and people say I should be suspended, but horses aren't machines - James Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well over a mile at Newcastle in February but looks like a middle-distance horse to me and can hopefully win his maiden. He's entered at Leicester on Saturday and Windsor on Monday over ten furlongs and is likely to run in one of those races. He's potentially a nice horse and I wouldn't write him off just because he didn't win his debut. 25-04-24

runners.name: Blue For You
runners.comment: Disappointing at York Dante meeting but shaped well on 7f return here prior to that
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for promising third on reappearance here (7f) in April; his subsequent run at the York Dante meeting was disappointing given his good overall record at that venue, with his trainer inclined to blame the slow pace; draw not ideal and Tudhope looks elsewhere.

quotes.race: John Smith's Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Blue For You seems to like this track. We've tried him at Ascot a few times and it's never worked, but he's bounced back from a terrible run down there. It's horses for courses. He normally shows his best here. We'll do the same thing and go to Goodwood and then come back for the mile race here at the Ebor meeting - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: John Smith's Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: He's a very good horse who travelled really nicely. Blue For You got the openings today and at Ascot last time he boiled over before he got to the start - we were happy to draw a line through that. He does like it here and he'll come back here next month. He might do Goodwood in between as well - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Plusvital Handicap
quotes.quote: Ble For You got a very good ride. He just found that little bit more late on. He won at Galway last year and he might go back there for a handicap - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Claregalwayhotel.ie Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We hoped he'd run well but obviously others appeared to be in better form coming into the race. He had to improve from his first run but we were optimistic he'd handle the ground. It did look unlikely in the dip and he is still a big raw horse. He toughed it out well and has shown a good attitude and hopefully he'll be up to Stakes level - Kris Weld, assistant to Dermot Weld, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He'll run this month in preparation for York in May, which is his track. He's also run well at Goodwood, but we now know he doesn't like Ascot. He looks well and should have more life in him. 14-04-25

runners.name: Lattam
runners.comment: Useful handicapper but seems best on softer ground than he's likely to face today
runners.spotlight: Had a light campaign in 2024, bookended by fine second placings in the Lincoln at Doncaster and Balmoral at Ascot (both 1m, soft); well beaten in this year's Lincoln on reappearance, though, and it's unlikely that underfoot conditions here will be as testing as he ideally wants them.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Lattam is a horse that I was told needed to get there inside the furlong pole or maybe a whole lot later! It was a nose away from being a shocking ride - Chris Hayes, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably going to need the ground to be on the soft ground if he's to run, but he showed in the Lincoln that he's an effective horse over a straight mile in soft conditions. 10-06-24

runners.name: Thunder Roar
runners.comment: First past post in Spring Mile (demoted); held on AW since but he's better on turf
runners.spotlight: First past post in competitive Spring Mile at Doncaster (good to soft) in March but demoted due to interference; disappointing on Tapeta at Newcastle since but a much more potent force on turf; any rain is in his favour.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice horse and the form of his Salisbury debut worked out very well - he was on the opposite side to the winner there and it would have been a close-run thing if they'd both been together. He's a big horse who's improved for being given a bit of time and turned inside out, he's grown and put on so much weight. We'll find a maiden then step him up and we think an awful lot of him. 10-05-22

runners.name: Theoryofeverything
runners.comment: Useful on his day and claims if a wind op ahead of reappearance has had positive effect
runners.spotlight: Useful on his day, landing soft-ground handicaps at Hamilton (1m1f) and Ascot (1m) at the end of last summer; his 2024 campaign ended on a low note, after which he underwent wind surgery; ran well (good ground) on 2024 reappearance and he's the mount of Danny Tudhope from the yard's pair.

quotes.race: Made In Doncaster St Leger Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Theroryofeverything handled the ground well, that was the key. I won the Atalanta Stakes on his mother on soft ground and she won the QEII and was a really decent filly. Let's just hope that's not his be all and end all. He travelled well into the race after overcoming a bit of greenness early on. He's got a really good mind on him, let's hope he can build on it - Robert Havlin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He looked really good one day at Ascot last year when he was held up on soft ground. He definitely needs it slow and that will be a big factor for him. His work is probably better than it was last year. 14-04-25

runners.name: Local Hero
runners.comment: Placed on AW/turf this spring but below form at Newcastle latest
runners.spotlight: Went close at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) in March; respectable third of six back on turf at Newmarket (7f, good) at the beginning of this month but not so good back on AW at Newcastle since.

stable_tour.quote: He was right back to his best at Kempton last time, and although I'm sure we'll try him on the turf again at some stage, we'll find some proper opportunities for him on the sand in the meantime. 22-04-25

runners.name: Dashing Darcey
runners.owner: C H Mcgie & Northumbria Leisure Ltd
runners.comment: Did well over C&D for previous yard; met trouble in the Lincoln on return for new stable
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (good) for Roger Varian last summer and another fine effort over C&D when second on soft in the autumn; changed hands for 110,000gns after final 3yo start; never involved in the Lincoln at Doncaster on reappearance for new yard but he did meet trouble in running; stall 14 could make life tricky.

stable_tour.quote: He's a progressive three-year-old and appreciated stepping up to a mile at Haydock on Saturday when he won well. We'll see how he comes out of the race but that win should get him into the Britannia, which is a race that should suit him well. He might prefer a bit of ease in the ground. 9-06-24

runners.name: Kindest Nation
runners.comment: Course winner; creditable third on recent Chester reappearance and same mark today
runners.spotlight: Reacted well to a visor with 7f wins here (good to soft) and at Chester (heavy) last September; creditable third of 14 back at Chester (extended 7f, good) on reappearance 15 days ago; same mark today; firmish ground would be an unknown, while she's also yet to prove conclusively that she stays 1m.

stable_tour.quote: She really surprised me last year, not only by how much she grew given she was a small two-year-old but how she improved through the year. She likes give in the ground and we'll try to get some black type with her. She's done well from three to four, so I'm also hopeful she can win a handicap or two along the way. 09-04-25

runners.name: Great Chieftain
runners.comment: Won a competitive race at Newmarket Guineas meeting and a 6lb rise may well not stop him
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps last summer and shrugged off two disappointing efforts in 2025 when getting his head back in front at Newmarket (1m, good) three weeks ago; that was a competitive event at the Guineas meeting and a 6lb rise may well not stop him if he shows up in a similar mood.

runners.name: Empirestateofmind
runners.comment: Underwhelming strike-rate but feasibly handicapped and had an excuse back on turf latest
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming strike-rate but he's currently only 1lb higher than when edging out Thunder Roar at York (1m, soft) last autumn and had an excuse (hampered) when ninth in the Spring Mile back on turf last time.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Autumn Handicap
quotes.quote: We were getting Empirestateofmind ready for the Lincoln when he injured a hock and that put him on the back foot. We thought he'd run well in the Cambridgeshire but he was drawn in the middle and he was a bit fresh. He always needs a run. It's good to get him back. He's in the Balmoral Handicap next week and he'll run if he gets in - John Quinn, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Summer Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Empirestateofmind bumped into one at Newcastle last Saturday and he deserved that, he's so consistent. This is a very nice race to win - Ross Harmon, owner.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately he won't be able to run in the Lincoln, which he finished seventh in last year, as he needed three weeks of rest at just the wrong time. He could be out in May and he's a good handicapper when the ground gets soft. He's been a victim of his consistency over the last 18 months as his mark didn't come down even though he didn't win, but he starts now lower than he did last year and I don't imagine he's any worse, so I hope he can win a nice handicap at some stage. 20-03-24

runners.name: Storm Catcher
runners.comment: Seven AW wins but 0-9 on turf and probably best to look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner but 0-9 on turf; given a bit of a chance by the handicapper in this sphere but still tough to fancy.

runners.name: Asteverdi
runners.comment: Three wins for Alice Haynes came on softer than good, so best watched unless rain arrives
runners.spotlight: Ended her time with Alice Haynes with a win at Nottingham (1m, soft) in October; second on her 2024 return but all her best form has come on going softer than good, so possibly best watched unless it goes that way here.

runners.name: Candonomore
runners.comment: On a hat-trick after pair of Class 5 wins; this race is harder but he's not discounted
runners.spotlight: Has won 1m fast-ground handicaps at Wetherby and Leicester since being gelded; jumps from a Class 5 to Class 3 but further progress can't be discounted in his current mood.

stable_tour.quote: He's very decent and I'm happy with him. He showed promise in all his three runs last year, even though he didn't win, and he'll get a mile and probably a mile and a quarter. There will be some good races for him. 23-04-24

runners.name: Beylerbeyi
runners.comment: AW Flat win in October but well held on recent AW Flat return
runners.spotlight: Won on AW Flat at Wolverhampton (9.4f) last autumn but well held in two hurdle runs at the end of 2024 and suffered a similar fate back on AW Flat last week.

4:10.race_name: Betfred 'The Classic Bookmaker' Edge Green Handicap
4:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.8) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 4.40 +28yds)

runners.name: Don Pacifico
runners.comment: Fair fourth at Southwell last time; this unexposed colt may yet be capable of better
runners.spotlight: All five starts over 6f on AW; suffered trouble in running on handicap debut at Newcastle last month and bumped into handicap blot when fair fourth at Southwell last time; may yet be capable of better.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely performance. Don Pacifico put that experience at Wolverhampton to good use and I was very comfortable once I got him relaxed and in a rhythm. He's still inexperienced and had a look around in the straight so hopefully there's more to come- Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Station X
runners.comment: Improved form last autumn on soft/heavy ground; plenty of rain would be welcomed
runners.spotlight: Improved form when winning C&D nursery (heavy) last October and followed up at Doncaster (6f, soft); showed promise on good ground last July but plenty of rain would be welcomed ahead of this reappearance.

runners.name: Persian Spirit
runners.comment: Made it 2-3 in AW handicap this month; there's every chance she'll continue to progress
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Newbury (6f, soft) last September before lesser run at Salisbury (6f, heavy); made it 2-3 when making all in Kempton handicap (6f, AW) this month; had just a neck to spare last time but is only 2lb higher here and there's every chance she'll continue to progress.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Persian Spirit won first time at Newbury and she got a run on them there. I felt it might have flattered her a bit but she's been working well and she likes soft ground, which you're not going to get at the moment, so we thought we'd try the all-weather. She's got a lot of speed and did it the hard way, virtually making all, and it's hard for horses to do that here as they come late and nine times out of ten they mug you on the line. She was very brave - Richard Hannon, trainer.

runners.name: Maelstrom
runners.comment: 2-2 in handicaps; tougher task today but he may well have more left in the tank
runners.spotlight: Major improvement when winning by 4l on handicap/seasonal debut at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) last month and he followed up over this C&D (good) four days later; had just a neck to spare last time and is 6lb higher today, but this well-bred colt could have more left in the tank for his top yard.

runners.name: The Flying Seagull
runners.owner: Two Plus Three Two Plus Four
runners.comment: Went close on Lingfield AW last month and drawn widest when fifth at Chester since
runners.spotlight: 2yo turf winner (good) who went close in Lingfield handicap (6f, AW) last month; drawn widest when fifth in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Chester last time and not ruled out for last year's winning yard.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fun sprinter who goes round Chester well. He was probably beaten by the draw on his second start since being gelded at Southwell last month but there are more races to win with him. He had a terrible draw last time but ran perfectly well. The key thing is he's qualified to run at Lingfield on Good Friday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Dan Tucker
runners.comment: Ayr maiden winner who is consistent and goes handicapping off fair mark; could be involved
runners.spotlight: Runner-up three times from first five starts (all 6f, various ground) before winning Ayr maiden (6f, good to firm) at 1-3 this month; goes handicapping off a fair mark and this consistent sort could be involved.

runners.name: Easy Peeler
runners.comment: Returns from absence but pedigree provides optimism she'll be better than this mark
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut at Ripon (6f, good) last July then won at Catterick (6f, good to firm); close second of six on nursery debut at Ripon (6f, good) last August; absent since but returns with her stable's horses running well and her pedigree provides optimism she'll be better than this mark.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely half-sister to Apeeling and the Quinns have always liked her. She got the job done at Catterick last week despite the track not being ideal. We'll probably run her again under a penalty before possibly raising our sights. It's handy that she can start off at a low level but she's definitely got lots of potential. 02-08-24

runners.name: Bonnies Boy
runners.comment: Showed ability last year but beaten a long way on reappearance and is now 0-6
runners.spotlight: Looks to be on a competitive mark on the pick of his 2yo form; he may have needed last month's reappearance at Southwell (6f, AW) but was beaten a long way and is now 0-6; has to leave that latest run miles behind.

runners.name: Line Of Force
runners.comment: A return to form is needed but perhaps another change of scenery will revitalise him
runners.spotlight: Won Southwell novice (6f, AW) last December on first run for Joseph Parr; soundly beaten on final few starts for that yard but he's dropped down the weights and perhaps another change of scenery will revitalise him (changed hands for 10,000gns); not written off on stable debut.

runners.name: Stapleford Park
runners.comment: Down the field on reappearance but may have needed it; won on final 2yo start
runners.spotlight: Down the field at 16-1 on last month's reappearance at Southwell (7f, AW) but may have needed the run; defied wide stall to win on nursery debut at Chester (7f, good to soft) last September and Newmarket trainer has healthy record here; not written off in a first-time hood.

runners.name: Mu Mu Land
runners.comment: Won on the middle of his three 2yo starts; returns having been gelded; retains potential
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut at Beverley (5f, good) last September then went one better at Newcastle (6f, AW); a lesser run followed there in November but he returns having been gelded and retains potential; handicap debut.

runners.name: Blue Lakota
runners.comment: Three AW wins in the winter but he's failed to shine on his two outings this spring
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins in the winter (6f/5f) and on a handy mark on that form; however, he's failed to threaten at Southwell (6f, AW) and Doncaster (5f, good to firm) this spring and needs to raise his game.

runners.name: Andalprofit
runners.comment: 5l win on AW debut at Newcastle (6f); faded there next time (7f); now back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Improved form when winning by 5l on AW debut at Newcastle (6f) last month; needs to transfer that progress back to turf and he was fifth at Newcastle (7f) a fortnight ago following a 12lb rise, but he shaped as though today's return to 6f would be in his favour and he's not discounted.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Andalprofit did run okay last year but he was quite weak and just needed a lot of time. I'm surprised he won as well as he did but he is a nice horse and hopefully he can go on - Nigel Tinkler, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

6:50.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Cathedral Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Annaf
runners.comment: Smart on his day; Haydock race not run to suit latest; big chance granted pace to aim at
runners.spotlight: Smart sprinter who landed a bumper payday in Saudi Arabia last February (6.8f, good to firm); solid effort when third in a Haydock Listed event two weeks ago (7f, good to firm); key player provided they don't dawdle early.

quotes.race: Saudi National Bank 1351 Turf Sprint (Group 2) (4yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's all down to Rossa, not my training. Anaaf keeps improving and keeps surprising us. Where we go next, God knows, but he's got that invitation to Japan and we'll possibly go there. These big meetings are becoming quite a habit really. It really feels like the sky's the limit. These international wins mean so much because it really does put the yard on the map -  Mick Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: John Guest Racing Bengough Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I love everything about Annaf. He's something else and he loved getting shifted about and being taken off his racing line today. He's really thriving and you have to give it to Mick Appleby and his team. He's been on the go since the start of the year and has not missed one beat - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Portland (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Annaf has been a star to me this year. My only concern was the ground and I knew the race was going to be ridden to suit him perfectly. He's a classy horse and a lot of people are forgetting he was third in the King's Stand and I'd imagine one of those nice Group races will fall for him. To do this off topweight on ground he didn't like, took some doing - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

quotes.race: BetUK Kachy Stakes (Listed Race) (All-Weather Championships Fast-Track Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It wasn't the plan to miss the break like that with Annaf but he did it well in the end. The plan is to go straight to all-weather finals day at Newcastle, although he could be a nice horse on turf later on - Mick Appleby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Owen Burrows' yard as an unraced two-year-old and he has taken his time to get there. He won twice on the all-weather last year and ran some fine races on turf without winning, but he has really thrived on the all-weather this winter. After a break we brought him back in January at Lingfield, where he won over 6f, and he has since added to that with wins at Kempton and in the Listed Kachy Stakes at Lingfield. Clearly he has improved with age and, although he has risen to a mark of 108, there may be a little more to come and I'd hope to campaign him similarly this summer to last. Before he resumes on the grass he'll go for the 6f race at the all-weather finals meeting on Good Friday, where I hope he'll be hard to beat. 22-03-23

runners.name: Jarraaf
runners.comment: Progressive over 6f in 2024, 2nd in Group 3 when last seen; still unexposed; major player
runners.spotlight: Improved for the return to 6f last summer, comfortably winning two handicaps at Ascot before a fine second in a Group 3 (soft ground) when last seen 231 days ago; still has low mileage and should make a bold bid for last year's winning stable.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Shergar Cup Sprint (Handicap)
quotes.quote: We've always liked Jarraaf and his work has suggested that he's pretty smart. Maybe I didn't do the best job with him early on in trying to stretch him over seven. The stiff six at Ascot suits him well and he was at his best in the final furlong. We'll see what the handicapper does and we'll go from there. He's a gorgeous, big horse and hopefully we'll have him next year as well  - Owen Burrows, trainer.

runners.name: Jasour
runners.comment: Ended 2024 quietly but had a wind op during his absence; down in class and has won fresh
runners.spotlight: Group 2 winner as a 2yo; improved at three, winning an Ascot Group 3 (6f, good to soft) on his reappearance before finishing third in the Commonwealth Cup; no further progress in Group 1 company afterwards but he's had wind surgery prior to his return and this is weaker than he is accustomed to; stable won this in 2019 and 2022.

quotes.race: Commonwealth Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was a great run. I'm very pleased. Obviously the winner was impressive. Jasour just switched leads right before the line, which might have cost us second, but he's run a blinder. I'm thrilled he's going the right way. I think we are close enough to warrant a kick at the July Cup, a race in which three-year-olds have done really well in the past. That would be my first thoughts as they cross the line, and as long as he comes back ok from here, he's a horse who deserves to be in the top flight - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Commonwealth Cup Trial Stakes (Group 3) (Registered As The Pavilion Stakes)
quotes.quote: Jasour was class last year in the July Stakes, then in the Morny they split and he was in the middle and just went too free. I think he got a little bit frightened as a juvenile, so we've worked and worked and he had some precious turnout up until Christmas at home. The whole team has worked really hard to be sure that we've kept him right and Jim [Crowley, jockey] seemed to really strike a chord with him in the July Stakes, so I'm just pleased the whole plan has come off. I was a little worried the ground would be too easy for him, but that didn't seem to be a problem. The Commonwealth Cup is absolutely the plan, and the Sandy Lane would be nice. We're looking forward to seeing him on a better surface and Jim has given him a super confidence-building ride. Winning was a super bonus I wasn't entirely sure would happen - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Kingdom Of Bahrain July Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: It's the first time I'd ridden Jasour but riding him from off the pace has been the key to him - Jim Crowley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Commonwealth Cup Trial at Ascot last year and was then third at the royal meeting but didn't quite build on that. He's trained well this year and we're looking forward to seeing him back in action. We're hoping to start him in the Duke of York on May 14. 17-04-25

Right from day one he looked a little bit special. His homework suggested he was good enough to win on his debut, but he was a little unlucky there as he went down by a neck having jumped the road at Salisbury. He won next time out at Nottingham, again over 5f, but I thought he was crying out for an extra furlong on that occasion. He could have gone to Royal Ascot but he just wasn't ready. He progressed from his win to his third run in the July Stakes at Newmarket. I was positive about his chances there and he duly obliged, running out an impressive winner. We now have to decide which route to take. I am not one to waste my owner's money on lots of fancy entries, so you can tell how much I thought of him as I had given him an entry in the Gimcrack before he ran at Newmarket. But if he went to the Gimcrack he probably could not go for the Group 1 Prix Morny which is just over a week later, but if he goes to the Richmond at Goodwood on Thursday there would be the ideal time between races. So, at the moment I'm leaning towards Glorious Goodwood, but we will see how the horse is before finalising plans. 02-08-23

runners.name: Russet Gold
runners.comment: Capable at this level but looks exposed and others have stronger claims
runners.spotlight: Failed to win last year but he ran some good races in defeat, notably third at Ascot (6f, soft; Group 3) in October; finished behind Jarraaf there, however, and lacks that rival's potential.

quotes.race: Market Cross Jewellers Handicap
quotes.quote: Russet Gold is a classy horse, a half-brother to Daahyeh who I won the Albany on. He'll stay six furlongs but his quality got him through the race - David Egan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: There's no reason to think he won't keep improving with age and I'd love to place him to win a Listed race. He should be ready to start in the second half of May. 11-04-25

runners.name: Zoum Zoum
runners.comment: Improved when winning 6f handicap on soft last October; vulnerable under these conditions
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in three 7f runs as a 2yo (AW and heavy); useful over 7f last season but he produced a big personal best dropped to 6f in the autumn, gamely landing a soft-ground handicap at Doncaster off a BHA mark of 101; not so good in Listed company when last seen and 6f on good to firm might prove an insufficient test.

quotes.race: Betfred "Double Delight" British EBF Novice Stakes (Colts & Geldings) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Zoum Zoum handled conditions very well and was probably in the best place on the rail. He's very professional and is a horse that we've always liked, so it was good to see him back it up today - Joe Tuite, trainer's assistant.

stable_tour.quote: We always thought he was a giraffe rather than a racehorse and then suddenly late last summer he started showing up at home. He's going to go to the Greenham Stakes. Being a gelding, our options are limited but the Greenham and the Jersey Stakes are on his radar at this point. 15-04-24

runners.name: Adaay In Devon
runners.comment: Two Listed wins last year; not found her best so far in 2025; others are stronger
runners.spotlight: Tough filly who landed two Listed races last season; hasn't quite recaptured her best in two runs this season and this looks a hot race for the grade; apprentice unable to claim his 5lb either.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Scurry Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The second is a good horse and I thought Adaay In Devon did well to give her 3lb. I thought we might get caught in the closing stages. She's very easy to train, a good-tempered filly, and she's still growing. We could have gone to the Commonwealth Cup Royal Ascot but she'd have to run a blinder just to finish fifth or sixth. I put her in the five-furlong handicap on Friday in case she was beaten but she won't go now she's got a penalty. We'll stick to the fillies' black-type races this year but distance wise could step up to seven furlongs. I expect she'll stay in England for now but she could go abroad next year. She's more than paid for herself - Rod Millman, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C & D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The original aim was to win one of the bonuses as Adaay In Devon isn't very big. We never thought she'd win three. This was always the plan as we don't normally go to Carlisle, but she needs softer ground and there weren't many other options. Her handicap mark might be ridiculously high after that but she'll head to Goodwood later this month for a really valuable prize - James Millman, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Adaay In Devon was brilliant and all the way through she's been progressing. She stays well and liked that ground. Rod has suggested we come back here for a 100,000GBP race on September 27 - Michael Ludwell, part-owner.

stable_tour.quote: She's entered in the Stewards' Cup but will only run if it's soft ground. She's pretty versatile regarding ground but she's at her best on soft.  She's a very game horse, not overbig but she's quite powerful for her size. She's been a revelation- last season she was the only horse to win four bonuses. She made all to win a Listed race at Sandown last time and goes to York on Friday for a fillies' Group 3. 11-07-24

runners.name: Fair Angellica
runners.comment: Not found her very best so far this year; this looks too competitive
runners.spotlight: Progressive in her first two seasons, winning a Listed race in France last summer (7f, good to soft); down the field in two runs this time around and she's in deeper this time.

quotes.race: Prix Amandine (Listed Race) (3yo Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
