quotes.quote: We came here for a bit of black type and if Fair Angellica won it was only going to be a bonus. The way she shot clear on her last run at Kempton made me very concerned about the mile at Ascot, and she didn't stay. Ryan [Moore, jockey] said she could come back to six, certainly on softer ground. I've an eye on the Oak Tree [at Goodwood] but we'll see - Richard Hughes, trainer.

quotes.race: Godolphin Flying Start Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: David Egan said Fair Angellica was a bit gangly in the early stages but when she hit the rising ground she took off. That's it for this season I think and hopefully she can get some black type next year - Wendy Miller, owner.

stable_tour.quote: We're delighted with her. The ground was too quick at Glorious Goodwood and we couldn't take the chance. She was declared because there was rain forecast and it never appeared, but she seems in great form and Ryan Moore liked her when he won on her. She ran another good race when fourth in the Group 3 Sceptre Fillies' Stakes at Doncaster on Sunday. 18-09-24

runners.name: Jouncy
runners.comment: Standout 2yo effort came in a visor and on AW; looks up against it taking on useful elders
runners.spotlight: Fast-ground maiden win at Glorious Goodwood last summer; improved for the addition of a visor when finishing second of ten in an AW Group 3 last September; less good twice since and he's opposable on balance.

runners.name: Cogitate
runners.comment: 0-7 since his successful 2yo debut; drops again in grade, but he needs a bit more
runners.spotlight: 0-7 since his successful 2yo debut; not disgraced when finishing in midfield in competitive handicaps at Newbury and Newmarket (both 1m, good) since returning last month; drops again in grade but he needs a bit more.

quotes.race: R & M Electrical EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Cogitate is a beautiful looking horse, he has the size and scope and looks to have a big future ahead of him. He qualifies now for the Acomb and that could be a good step. We've won that a couple of times before with Dutch Connection and Phoenix Of Spain so that might be the route he takes.

stable_tour.quote: He wants fast ground and conditions will be key to his chance. I think a stiff mile will really suit him and he already has some decent form in the book. We were looking to get another run into him before the Britannia, but 93 is a good mark and we've decided to keep our powder dry. He bumped into a good horse in Night Raider on his comeback at Southwell but still ran well and wasn't 100 per cent wound up for that. He's done a couple of nice pieces of work recently and there should be good improvement in him. He's a horse who runs well fresh and I hope he's a Group horse. 13-06-24

He's a lovely, big colt we bought last year. He has a very good attitude and does everything we ask of him at home. He'll be a lovely horse next year but before then he should be okay as a juvenile as everything he has done on the bridle makes me think he's a useful colt. 21-06-23

runners.name: Dancing Magic
runners.comment: Showed some smart form in defeat in his younger days, but is now 0-18; best watched
runners.spotlight: Showed some smart form in defeat in his younger days, finishing fourth of eight behind Auguste Rodin in the Group 1 Vertem Futurity; runner-up three times last year, but failed to beat a rival on last month's Kempton return (7f, AW) and is now 0-18; best watched.

stable_tour.quote: He was free in the Dante and didn't switch off. That was his worst race, but he was only beaten a length and three-quarters by The Foxes in the Craven. We've put a hood on him to try to get him to settle and the Hampton Court is the plan. His form behind Auguste Rodin from last year looks okay now and that horse has shown one bad race doesn't make a bad horse. 13-06-23

runners.name: Sky Safari
runners.comment: 3-4; something to prove under the likely conditions but remains unexposed and progressive
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-4 when making a successful return from 178 days off at Kempton (1m, AW) last month; now 6lb higher and has something to prove under the likely conditions (debut win came on soft) but she remains an unexposed and progressive filly; major chance.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sky Safari has had a couple of niggles but she's always looked a nice filly. She's shown ability at home, she's a big girl but she's also got an engine as well. She showed a really good attitude inside the last furlong - James Fanshawe, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Eagle Day
runners.comment: 5-23 on the AW and just 1-12 on turf; well beaten on recent return to grass
runners.spotlight: 5-23 on the AW and just 1-12 on turf, albeit his win came over this trip on good to firm ground at Haydock last summer; still 10lb higher, though, and well beaten on his return to grass at Newbury (1m2f, good) eight days ago (did too much early).

runners.name: Finsceal Luas
runners.comment: 1-10 for Jim Bolger and should be all the better for last month's stable debut
runners.spotlight: 1-10 for Jim Bolger, the win coming in a Leopardstown maiden (1m1f, heavy) last October; looked to need the run after six months off when fifth of six on stable debut at Ascot (1m, good to firm) a fortnight ago (third has won since); should do better and holds each-way claims.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Golf And Driving Range Maiden
quotes.quote: It was a nice set up for bFinsceal Luas today, got a nice lead and she likes a bit of room. I think even going up in trip would suit her better. I said to Jim (Bolger) the last day that when I gave her a crack I don't think she liked it and I said I'd resist that today - Declan McDonogh, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Billy Mill
runners.comment: 2lb lower than when winning on turf last summer but looks much better suited by 7f
runners.spotlight: Better known as an AW performer (7-40) than turf (2-13); 2lb lower than when winning on grass at Ascot last summer and has scored once over this far on the AW, but his other eight successes have come over 7f; this may stretch him.

stable_tour.quote: He's a horse we bought from Richard Hannon. He runs mostly on the all-weather because he wouldn't handle firm ground and he wouldn't go on heavy and we've been pretty successful with him. He loves Newcastle, it's just a shame that my yard is so far away from Newcastle! We've won three races with him up there. He's just a good old horse and very genuine. 11-07-24

runners.name: Redredrobin
runners.comment: Dual course winner over 6f; ran well over 1m on her Kempton return; could make an impact
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner over 6f though has won several times over 7f elsewhere; hasn't had many goes over this far, but ran well when third of ten on this month's Kempton reappearance (1m, AW; 50-1); could make an impact if building on that.

quotes.race: betting.bet Free Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: RedRedRobin went up a lot in the handicap last year but she's been coming down lately, although she's not been running that well. She normally runs well here and it certainly helps when they can handle the track - Malcolm Saunders, trainer.

runners.name: Chourmo
runners.comment: Won four times on turf last year and he could be given a chance if returning to his best
runners.spotlight: Last three efforts (two on AW, one over hurdles) leave plenty to be desired, but he won four times over further on turf last year and could be given a chance if returning to his best with conditions likely to be in his favour.

4:45.race_name: Whitsbury Manor Stud British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)

runners.name: Ardisia
runners.comment: Twice run well since his successful Musselburgh debut including in a warm race last time
runners.spotlight: Landed a four-runner Musselburgh novice (5f, good) on last month's debut and has performed well in both outings since, including when beaten less than 2l into fourth of eight in the Lily Agnes at Chester (5f, good) 17 days ago (third has won since); leading claims, especially if he learns to break better.

runners.name: Kesta
runners.comment: Won a Brighton maiden last month; ran with credit under his penalty last time; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Stepped up from last month's promising Wolverhampton debut when winning a Brighton maiden (5f, good to firm) 11 days later (a couple of subsequent winners behind); finished a creditable fifth of 11 behind a stablemate under his penalty in a Goodwood novice (5f, good) last time (in front of two of these) and one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Army Bugler
runners.comment: Stable wouldn't be a noted source of winning 2yo newcomers
runners.spotlight: April foal by Soldier's Call; 2,000euros yearling; 30,000gns 2yo; half-brother to 6f AW 2yo winner Fiorella Princess (RPR 75); dam 6f winner (87), half-sister to 5f Group 3 winner Thunderbear, out of half-sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner Move Up; stable wouldn't be a noted source of winning 2yo newcomers.

runners.name: Proof
runners.comment: Something to like on breeding and worth a market check
runners.spotlight: April foal by Zoustar; 30,000gns yearling; half-brother to winners Spoof (prolific 5f including 2yo; RPR 101), Hey Mr (5f including 2yo; 85), Filmet (Italian 6.5f-9.5f including 2yo/AW) and Filo Boy (Italian 5f-7f including 2yo); dam placed in Italy (including 6f 2yo Listed; 90); something to like on breeding and worth a market check; holds an entry in the sales race at the Doncaster St Leger meeting.

runners.name: Sands Of Spain
runners.comment: Green when behind two of these on his Goodwood debut; should improve but will need to
runners.spotlight: 9-1 and ran green when eighth of 11 on his Goodwood debut (5f, good) this month, finishing behind two of these; should improve for the experience but will need to.

runners.name: Son Of Sarabi
runners.comment: Beaten a nose in the Brocklesby but didn't build on it at Goodwood last time
runners.spotlight: Sent off 25-1 for his debut in the Brocklesby at Doncaster (5f, good to soft) in March, but was only beaten a nose in the 17-runner field; didn't build on it when seventh of 11 in a Goodwood novice (5f, good) this month, finishing a length behind Kesta and just ahead of Sands Of Spain; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Button It
runners.comment: Would be a rare winning newcomer from the stable
runners.spotlight: February foal by Rumble Inthejungle; dam 5f 2yo winner (RPR 93), sister to Greek 6f-1m winner Touch Paper, closely related to 5.5f/7f winner Limelite, half-sister to 7f winner Swindon; would be a rare winning newcomer from the stable.

runners.name: Filly Foden
runners.comment: Runner-up in both starts and seems sure to go well again; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Beaten just over a length by Ardisia when second of four on last month's Musselburgh debut (5f, good) and is now 7lb better off; improved on that when second of ten at Thirsk (5f, good) ten days later and seems sure to go well again; tongue-tie given a go.

runners.name: Brightling
runners.comment: Not without ability in her first two starts but will still need to improve plenty
runners.spotlight: Not without ability in her first two starts over 5f at Kempton (AW) and Chepstow (good), but will need to improve plenty in order to mix it with some of these.

runners.name: Dawn Melody
runners.comment: Wouldn't be an obvious candidate on debut
runners.spotlight: March foal by Sergei Prokofiev; first foal; dam 5f AW winner (RPR 68), half-sister to 6f winner Etoile Alexander, out of 5f 2yo Listed winner from speedy family; wouldn't be an obvious candidate on debut.

runners.name: Nifty
runners.comment: Stable has its share of winning 2yo newcomers and worth a market check
runners.spotlight: February foal by Dandy Man; 16,000gns yearling; half-sister to 5f winner Messa Concertata (RPR 77); dam 1m1f winner (79), half-sister to 7f 2yo Listed winner Tigrilla, out of 1m4f winner, is granddaughter of 7f winning half-sister to leading dirt performer Twilight Agenda; stable has its share of winning 2yo newcomers and worth a market check; holds entries in a couple of sales race during the summer.

6:20.race_name: Whitsbury Manor Stud Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Adaay Dancing
runners.comment: Poor form in bumpers and over hurdles; no appeal switched to the Flat
runners.spotlight: Poor form in bumpers and over hurdles; no appeal switched to the Flat.

runners.name: Brave Guest
runners.comment: Second foal of a 6f winner (RPR 75); one of two newcomers for Jack Channon
runners.spotlight: Second foal of a 6f winner (RPR 75), herself a half-sister to two winners; apprentice-ridden on debut; one of two newcomers for Jack Channon.

runners.name: Lord Montague
runners.comment: 50,000gns half-brother to six winners out of a Listed winner; likely type on paper
runners.spotlight: 55,000gns foal, 50,000gns yearling; seventh foal; half-brother to six winners including Tapisserie (7f including Listed; RPR 102), Al Muqdad (7f; 88), Sky Blue Pink (6f 2yo; 86) and Art Fantastique (6f 2yo; 66); dam 5f 2yo winner (including Listed; 102); lots to like on paper but he has a useful standard to aim at.

runners.name: Rajeteriat
runners.comment: Off since disappointing as favourite at Beverley last July; new yard/trip/headgear today
runners.spotlight: All runs at 5f; placed on his first three starts as a 2yo but his form dipped when a strong favourite at Beverley last July (a race that looks considerably better now than it did at the time); gelded during his 322-day absence and returns for his new yard with a hood fitted; each-way shout.

runners.name: Realign
runners.comment: Placed in two hot races last summer; sets a good standard with the prospect of improvement
runners.spotlight: Chased home subsequent Dewhurst winner/2000 Guineas third Shadow Of Light on his Newmarket debut last August (6f, good); third of 17 in a red-hot York maiden three weeks later where the seventh furlong looked to stretch him; sets a high bar for his rivals to aim at and he's capable of better himself; still holds a Commonwealth Cup entry.

runners.name: Tasalla
runners.comment: Well-bred colt; promise amidst inexperience on debut; open to plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: Showed something to build on when eighth of 13 in a competitive 6f novice at Doncaster four weeks ago; tongue tie now added; bred to do much better.

runners.name: Questa Notte
runners.comment: Half-sister to two smart sprinters; stable's newcomers usually better for a run
runners.spotlight: 27,000euros foal, 80,000gns yearling; sixth foal; half-sister to top-notch sprinters Live In The Dream (Nunthorpe; RPR 120) and Live In The Moment (104); should have a future but yard's newcomers usually better for a run and she has a good standard to aim at.

runners.name: Soviet Symphony
runners.comment: Half-sister to two winners out of a minor sprint winner; perhaps a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to winners Drama (6f; RPR 95) and Sidcot Swallet (Qatar 6f); dam 5f turf 2yo/6f AW winner (75); should have a future judged on pedigree but this looks a tough starting point.

runners.name: Tryfan
runners.comment: AW winner for former yard; disappointing stable debut but should be capable of better
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent for Brian Ellison but was first and second in two 1m4f AW handicaps and left that yard for 65,000gns; gelded ahead of stable debut when tailed off in a 1m4f Class 3 at Epsom; nothing good to take out of that but he should be capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably the best three-year-old we've got in the yard. He's really good and works very well and I'll be disappointed if he doesn't get rated in the 90s. He ran once last year when he finished third at Newcastle. We've had issues with the stalls with him as he's a big horse and he gave away six lengths at the start at Newcastle but was only beaten three lengths. The winner won again, so the form is all right. He's improved loads since last year. He's ready to go. 03-04-24

runners.name: Robusto
runners.comment: Most wins and best form has been on the AW but he's rated lower on the grass
runners.spotlight: Often leads; most wins and best form has been on the AW but he has an 8lb lower turf mark to work with and only win on grass did come here two years ago.

runners.name: Junkanoo
runners.comment: Never really counted at Goodwood (1m6f) but this lower grade will help
runners.spotlight: Hurdling during the winter and returned to the Flat with close thirds in 1m3f/2m AW handicaps; never really counted at Goodwood (1m6f) but this lower grade will help.

runners.name: Grey Fox
runners.comment: Winning miler but collected by 2l over 2m on the AW in March; below par since
runners.spotlight: Running, and winning, over 1m this time last year but he collected by 2l over 2m on the Kempton AW in March; not in the same form back there a month ago but chance if on a going day (can be up and down).

runners.name: Wannabe Brave
runners.comment: Five-time 2m winner on the AW and he's not had all that many chances on turf
runners.spotlight: Has made his name on the AW, winning five times at 2m; arrives here in good nick and he's not had all that many chances on turf.

runners.name: Marioento
runners.breeder: Normandie Stud Ltd & Star Pointe Ltd
runners.comment: Seems fine on turf and didn't appear to stay 2m last time on the AW
runners.spotlight: 9.4f AW winner in February; seems fine on turf and didn't appear to stay 2m last time on the AW when tried in cheekpieces; blinkers now given a go and 1m6f might be a better fit.

runners.name: Fair Dinkum
runners.comment: Lost his way last year but his comeback run at Bath was more encouraging
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been on the Lingfield AW, at 2m and 1m5f; lost his way last year but his comeback run at Bath was more encouraging; could have a part to play.

7:50.race_name: Saunton Sands Hotel 'Confined' Handicap (For horses Which Have Not Won More Than One Race)

runners.name: Nanny Park
runners.comment: May have needed his recent Chelmsford return, but will need to step up on this turf debut
runners.spotlight: Progressive in three 1m AW novices late last year, winning at Kempton in December (second and third have won since); may have needed the run when well held on handicap debut at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) this month, but will need to step up on this first go on turf.

runners.name: Patsy Snugfit
runners.comment: 0-8; steps up in trip, but there is plenty of stamina on the dam's side; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: 0-8, but went close on a couple of occasions last summer and met all sorts of trouble on her Doncaster reappearance (1m, good) three weeks ago; steps up in trip in first-time cheekpieces, but there is plenty of stamina on the dam's side; worth a second look.

runners.name: Arcturus Flame
runners.comment: Has improved since returning in handicaps last month; should stay the longer trip
runners.spotlight: Has improved since returning in handicaps last month with cheekpieces added, winning at Nottingham (1m, good) and finishing second of ten in this headgear combination at Ascot (1m, good to firm); should stay the longer trip and high on the list.

quotes.race: Beer Festival 12th April Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Arcturus Flame was 10-1, then 14s. I didn't care what price he was, I thought he'd win. He went for a gallop with Dutch Kingdom and he came out and won a 0-90  - Darryll Holland, trainer.

runners.name: Babylon
runners.comment: Close second on handicap debut at Yarmouth last time; up 4lb but shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Has improved in each of his four starts, going down by less than a length when second of ten on handicap debut at Yarmouth (1m2f, good to firm) last month; up 4lb but remains open to further improvement and shouldn't be far away.

runners.name: Komodo Island
runners.comment: Beautifully bred so could take a step forward now handicapping; stable won this last year.
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in three novices at around 1m and was beaten a long way on his turf debut at Wetherby (good to firm) last month; bred in the purple (including being a brother to the Group 1 winner Snow Lantern) so not a surprise if he takes a big step forward now handicapping; stable won this last year.

runners.name: Arizona Rock
runners.comment: Bred to appreciate this longer trip on turf/handicap debut and not to be taken lightly
runners.spotlight: In the frame in all three starts at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) this year; bred to appreciate the longer trip on turf/handicap debut and not to be taken lightly.

runners.name: Connie Moon
runners.comment: Has shown much more in her last two starts; bred to stay well so one to consider
runners.spotlight: Has shown much more in her last two starts, as when an eyecatching sixth of 13 on her reappearance/handicap debut at Epsom (8.5f, good) last month; bred to stay well so one to consider.

runners.name: Navid
runners.comment: Out of the frame in all five outings; more needed
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in all five outings including when eighth of 14 on his reappearance/handicap debut at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW; first start since being gelded) last month; more needed.

runners.name: Wootton Palace
runners.comment: Out of the frame in three starts; bred to stay the longer trip on handicap debut; visor on
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in three starts over 7f/1m on turf/AW (gelded before latest outing); bred to stay the longer trip on handicap debut with a visor now given a go.

runners.name: Bintjan
runners.comment: Off the mark in decisive fashion at Brighton last month (only four ran); this demands more
runners.spotlight: Steady improvement across her five starts, getting off the mark last month with a 7f handicap win at Brighton (won with more authority than the neck margin suggests); can do better but such progress is a requirement.

runners.name: Key Witness
runners.comment: Green on debut but much more savvy when making all at Chelmsford last month; more to come
runners.spotlight: Too green to reward market support on his Lingfield debut (7f, AW) in March but he showed his true colours with a front-running success at Chelmsford 30 days ago (second and third have run well since); open to improvement and he's high on the list ahead of his handicap debut.

runners.name: Panama Black
runners.comment: 1m AW win in February; well held in two stronger races on turf this spring
runners.spotlight: In good form on AW over the winter, winning at 1m handicap at Southwell in February; well beaten in two runs back on turf but he's dropped 5lb and this is weaker.

runners.name: Eliza Bennet
runners.comment: Improved with each 2yo run; solid reappearance when 5th at Southwell last month; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Improved with each 2yo run, second of nine at Wolverhampton (7f) in October; made the running before weakening into fifth at Southwell on last month's handicap debut/reappearance; still has time to do better.

runners.name: Political Power

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Exposed ten-race maiden; hopes rest on the return to turf sparking something extra
runners.spotlight: Exposed ten-race maiden; came up short in two handicap runs on AW and the return to turf isn't enough to make him of interest.

runners.name: Hunky Dory
runners.comment: No improvement on h'cap debut at Newmarket this month; down in class; still early days
runners.spotlight: Always prominent when third of 13 at Kempton last September (7f, AW), his best effort to date; may come on for his Newmarket reappearance/handicap debut three weeks ago; down in grade and could yet do better.

runners.name: Gloryous
runners.comment: Best 2yo run came over C&D; not seen to best effect on AW on stable debut; contender
runners.spotlight: Her best effort for Rod Millman came over C&D last August (RPR 72); low-key stable debut at Wolverhampton 18 days ago (8.6f) but she was poorly positioned (raced freely in rear off a steady early pace) and given a considerate ride; grounds for expecting much better today.

runners.name: Kosometsuke
runners.owner: A Bintouq, C Fahy & R & S Marchant
runners.comment: Big step forward with Kempton win (7f, AW) on handicap debut; 5lb rise looks manageable
runners.spotlight: Didn't achieve a huge amount in three 6f novice runs last season; gelded prior to his seasonal/handicap debut at Kempton nine days ago and he took a good step forward upped to 7f, strong at the finish and winning with something to spare; bred to carry on improving and a 5lb rise looks manageable.

runners.name: Moby Quick
runners.comment: Has the ability to feature off this mark but looked a tricky ride at Doncaster last time
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; good efforts in two of his last three handicap runs, staying on for second at Doncaster three weeks ago (6f, good to firm; cheekpieces first time); solid form claims off the same mark back at 7f but he hasn't always looked straightforward.

runners.name: Cuban Girl
runners.comment: Always behind when 28-1 for recent seasonal/handicap debut (6f, AW); hood returns today
runners.spotlight: 28-1 and always behind on her seasonal/handicap debut at Kempton 19 days ago (6f, AW); returning to 7f can help but she will need to come on a good deal for that reappearance effort; hood returns today.

runners.name: Blue Anthem
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs M Morris, Mr & Mrs P Hopper
runners.comment: 7f AW win on handicap debut; no progress since (1m/6f); break needs to revive fortunes
runners.spotlight: Left maiden/novice form behind him when winning a 7f handicap at Wolverhampton in February; not so good twice since (1m and 6f); short break and the return to 7f need to prompt a full revival.

runners.name: Dandy G Boy
runners.comment: Didn't live up to market billing in first two handicaps; improvement needed back on turf
runners.spotlight: Failed to live up to market billing in his first two nursery runs; gelded in October and there was no immediate improvement at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day; hopes pinned on the return to turf sparking extra from him.

runners.name: Ridgeway Redwing
runners.comment: Should be better suited by handicapping but improvement needed back from ten months off
runners.spotlight: Big prices and no real impact in three runs in fillies' novice/maiden company last summer; should be capable of better in minor handicaps this season.

5:50.race_name: MPS Services Group Conditions Stakes (No More Than One Win And Not Won Class 1 Race) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Spirit Of Farhh
runners.comment: Heavy-ground maiden winner in October; flopped badly in good-ground handicap last month
runners.spotlight: Ran to useful level when ending three-race 2yo campaign with heavy-ground maiden win at Newbury (6.5f) in October but flopped badly in good-ground handicap there (7f) six weeks ago, with trainer reporting he would prefer a slower surface and the vet reporting an irregular heartbeat.

quotes.race: BetVictor Lengthen The Odds EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think it was very sticky ground, but Spirit Of Farhh is still a weak shell of a horse and I think he'll be nice for next year. The second and third favourite were up there and the form was good. I'm happy - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Stanhope Gardens
runners.comment: Close second in Newmarket Group 3 in the autumn; ought to be hard to beat here
runners.spotlight: Delivered on debut promise when eased-down winner of Beverley maiden (7.4f, good to firm) last summer and was close second to subsequent Group 1 Futurity second Delacroix in Newmarket Group 3 (1m, good to soft) in the autumn; holds multiple Group 1 entries for the season ahead and ought to be very hard to beat here.

quotes.race: New 911 EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I was very impressed with how Stanhope Gardens did it. He's learned a lot from Sandown. I thought when my lad got to the front he'd half prick his ears but actually, when I gave him a dig in the belly, he picked up and quickened. He didn't ease off the accelerator until I let him, so that was a great sign. He took a lot of pulling up after so going up another furlong will be no problem in time. It kind of amused me how much he's copped on to the job from his run the last day and I'd be disappointed if he didn't improve again - Rossa Ryan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

stable_tour.quote: He's had an awayday gallop and he goes well. He's had a 2,000 Guineas entry, but the Dante is more likely. He will get better as he goes further. It was a proper effort in the Autumn Stakes and the winner [Delacroix] has boosted the form by coming out and winning the Ballysax Stakes. The dream is the Derby and we'd all like him to land there. 28-04-25

runners.name: Stark Warning
runners.comment: Quite impressive on last summer's debut; came last in Listed race on second start
runners.spotlight: Created pretty good impression when clearcut winner of Ffos Las maiden (7.3f, soft) on debut last August but finished of eight last when upped to Listed level the following month and we haven't seen him again since; stable has much stronger claims with Stanhope Gardens.

2:45.race_name: bet365 Two Year Old Trophy EBF Conditions Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
2:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Ice Cold Alex
runners.comment: An April foal so did well to make a winning debut last month; form has been franked
runners.spotlight: An April foal so did well to make a winning debut last month at Pontefract (5f, good) and in second that day was previous-race contender Saucy Jane who has twice franked the form; certainly not dismissed.

quotes.race: Racing TV Sky Channel 424 EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: We fancied Ice Cold Alex a bit. He didn't cost much and his sire Soldier's Call isn't the most fashionable. He has a fantastic pedigree and has always worked nicely. He did the job well - Ollie Pears, trainer.

runners.name: Raakeb
runners.comment: Won at Ripon but it didn't look a strong race and the form has taken some knocks
runners.spotlight: Never far away when making a winning debut at Ripon (5f, good; 9-2) but it didn't look a strong race and the form has taken some knocks; will need more here if he's to follow up.

runners.name: Tropical Dreamer
runners.comment: Late-March foal; travelled best and kept on well to collect over C&D a month ago
runners.spotlight: Late-March foal; travelled best and kept on well to collect over C&D a month ago (good; 11-2) when Hilary Needler contender Artista was back in third; difficult to know how good he might be.

runners.name: Old Is Gold
runners.comment: Strong contender here after finishing close up behind a smart colt at Ascot
runners.spotlight: 200,000gns breeze-up buy; beaten a length at Ascot (5f, good to firm) where he only wilted late on after racing prominently; the winner is now 2-2 for Godolphin and presumably bound for Royal Ascot; strong contender.

runners.name: Naval Light
runners.comment: Bought for 360,000gns at Craven Breeze-Up Sale and similar profile to last year's winner
runners.spotlight: Bought for 360,000gns at the Craven Breeze-Up Sale in April and represents the same connections of last year's winner Shareholder, another expensive breeze-up recruit who went on to win the Norfolk at Royal Ascot; this colt is probably pretty smart.

runners.name: Straight Ahead
runners.comment: First foal out of an ordinary sprinter; surprising if he's up to this first time out
runners.spotlight: First foal out of an ordinary sprinter and half-sister to winners Opal Tiara (1m/1m1f Group 2) and Twentyfirst Lancer (bumper); surprising if he's up to this first time out.

2:10.race_name: Hilary Needler Trophy EBF Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Ali Shuffle
runners.comment: Made it 3-3 with an all-the-way success in Chester's Lily Agnes; hard to knock
runners.spotlight: All runs over 5f on good; unbeaten filly who was always holding Argentine Tango over C&D before a no-nonsense win in Chester's Lily Agnes, in which she made all from the plum draw (doesn't have to lead); hard to knock.

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Lily Agnes EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very straightforward. I know the draw is a massive advantage here, but Ali Shuffle won with a little bit in hand. She was coasting around there. She's got such a great mind. Very early on people were ringing me up for first-season sires, we've three A'Ali fillies and I said all of them will win, but she's the only one we've managed to run so far. She's probably exceeded expectations. Nick just said about the Hilary Needler, but we'll see how she is. She can go to Ascot and wouldn't disgrace herself there, that's for sure. She'll be even better over six furlongs and with a lead too, but we couldn't give up that draw today - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C & D) (EBF Qual') (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Ali Shuffle had a penalty and it's not easy to do. I felt like something was going to get me in the last 100 yards, but she's tough and very straightforward. I think the better the race, the better she'll be because she'll have something to aim at. I think she can win again. I presume it will be York next for the Marygate. That'll be up to the boss [Karl Burke], but I think she's a smart filly - Sam James, jockey.

runners.name: Angel Numbers
runners.comment: 50,000gns yearling; travelled strongly before pulling clear at Chepstow; looks useful
runners.spotlight: 50,000gns yearling; travelled strongly before pulling clear at Chepstow (good; tongue tied) 11 days ago and carried plenty of confidence in the market; clearly useful and she's well drawn here.

runners.name: Arduis Invicta
runners.comment: Disappointing at Chester but not without hope on the promise she showed first time out
runners.spotlight: Had subsequent winner Artista behind when a 40-1 runner-up over C&D but then dropped away to be 5l behind Ali Shuffle at Chester; wouldn't be without hope if tapping back into the promise of her debut effort.

runners.name: Argentine Tango
runners.comment: Pontefract winner who probably bumped into one earlier this week at Carlisle
runners.spotlight: Kept Ali Shuffle honest on her debut here before going one better at Pontefract; only second under a penalty earlier this week at Carlisle but the winner was an odds-on newcomer who looks well above average; good chance.

quotes.race: Racing TV Club Day EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Argentine Tango is as hard as nails and was very hard to break in. But she's tough and she'll improve masses. When the other horse came to her she went again. We might take her to York for the Marygate Stakes - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Artista
runners.comment: Did well to make all from a wide enough draw here last time and commands respect
runners.spotlight: Drawn wide on both her visits here but ran on well on debut and then showed bright speed to make pretty much all 11 days ago (good to firm); has a bit to find on the figures but could easily deliver another personal best.

runners.name: Meelaf
runners.comment: Musselburgh winner; others have achieved more but this filly is well regarded
runners.spotlight: 105,000gns yearling; ran below market expectations on Newmarket debut but showed her true colours when coming from last to first in a small field at Musselburgh (good); others have achieved more but this filly is well regarded.

quotes.race: EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We thought a lot of Meelaf before we went to Newmarket. She probably didn't handle the track and things just didn't go to plan. There were only a handful of runners here but I really liked the way she quickened up well and off a steady pace, I thought she did well. She's going to be a nice filly. Karl [Burke. trainer] is probably wondering which ones he'll run in the Queen Mary, but she might be better over six furlongs. The options are open - Sam James, jockey.

runners.name: Saucy Jane
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 16 And Jmr Partners
runners.comment: C&D winner who then ran a solid race in defeat in a Listed race at York
runners.spotlight: A line through the horse she beat here two runs back gives her the beating of Artista and ran a solid race in defeat at York (Listed), again showing good speed; enters the reckoning.

quotes.race: EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Band D) (EBF Rest' Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Saucy Jane had a poor draw at Pontefract and she ran respectably but her homework had been showing us she'd improved. I'm delighted for all of my team, especially Harriett [Bryce], who rides her every day and broke her in as well. She looks like a filly on the up and a nice prospect. We'll see how she gets on when she gets home but we could look at the Hilary Needler Trophy back here [May 24] or the Marygate at York next Friday. We can always dream of Ascot. She looks a nice filly and if she continues to progress there's no reason why we can't look at it - Jack Morland, trainer.

3:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Signcastle City
runners.comment: Come up just short in both races this season; entitled to be thereabouts once again
runners.spotlight: Versatile as regards ground and trip (7f/1m); might be a shade high in the weights and has come up just short in both races this season; entitled to be thereabouts once again.

runners.name: Diligent Resdev
runners.comment: Strong-travelling fifth of 17 in the Victoria Cup and this is easier
runners.spotlight: The winner of last season's Ayr Bronze Cup; made a nice reappearance at Musselburgh and looked threatening in Ascot's Victoria Cup (7f, good to firm; visor returned) until fading away late on; still finished fifth of 17 and this is easier.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: They went a nice gallop throughout, we got cover and at the three-pole I was looking around thinking 'I'm going well here.' I kept it simple, pulled Diligent Resdev out and he steamed home. He's a very quick horse with a high cruising rate and he powered through the line - Lewis Chalkey, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I don't think that was expected but Billy (Garritty, jockey) was more confident than David (Easterby, joint-trainer). Diligent Resdev did it really well, I think he was on the best part of the track but there were some very expensive horses in that race, costing the best part of half a million - Lee Westwood, part-owner.

runners.name: Roberto Caro
runners.comment: Three-time winner; last season didn't end well but he returns off a fair mark
runners.spotlight: Won two 6f handicaps (good to soft/soft) last summer and he won his maiden at this sort of trip; last season didn't end well but he returns off a fair mark.

stable_tour.quote: He's not a bad horse. He was slowly away on his debut in a novice at Windsor but ran a nice race and I hope he'll be capable of winning one of those. He had a hood on as he sweats up a little bit and we thought we'd try to give him a nice experience first time out. 12-09-23

runners.name: Billyb
runners.comment: Won this 12 months ago after needing his comeback race; ran okay at Chester
runners.spotlight: Dropped away at Chester 17 days ago but ran well to a point and he won this race 12 months ago on his second run back; 5lb higher this time but he can cope with this mark.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Billyb was quite keen when we got him. He's settled down quite a lot and he's done that well - Craig Lidster, trainer.

runners.name: Lerwick
runners.comment: Both wins over further but effective at 7f as he showed when close up at Kempton
runners.spotlight: Both wins were for his former yard and over slightly longer trips; however, he was close up in a bunched finish over this far at Kempton and that despite racing keenly with headgear removed (as is the case here); not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He showed plenty of promise last year in three runs over a mile, finishing second twice. First time out this year at Haydock, he was probably a bit fresh and finished fourth of the 14 runners over a mile, but he's much better than that. I would suggest readers keep on the right side of him as I think he's on a very decent mark. He's fine over a mile but I can see him doing all right over 1m2f. 01-06-23

runners.name: Light Speed
runners.comment: Four-time winner but his record fresh suggests this run might be needed
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner for Andrew Balding and added a Chester handicap over this far for current yard last summer (good; 2lb lower); his record fresh suggests this run might be needed.

quotes.race: Printworks Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Joanna [Mason] gave Light Speed an amazing ride. Obviously, it was a really tricky draw, but she's got a lovely split through and it was nice to see him bounce back to form. I felt that we needed to get him to run well back in trip before we stepped him back up. I thought it might have been on the sharp side for him, but I thought, given his stride length, that the track would suit him. He had a brilliant winter for Mr [Andrew] Balding and he's been in good form recently at home, so we were quite hopeful - Gemma Tutty, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Chester last year. He's a bit further behind in his prep because he didn't come back to me until late but he was looking like he had another win in him at the back end of last year off his current mark. Hopefully he can do the business when he gets back on the racetrack. 23-04-25

runners.name: Yermanthere
runners.comment: Did win last season but underwhelming in the main and this campaign hasn't started well
runners.spotlight: Did win last season but underwhelming in the main and this campaign hasn't started well; others safer.

quotes.race: Londis Roscommon Handicap
quotes.quote: Yermanthere had his conditions today and he had been working very well at home - Andrew Kinirons, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's another who has had a good break since joining us. We decided to wait for the summer with horses like him who look to be well handicapped; that's where the money and the races are. It looks as though he's a seven-furlong horse. 23-04-24

runners.name: Daring Legend
runners.comment: Won two 7f handicaps on turf last year and endured a near miss last time at Yarmouth
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps last year, two on turf over 7f; back to something approaching his best when narrowly missing out at Yarmouth ten days ago (7f, good to firm); off his last winning mark.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him from James Ferguson's yard at the end of his two-year-old season. He's had a really good year, winning three times. He was on the go early in the year, as we brought him back on the all-weather, and his latest start suggested he'd been on the go too long. He's quite a big, rangy horse for a three-year-old and we thought another winter off would do him the world of good, so he's gone on his holidays. He's A1 and we're giving him the chance to really mature and fill into his frame. We think there'll be more improvement in him as a four-year-old and he's one to look forward to next year. 26-09-24

runners.name: Vince Le Prince
runners.comment: Capable handicapper when on song but will need to run better than he has the last twice
runners.spotlight: Won three times on turf last season and reappeared with a 3l fourth at Musselburgh (7f, good); however, will need to run much better than he has the last twice.

quotes.race: Spreadex Racing In-Running Spread Betting Handicap
quotes.quote: There is quite a stiff side and head wind now, but he still picked up lovely. I know he's also won at Redcar and Catterick, but he probably has more strengthening to do and confidence to gain - Faye McManoman, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Mysteryofthesands
runners.comment: Finished best of the rest behind one who made all over Musselburgh's 7f last time
runners.spotlight: May appreciate a bit further these days but has returned in good heart over 7f, last time at Musselburgh finishing best of the rest behind one who made all; in the mix.

3:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watered)

runners.name: My Harrison George
runners.comment: Has only won at a mile but stays this far and even finished second over 1m6f last time
runners.spotlight: Has only won at a mile but stays this far and even finished second over 1m6f last time; that was his second run after a good while out so might even be sharper again here.

runners.name: Spring Chorus
runners.comment: Beaten under a penalty last time and up another 2lb, but she's on top of her game
runners.spotlight: Won easily on her stable and seasonal debut over C&D earlier this month and five days later ran well under a penalty; has another 2lb here but she's on top of her game.

runners.name: Wadacre Giorgio
runners.comment: Modest first season but he's handicapped accordingly and returns gelded
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on a mildly encouraging debut last season but he's handicapped accordingly and returns gelded; the market could be instructive.

runners.name: Freddy Robinson
runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Linsey Pallas & Mrs Claire Ellison

runners.comment: Only Flat win came here and has run well on his recent visits; chance back at 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who is 1-18 on the Flat; that victory did come here over 1m2f and has also run well on his recent visits; won't mind returning to 1m4f.

stable_tour.quote: He's named after my grandson. I don't know why he didn't win on the Flat, but he's won twice over hurdles. He likes jumping and won at Catterick last time. He came back from that a bit sore but he's fine now and we're just waiting for better ground. He'll probably end up going back on the Flat and he should be winning in that sphere. 03-04-24

runners.name: Palazzo Persico
runners.owner: Johnny Hall And Mrs David Nutting
runners.comment: Poor the last twice but capable off this mark if back to anything like his best
runners.spotlight: Reportedly failed to stay nearly 2m last time but was also well beaten the run before over 1m2f; just about stays this far and capable off this mark if back to anything like his best.

runners.name: Icecap
runners.comment: Not shown anything over hurdles in last three races and Flat form is none too inspiring
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown anything over hurdles in her last three races and Flat form is none too inspiring, including four handicaps at up to 1m2f.

4:25.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap
4:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Princess Niyla
runners.comment: C&D winner; had a wider trip than the front two when third at Wetherby (1m2f)
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; had a wider trip than the front two when third at Wetherby (1m2f) and that was an encouraging return; respected.

runners.name: This Years Love
runners.comment: Not badly handicapped and all three wins have been here on fast ground
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been here on fast ground and only 2lb higher than for the latest last August when making all in the new cheekpieces; below par with and without those aids on his last two runs (Ayr/Doncaster); needs a second look back here.

runners.name: Dawn Of Liberation
runners.comment: Without a win since 2022 despite dropping in the weights
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2022 despite dropping in the weights and hasn't been threatening for a while now; reservations remain.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dawn Of Liberation ran so badly at Newmarket last time and nobody could really understand that. He emptied, but was quite free, so a mile might be better for him. He's still a baby and I think Churchill's progeny will just get better as they go on. We thought a lot of him before Newmarket - Paul Roy, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He'd sometimes been running to 102 and other times to 82, so we've tidied his wind up and I think he'll go to a handicap at Newmarket on Guineas day. He wouldn't want it soft. 02-05-23

There's a Â£20,000 race at Musselburgh on Sunday lined up for this well-bred sort. It's for those rated 41-68 and, as he's 68, it's the perfect opportunity. This time last year he was rated 85, so he has become well handicapped. 09-04-25

runners.name: Dandys Angel
runners.comment: Best at 1m2f and kept on well for second over the extended 1m here 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Has won five times over C&D and kept on well for second over the extended 1m here 11 days ago; possibilities, especially should it rain.

runners.name: Solar Bentley
runners.comment: Win and place form at this trip and any rain would bring him into it
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over this far but on heavy ground; has run a few good races in defeat and any rain would bring him into it.

runners.name: Life On The Rocks
runners.comment: Back in the groove now and deserved his narrow win at Leicester (1m2f)
runners.spotlight: Won four times over 1m2f last year on turf; the winter didn't go well but back in the groove now and deserved his narrow win at Leicester (1m2f, good to firm); only 1lb higher.

5:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Union Island
runners.comment: Finished just under 3l behind Light Up Our Stars at Yarmouth ten days ago
runners.spotlight: One turf win at 5f and two on the AW at 1m; finished just under 3l behind Light Up Our Stars at Yarmouth ten days ago (1m, good to firm) and there were no excuses having been given every chance.

runners.name: Crownthorpe
runners.owner: Mrs M Doherty & A D Brown

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Nothing positive to take from either run following an absence
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner but powers are firmly on the wane and nothing positive to take from either run following an absence.

quotes.race: Ripon "Cock O' The North" Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a good run in Ireland last time. Crownthorpe is a work in progress, but has got potential and is going the right way - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Thats My Boy Luke
runners.comment: Blinkered last twice; raced up with the pace here last time and only just missed out
runners.spotlight: Now 0-13 and has his bad days, but he raced up with the pace here last time and only just missed out; that was only his second start in the blinkers.

runners.name: Berkshire Phantom
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock

prev_owners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub

runners.comment: Losing run of 11 but usually runs well, as at Catterick last time when slowly away
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner on a losing run of 11; usually runs well, though, as at Catterick last time when slowly away; now 12lb lower than for last win.

runners.name: Triple Force
runners.comment: Finished well from off the pace when runner-up over C&D 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden but placed a few times and finished well from off the pace when edging out Thats My Boy Luke for second over C&D 19 days ago; should be involved.

runners.name: Light Up Our Stars

prev_owners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam
Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam

runners.comment: Finished much the best over 1m at Yarmouth last week (under Taryn Langley)
runners.spotlight: In a good run of form right now and finished much the best over 1m at Yarmouth last week (under Taryn Langley); clear claims off 3lb higher.

quotes.race: BJ Llewellyn Supports Tenovus Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Light Up Our Stars ran a grand race at Newbury on his seasonal comeback on very soft ground and the quick conditions here have helped him. We will have to see how the handicapper looks at the result before making a little plan - Richard Hughes, trainer.

1:35.race_name: bet365 Very British Raceday Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
1:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watered)

runners.name: Raging Al
runners.comment: Showed a bit in his second run for Ralph Beckett and was recruited for 15,000gns
runners.spotlight: Lasted only two races with Ralph Beckett but finished fifth of 13 in a 1m2f Sandown maiden in June and there could be more to come from this well-bred gelding; bought for 15,000gns.

runners.name: Broker Charlie
runners.comment: Similar profile to Raging Al in that he showed some promise in two races for Ralph Beckett
runners.spotlight: Similar profile to Raging Al in that he showed some promise in two races for Ralph Beckett before being sold on relatively cheaply; hooded for his first two races as well; others are preferred.

runners.name: Gravitas
runners.comment: Might well have floored the favourite at Ripon had he been wiser to the job in hand
runners.spotlight: 50,000gns yearling; 7-2 at Ripon (1m4f, good) and had he been that bit wiser might well have floored the long odds-on favourite (stablemate of Tarriance); that was a promising start and must hold every chance.

runners.name: Invincible Shadow
runners.comment: 200-1 when tailed off in a 1m AW maiden in October and can only be watched after that
runners.spotlight: 200-1 when tailed off in a 1m AW maiden in October and can only be watched after that.

runners.name: Me And Bobby Mcgee
runners.comment: Finished last of the five at Hamilton (1m3f; 10-1) last week; stable second string here
runners.spotlight: Finished last of the five at Hamilton (1m3f; 10-1) only last week; stable second string here.

runners.name: Tarriance
runners.comment: Third at Leicester in a maiden that's working out well and should be hard to beat
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt out of a Group 3 winner; easy to back at Leicester (1m2f, good; 22-1) but led two out and only faded late on; the form of that race is already working out quite well and this is easier.

runners.name: Hazy Bela
runners.comment: Finished out the back in races over 1m at Southwell and 1m2f here; one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Finished out the back in races over 1m at Southwell and 1m2f here; one for handicaps.

5:38.race_name: Old Park Wood Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
5:38.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Jerrash
runners.comment: Pulled up on latest outing but last summer's form (including over C&D) gives him a shout
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner on good ground last summer (2m4f/2m5f) and subsequently went close over C&D on heavy ground; pulled up on only start this year (in Edinburgh National in February) but has possibilities here if back on song.

quotes.race: Lives Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The change of scenery has done Jerrash good. This was a lot better race than the one he won at Bangor last time. We'll have three in the Summer Plate [at Market Rasen] now. This horse is still improving. He won off 118 but I can't see him going up that much - Peter Bowen, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: I think this horse has a very big future and is one to keep an eye out for. He ran a lovely third to Our Jester (won valuable Lingfield bumper since) on his debut at Ascot and he came on a ton for that experience as he showed late last month at Ascot when winning nicely over 2m5Â½f on his hurdling debut. I am not sure how strong the opposition was but he could only do what he did. He must go forward from that but it will be baby steps, nothing to hot too soon. Cheltenham is out of the question as those races are now closed, which is no bad thing. We will take our time as he could be quite smart. 02-02-22

runners.name: Morfee
runners.comment: Very close second to a next-time-out winner last month; gets another chance off same mark
runners.spotlight: Worked his way back to form in second half of last season and lost out only by a head to a next-time-out winner when clear second at Market Rasen (3m, good) last month; gets another chance off the same mark here and this left-handed track should also suit; might be the answer.

quotes.race: William Hill Daily Bet Boost Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I had to take a pull on Morfee early doors as I hit the front on him soon enough last time - James Best, jockey.

runners.name: Fairlawn Flyer
runners.comment: Ended last season with three consecutive wins and is suited by this C&D; respected
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with three consecutive wins, the latest when battling on well to lead close home in Highland National at Perth (3m6f, good to soft) four weeks ago; latest 6lb rise demands more from him but he has a C&D success (in 2023) on his CV and will be fine on the forecast good ground.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well, winning his last two races at Huntingdon and Market Rasen. He ran well on his first run for over a year at Kelso in December, but then lost his way a little bit again. He's hard to train but when he finds his form he's not bad. There's a staying chase at Perth next month, a 0-125 over 3m6f that's worth Â£30,000, and the plan is that he'll go there next. He'll have a nice light weight and if he's in the same sort of form he should hopefully win again. He went up to 104 for winning at Market Rasen and then won under a 5lb penalty at Huntingdon for our claimer Shane Fenelon. But they haven't put him up again so he should have a good chance. It's a long ten-hour drive at least up to Perth so there's no point going there with a runner that doesn't have a chance. 26-03-25

runners.name: Sean Og

prev_owners.owner: Ms Mary Mullins & Ms Margaret Mullins

runners.comment: Dual chase winner last season but far too inconsistent to rely upon
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner last season, here (2m5f, heavy) and at Catterick (3m1f, good to soft); today's forecast ground won't be a problem but he's not very consistent and needs to bounce back from a poor run last month.

6:08.race_name: John Fogg Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
6:08.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Horn Cape
runners.comment: Six-time hurdle winner; well beaten in only previous chase; best on soft/heavy ground
runners.spotlight: Six-time hurdle winner on soft/heavy ground; reverts to fences on a tempting mark but was well beaten in his only previous chase (in October 2023) and there may not be enough rain about for him today.

quotes.race: Cazoo Search Drive Smile Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted to see Horn Cape follow up and I wasn't really in a hurry to run him again because he's a big horse, but my hand was forced with the handicappers reaction. He's seemed fresh and well this week and we thought we'd give it a go. - Ben Haslam, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's backward but that isn't surprising given his size. He's a nascent chaser and should come into his own this season, particularly when the ground is soft. He's still a novice over hurdles and we'll try to push on with him. 24-10-22

runners.name: Hurricane Ali
runners.comment: Not bred for chasing but runs this track well and is suited by good ground
runners.spotlight: 7-40 over hurdles; not bred for fences and has left it rather late in the day to launch his chasing career but he runs this track well and is suited by good ground.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hurricane Ali is progressing nicely and likes this ground. Running him over 2m is clearly working but he will stay 2m4f down the line - Stan Sheppard, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse we've just bought from John Mackie. John has looked after him really well and was sad to see him go, and I think he's going to have a good summer campaign. He's an older horse who's been really consistent over hurdles. I like these good-ground horses for Cartmel and he could be one to jump a fence. 14-02-24

runners.name: Klitschko
runners.breeder: A J Davenhill & Mrs A L Davenhill
runners.comment: Hurdle winner two runs ago; well held since, though, and not straightforward; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Came good for Lucinda Hughes with quite stylish hurdle win at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) in March but he's not straightforward and his latest run was disappointing; not an easy one to predict on chasing debut.

stable_tour.quote: We had a few little hold-ups with him but we got him to the track at Huntingdon, where he surprised me by pulling hard. He got lit up and did an awful lot wrong but was still an impressive winner. He's obviously got a big engine and he's schooling well over hurdles. 19-10-22

He was his own worst enemy last season as he was inclined to overrace. But he gradually got the hang of things and won over 2m at Plumpton despite finding the trip too sharp. He had a setback after that but is back working well and will have another season over hurdles. 10-11-23

runners.name: Coqolino
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Logis Saint Germain
runners.comment: Went close over 2m5f here last summer but needs to better his recent efforts
runners.spotlight: 0-19 over fences; went close here (2m5f, heavy) last summer and is now 5lb below that mark but his recent efforts have been disappointing and he might find 2m1f on good ground an inadequate stamina test.

quotes.race: Navan Members Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Coqolino gave us a scare at the last but he did it well and was entitled to. He's a gorgeous horse and a chaser in the making - Denise Foster, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Didn't run in the second half of last season so he remains a maiden over fences. Hopefully he can pick up a chase somewhere along the way. He wants a trip and plenty of cut in the ground. 24-10-23

runners.name: Disco Annie
runners.comment: Went off too hard at Perth last month but didn't run badly; comes here on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles at Carlisle (2m1f, good to soft/soft) in November and ran well in defeat there (2m, soft) on chasing debut the following month; went off a bit too hard when well-held fourth at Perth (2m, good) ten days ago but certainly didn't run badly there; came second (over hurdles on good ground) on only previous visit to Cartmel and returns here on a good mark; hood refitted; good chance.

stable_tour.quote: She's been hard to get settled at home but the penny really started to drop at the back end of last season and she was second at Cartmel. She's a bold front-running mare who wears her heart on her sleeve and she could be one for the Lady Buttons Go North Final. If she settles she'll get 2m4f. She runs on Thursday at Carlisle. 16-10-24

4:00.race_name: Cartmel Sticky Toffee Pudding EBF Mares' Handicap Hurdle
4:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: D Day Arvalenreeva
runners.comment: 2-2 in handicap hurdles; hiked up 11lb for last month's easy Ludlow success; respected
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who is 2-2 in handicap hurdles; cruised clear to win easily at Ludlow (2m, good) last month and commands respect here, despite a subsequent 11lb hike up the weights.

runners.name: Lahinch Wave
runners.comment: Made all on hurdle debut; not as good when ridden very patiently on next outing
runners.spotlight: Safely held when ridden very patiently in 2m5f Fontwell novice last month, after a layoff, but made all on hurdle debut at Worcester (2m4f, good) last September and it will be interesting to see whether connections revert to positive tactics over this shorter trip on her handicap debut.

runners.name: Jolie Coeur Allen
runners.comment: Well beaten over C&D on stable debut and has not shown much on the Flat since
runners.spotlight: Made the frame four times over hurdles for Willie Mullins in Ireland but disappointed over C&D on summer's stable debut and did not show much on her three subsequent Flat starts; others have much less to prove.

runners.name: Expelliarmus
runners.comment: Not beaten far on handicap debut at Cork in December; returns for new stable
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when seventh of 14 on handicap debut at Cork (2m, yielding) and but we haven't seen her again since; makes stable debut here; cheekpieces removed after one use; market may guide.

runners.name: Spot On Soph
runners.comment: Ran well in this race a year ago but absent since below-par effort here last August
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for third in this race a year ago and won at Market Rasen (2m4f, good) on her next outing but we haven't seen her since a below-par C&D run last August and she'll need to resume in peak form to have a chance off her current handicap mark.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: She's not the biggest mare and has been running over hurdles, winning at Market Rasen. She can jump a fence but she's not a natural chaser and is better round the smaller tracks. She'll go to Musselburgh for the Go North series mares' final. Jonathan: She'll probably end up back over fences this summer because she's reached her ceiling in the handicap in hurdles races. She found 2m6f stretching her stamina when she tried the trip at Cartmel, and she's probably best at two-to-two and a half miles. 08-02-24

runners.name: Bellbird

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie HDBB, N Clement & Mrs Linda Dyer

runners.comment: Fairly consistent mare who drops back in trip after last month's 2m3f Bangor second
runners.spotlight: Fairly consistent in handicaps since her Ludlow novice win (2m, good) just over a year ago; drops back in trip after perfectly respectable second at Bangor (2m3f, good to soft) last month and probably won't be far away.

5:05.race_name: Bowness Bay Brewing Mares' Handicap Hurdle
5:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Springtime Promise
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner in early 2024 but not much went to plan during light campaign last season
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 novice hurdle in February 2024 (2m4f, soft) but chasing didn't go to plan during light campaign last season and she was well beaten when upped to 3m1f for hurdle return in January; this race is much easier but she's not yet proven on good ground and her current ability is hard to gauge; had wind op in February.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Cheltenham Festival Betting Guide Jane Seymour Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB)
quotes.quote: I've detested this whole winter of rain, but for Springtime Promise it's been great, so I've not minded the weather all week. It's poured down and I'm delighted to see it soft, heavy in places because she loves it. The plan was always to come here after she won at Huntingdon in January, but we got a run at Sedgefield in between because she's so well. For the ground to come up right I was just so happy, and she had a dream run. Her confidence is sky high, all she wants to do is win races, and we just thought we needed that Cheltenham entry in case it came up soft. If the rain comes, she could be there - Sally Randell, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Private Bank Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was Springtime Promise's first run for us since she come over from Ireland. She jumped well, but we didn't think she had much turn of foot however she kept on galloping. Sally (Randell, trainer's partner) found her for us. She sent us over two or three videos of different ones but as soon as I saw this one I said that's the one we want. She has been purchased to replace Merry Berry who won four races for us. It is early days and this is a good enough start, but if she was as good as Merry Berry we would be delighted - Sheena Pilkington, representing the Keeping The Dream Alive syndicate.

runners.name: Mermaids Cave
runners.owner: A Keaveney, M Keaveney & P Butcher
runners.comment: Scored at Huntingdon this month and is now 6-18 over hurdles; player if stamina holds out
runners.spotlight: Progressive mare who scored by 4l in first-time cheekpieces at Huntingdon (2m3f, good) this month and is now 6-18 over hurdles; not yet proven over this far but has won here before; must be considered.

quotes.race: starsportsbet.co.uk Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Mermaids Cave was straightforward considering what was going on around her. She was straight as a bullet. We've dropped her out today and she seemed to gain confidence coming through horses. Going forward I think she's one to look forward to, I couldn't fault her and she was foot perfect - Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Musique De Fee
runners.comment: 3-5 since cheekpieces were added in March; might still be on the upgrade; commands respect
runners.spotlight: 3-5 since cheekpieces were fitted in March, the latest win gained in four-runner race at Hereford (3m1f, good) a fortnight ago; did that very easily and latest 6lb rise does not look excessive; good chance.

quotes.race: DragonBet: Oncourse And Online Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I must say a big thank-you to Sean Bowen, who rode Musique De Fee six days ago. I rang him this morning and all he said was to kick on with her and he was right - Finn Lambert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Mellificent
runners.comment: Well beaten on both starts for new stable this year; needs to get career back on track
runners.spotlight: Promising novice at up to 3m for Jonjo O'Neill in 2023-24 season but well beaten in two handicaps for new stable this year (2m5f/2m4f), the latter at Hexham a fortnight ago; needs to get career back on track.

stable_tour.quote: She won her first start for us last season at Uttoxeter but the lack of pace was against her when she ran sixth in a Listed bumper at Market Rasen. It was good to see her make a winning start over hurdles at Carlisle last month in what was probably only an average race but she was always on top. We might look at the French Furze novice hurdle on Fighting Fifth day at Newcastle over 2m6f, which is a trip that should suit her. 14-11-23

runners.name: Robyndeglory
runners.comment: Safely held in a recent chase but was placed in 20-runner Cork hurdle two runs again
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner; inconsistent for current stable since autumn and comes here after 30l defeat over fences three weeks ago but was denied clear run at crucial stage before keeping on for third in 20-runner Cork handicap (3m, soft) two starts ago and will be fine on the faster ground here.

runners.name: Vroomoz Eile
runners.comment: Won 2m3f Carlisle novice in February; could have more to offer in staying handicaps
runners.spotlight: 0-13 in Irish points but came good under rules at third attempt, in Carlisle novice (2m3f, soft) in February; not sure to be suited by the faster ground here but could easily have more to offer in staying handicaps.

runners.name: Shantou Sunset
runners.breeder: Elms Stud Co Ltd & P Atkinson

prev_owners.owner: Optimumracing Co Uk & Andrew P Bell

runners.comment: Placed twice here under Leah Noreci last summer; can't be ignored
runners.spotlight: Returned from layoff with low-key run in February but was placed twice under Leah Noreci here last summer (3m1f/2m6f) and seems very versatile regarding ground; can't be ignored.

stable_tour.quote: She won at Newton Abbot last week and I thought it was 50-50 between her and the other horse before that one fell at the last. She might've been lucky but we're delighted with her first run of the season. She's not a big mare so running off a lower weight might help and there's a 0-130 mares' handicap over three miles at Ascot on November 20 that we might have a go at. 25-10-21

A six-time winner who's been a good, fun horse. She only got beat a short head by Our Sam at Cartmel last summer and she'll be running when the better ground comes around. She's had a long career and will probably go to stud at the end of the year. 14-02-24

4:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Caughtinyourtrance
runners.comment: Placed in two bumpers last year but showed only minor promise on first two hurdle starts
runners.spotlight: Won Irish point (soft to heavy) in autumn 2023 and was placed in two soft-ground bumpers the following spring but showed only minor promise on his two hurdling starts last season (2m4f/2m3f, soft) and needs to improve on the much quicker ground here.

stable_tour.quote: A nice bumper horse we've bought who goes very well and will run before the ground firms up. He won his only point and should be ready to run in mid-March. He's been steadily improving at home and his work has been really good. He's taken a bit of time but is very straightforward. He's improved steadily and I'll be surprised if he can't acquit himself really well in a bumper. We've had quite a few bumper winners in the last few years and his homework compares very favourably to all of those. I'd be very hopeful he's above average. 14-02-24

runners.name: Getaway Vic
runners.comment: 2-3 in bumpers since emphatic Irish point win; taken very seriously on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Quickened clear for emphatic Irish point win just over a year ago (good to yielding) and is 2-3 in good-ground bumpers since; quickly moves up in trip for this hurdling debut and needs to be taken very seriously.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Worcester last summer and was then placed in another. He might have one more bumper run before the end of the season and will go novice hurdling after that. I think he should end up being a nice horse. 26-03-25

runners.name: Lantic Bay
runners.comment: Struggled on both hurdling starts (2m/2m2f)
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in good-ground Worcester maiden (2m) on debut in June 2023 and also struggled when reappearing on heavy ground at Newton Abbot (2m2f) last month.

runners.name: Maggies Boy
runners.comment: Close up in two Perth handicaps this spring; good claims on return to novice company
runners.spotlight: Beginning to look exposed after seven hurdling starts but finished close up in two Perth handicaps this spring (3m/3m2f) and has good claims on this return to novice company.

runners.name: My Friend Yeats

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.comment: Big player if judged on winter handicap form but weakened quickly on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Went close in Catterick handicap (2m3f, good; first-time cheekpieces) in December and ran well over same C&D the following month (good to soft; first-time visor); big player if judged on those efforts but weakened quickly on last two outings and is now 0-12 over hurdles; cheekpieces refitted.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very good second in a 2m6f novice hurdle at Cartmel in July and has an opening mark of 104. He should be competitive over a trip. 16-10-24

runners.name: Turndlightsdownlow
runners.comment: Showed some ability in Irish points in February; Sean Bowen booked for rules debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a very useful Flat/hurdle winner; showed some ability in two slow-ground Irish points in February and the booking of Sean Bowen makes him worth a glance in the betting before this rules debut.

runners.name: Kalo Athena
runners.comment: 2-2 in Irish points; not much went to plan on first two rules starts; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: 2-2 in Irish points in spring 2024; looked unlucky not to finish closer than sixth in Carlisle bumper on rules debut in November and her disappointing hurdle debut in February can probably be excused (sprawled on landing after mid-race jumping error); not ruled out.

runners.name: Perfect Poli
runners.comment: Pulled up when 150-1 for last month's stable debut at Perth
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far on hurdling debut for Iain Jardine in November 2023 but, following a long absence, was pulled up when 150-1 for last month's stable debut at Perth (2m4f, good to soft).

runners.name: Sky Luna
runners.comment: Placed twice over C&D last summer; slow ground the excuse on next two outings
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; placed over C&D (good) on first two starts under rules (both last summer) and may not have been suited by the slow ground when pulled up on next two outings; has fitness to prove after 224-day absence but has a fighting chance if quickly back in the groove.

6:38.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Super Citizen
runners.comment: Had ground excuse when well beaten this month; player if judged on earlier form
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old but won off reduced mark at Carlisle (3m, good) last month and again stuck to his task well when second at Kelso (2m7f, good) a fortnight later; reportedly not suited by the good to soft ground when well beaten on latest outing; contender if able to rebound here.

quotes.race: John Thomas McNamara Series (Q.R.) Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Super Citizen loves this place and the race suited him, it obviously suited him last year and suited him this year. He's not a horse that usually pulls out a lot and I'd rather have seen him two lengths clear at the last. He's honest, jumps well and stays - Eugene O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Kate Madrik
runners.comment: No match for easy winner when second on British chase debut; up from 2m5f today
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner in France last year (2m4f/2m2f, soft); no match for easy winner when second of five on this month's British chasing debut at Fakenham (2m5f, good) and needs improvement over this new trip.

runners.name: Big Bee Hive
runners.comment: Won this race in 2024 and might be boosted by a change of headgear today
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner (including this race in 2024) who is usually ridden very patiently; not really firing on all cylinders this year but wasn't beaten far when fourth at Southwell (3m, good) last month and might be boosted by a change of headgear here.

quotes.race: Cannonwood Handicap Hurdle (Rated 80-95)
quotes.quote: Big Bee Hive ran a blinder at Punchestown last time for Phidelma (Elvin). He won't go on summer ground and he probably doesn't handle heavy. I would say he'll improve and hopefully we can find another little race for him - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: He doesn't like pressure and has taken time. Jonathan: He's only just started to get things together and last time out, when he finished third at Sedgefield, was the first time he's shown signs there might be races to win with him. He'll appreciate nicer ground and will probably go chasing in the spring, but he should be able to win off 84. I rode him to give him every chance to get 2m4f last time, but he'll probably stay further. 08-02-24

runners.name: Lights Are Green
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; made a satisfactory reappearance this month; back here on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Won this race in 2023 and collected another good-ground C&D win last summer; returned from layoff with a satisfactory run at Hexham three weeks ago and returns here on a good mark; one to note.

runners.name: Jelski
