runners.comment: Badly out of form at end of last year but runs this track very well; back from break
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D (good) in summer 2023 and also has three other course wins on his CV; ended 2024 in poor form over hurdles and returns from five-month break with quite a bit to prove but has slipped to a very tempting mark.

quotes.race: Remembering Nicholas Hooton Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: They went too quick, they've gone a right gallop, Jelski sat last and it panned out perfectly for us. I hope the handicapper doesn't take it literally - Jimmy Moffatt, trainer.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Jelski has dropped into the right grade. He was hard to saddle the last time here and I feel it upset him. He goes on soft ground too and will stay three miles - Jimmy Moffat, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a superstar. We bought him at the Trevor Hemmings dispersal sale in 2020 and he's won five times for us. He won two chases at Cartmel last summer and might need to come down the handicap a little bit, but he wins his races every year. He'll be out from springtime and we'll mix it between hurdles and fences. He's as good over hurdles as he is over fences. He's not the most scopey and has a neat way of doing things, but the smaller fences at Cartmel suit him well. 14-02-24

runners.name: Game Line
runners.comment: Pulled up all three starts since returning from a long absence
runners.spotlight: Has run well at this track and is very well handicapped on old form but pulled up on all three starts since returning in December from a mammoth absence and needs to prove some ability remains; blinkers refitted.

quotes.race: Snellings Norfolk National Handicap Chase (Fakenham Double Up Bonus Race)
quotes.quote: Game Line did that well, the further he goes the better he is. He hasn't finished out of the first three since he joined us and seems to go on any ground so we will enter him for the Summer Cup at Uttoxeter - Peter Bowen, trainer.

runners.name: Judicial Review
runners.comment: Made all over 2m5f here last summer; not seen since but still unexposed over fences
runners.spotlight: Responded well to first-time blinkers when making all here (2m5f, soft) last summer, his second chase start; has fitness to prove after nine-month absence but is open to further progress over fences if today's different trip-and-ground combination also suits.

runners.name: Euchan Falls
runners.comment: 0-12 over fences; good second at Ayr in March but well held twice since; others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-12 over fences; gave good account when second at Ayr (3m, soft; also suited by good) in March but two lesser efforts have followed (chase/hurdle); first visit to Cartmel; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He has been second three times in the past six months, twice over fences and once over hurdles. He was a very good second over hurdles at Perth last time behind What A Johnny and is entered back there over fences on Wednesday evening. After that he'll probably go on holiday. 16-05-24

runners.name: Fathers Advice
runners.comment: Belatedly off the mark at Perth ten days ago; still unexposed over this sort of trip
runners.spotlight: Came good at 32nd attempt, from just out of the weights in Perth chase (3m, good) ten days ago; has run well here (albeit over hurdles) and is still unexposed over staying trips; no surprise if he features.

stable_tour.quote: He's had just a couple of runs this year. He's been a nearly horse, but he's on a ridiculously low mark now for what he shows at home. He'll probably go to the big meeting at Cartmel at the end of the month. 16-05-24

runners.name: Donnys Fortune
runners.comment: Not beaten far on recent chasing debut but didn't get far at Hexham on Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner who is still unexposed under rules; not beaten far when fifth on recent chasing debut at Uttoxeter (3m, good; several fences omitted) but needs to build on that performance here and didn't get far at Hexham on Tuesday.

runners.name: Wotsmyname

prev_owners.owner: K Jardine R Griffiths S Greig

runners.comment: 0-24 under all codes but ran well from out of the weights at Kelso last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: 0-24 under all codes and not very reliable but gave very good account when fourth from out of the weights at Kelso (2m7f, good) last month and is effectively 9lb lower from correct mark here; had excuse when pulled up last time (stirrup snapped); not ruled out.

runners.name: Muroor
runners.comment: Went down fighting at Hexham on Tuesday but needs to prove himself on this track
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has not been with Lizzie Quinlan long and went down fighting when close second at Hexham (3m, good) on Tuesday; effectively only 2lb higher today but was well beaten on both previous visits to Cartmel.

quotes.race: hannontravel.com Most Appropriately Dressed Lady Win A Trip To The Dominican Republic Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He jumped very quick and was lightning for a small horse. I thought at the weight he would run well, not as well as those who backed him, I don't know where that [money] came from. He's just a real specialist for up here - Tom McCourt, trainer

quotes.race: Portman Dentalcare Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Muroor loves it up here and Conor [Maxwell] has him down to a tee. He has plenty of ability and tracks like this suit him - Tom McCourt, trainer

quotes.race: Ulster Carpets Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Muroor loves these type of tracks. He's getting it together. There's another meeting here next month and he might come back, the stiff finish here suits him. Last day was a real sickener but it's great to get this one - Tom McCourt, trainer.

quotes.race: Stoat Selling Stakes
quotes.quote: The other horse brought me across but I just had to try and keep Muroor going. He's a little bit quirky but he's won in the end. I was pretty sure I'd got up - Jamie Spencer, rider.

7:08.race_name: North West Air Ambulance Handicap Chase
7:08.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.8) (Watering)

runners.name: Whoshotthesheriff
runners.comment: Winless since 2022 but was running well before penultimate-fence fall two starts ago
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2022 but was in process of running well before penultimate-fence fall at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft; refitted cheekpieces) two starts ago and had excuse when tailed off there last month (suffered overreach); blinkers tried today.

quotes.race: Wreay Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Whoshotthesheriff has been freshened up and the better ground has suited him after his very disappointing run at Wetherby. He was the class horse in the race and is going back in the right direction - Sean Quinlan, jockey.

runners.name: Fearless Action
runners.comment: Good 2m winner at Sedgefield in March but not in same form again since; stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Produced good performance to win by 6l at Sedgefield (2m, good) in March but has not been in the same form again since, and he failed to convince stamina-wise on his three previous attempts at about 2m4f.

runners.name: Pilgrims King
runners.comment: Won dramatic race at Sedgefield in February but safely held there next time
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to collar an idling Beat The Edge and score at Sedgefield (2m3f, good to soft) in February but it's probably wise to treat that form with a degree of caution, and he managed only fifth when back at Sedgefied (2m5f, good) the following month.

quotes.race: Mary & Smokey Reed Wedding Anniversary Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It was a lucky one, I kind of felt the saddle going down to the first and I could see it slipping back. I couldn't even give Pilgrims King a proper ride down to the last because it was so far back, but it looked a lot worse than it felt - Shane Fenelon, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: Shane [Fenelon] did an amazing job on him when he won at Sedgefield in February, managing to stay on when his saddle slipped and win the race. He went up 4lb for that - and Shane was taking 5lb off. He was fifth at Sedgefield when returning there last week and may need to come down a few pounds. 26-03-25

runners.name: Defence Witness
runners.comment: Ran poorly (over hurdles) on stable debut; not an easy one to predict here
runners.spotlight: Displayed promise on both chasing starts for Sandy Thomson in the autumn and was placed in a 3m hurdle for him in December but his stable debut (over hurdles) in March was very disappointing and it's hard to know what to expect from him here; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.name: Wearelongterm
runners.owner: Dennis J Coppola & Mrs Dianne Sayer
runners.comment: Ended last season in poor form; needs recent wind op to have made a difference
runners.spotlight: Ran well over hurdles here in 2023 but ended last season with some very disappointing hurdle/chase runs and is now 0-13 under rules; needs recent wind op to have made a big difference.

runners.name: Beat The Edge
runners.comment: In good form since the autumn but this quirky customer tends to idle when in front
runners.spotlight: Quirky customer who tends to idle when hitting the front and has become very tricky to win with; that said, he's been in good form for Micky Hammond since the the autumn and will be suited by the trip/ground here.

runners.name: Azof Des Mottes
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Lightly raced since his chase win in 2023; returned from latest break with very poor run
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since his chase win at Kelso (2m5f, good) in spring 2023 and returned from latest layoff with very disappointing run a fortnight ago; needs to leave that effort a long way behind.

runners.name: Toombridge
runners.breeder: Little Lodge Farm & Lucky Bin Racing
runners.comment: 0-16 under rules but posted some pretty good efforts towards end of last season; a player
runners.spotlight: 0-16 under rules but posted some pretty good efforts in cheekpieces towards end of last season, most recently when second from out of the weights at Kelso (2m4f, good) one month ago; can make his presence felt off correct mark here.

runners.name: Noel Fox
runners.comment: Two wins last season, her first; still low mileage and talented 7lb claimer booked
runners.spotlight: Won two of her first four starts, a 6f maiden and a 5f handicap, but she ended that campaign with two lesser efforts (heavy ground excuse latest); good apprentice booked for her seasonal return and still has some potential.

runners.name: Lady Dreamer
runners.comment: C&D winner; feasibly treated back from a break; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won her novice over C&D but her five subsequent handicap wins have been on AW, the latest at Wolverhampton when last seen in February; withdrawn after getting upset in the stalls here on May 12 (12-1 at the time of withdrawal);

runners.name: Raffles Angel
runners.comment: Progressed well in handicaps for R Guest last summer; another career-best needed on return
runners.spotlight: Made good progress once handicapping last summer (trained by Rae Guest), winning 6f handicaps at Ripon, Lingfield and Yarmouth; failed to fire when last seen in October; may progress again this year but she will need a career-best to make a winning return.

runners.name: Study Up
runners.comment: Salisbury win (6f, good to firm) on 2yo debut; two solid AW runs this year; needs more
runners.spotlight: Looked promising when winning a 6f novice at Salisbury last summer; two creditable AW runs this year without making any progress; return to turf could spark extra but it is needed.

stable_tour.quote: He's run only once but that was a very pleasing debut at Salisbury last July when he won by a length and three-quarters. He had a hold-up after that but he's training nicely and I'm looking forward to getting him back on the track. 17-04-25

runners.name: Strike
runners.breeder: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.owner: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.comment: Two C&D wins last year; good second at Ascot a fortnight ago; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Two of last season's three wins came over C&D on fast ground; two solid efforts this year, second of ten at Ascot two weeks ago, and his rider's claim is useful; should go well.

runners.name: Tiger Tulip
runners.comment: Yet to fire this year, including when backed at Wolverhampton on Monday
runners.spotlight: Attracted support at Wolverhampton on Monday but there was no upturn in her fortunes, racing freely and getting caught wide despite a handy draw; dangerous mark but others look much safer.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C-D 3 Runs Or Fewer) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Everything went smoothly. Tiger Tulip was away nicely and we just took a tow into the race off the favourite. She's still very inexperienced so I thought I'd squeeze her in between two (rivals) in the home straight and she picked up nicely - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Zariela
runners.comment: Overcame trouble when scoring at Yarmouth and she's open to more progress; key player
runners.spotlight: Acts on good to firm and good to soft; won a Lingfield maiden (1m, AW) last September and she got back on the scoresheet when landing a Yarmouth handicap (1m; first-time visor) last month; up 3lb but she overcame trouble to score with a bit in hand last time and is open to more progress; key player.

runners.name: Newfangled
runners.comment: Won on AW last month and he went close back on turf at Newbury (1m) last week; respected
runners.spotlight: Solid operator who recorded his fourth AW win when scoring at Lingfied last month; 0-9 on turf but he returned to this sphere with a close third at Newbury (1m, good) last Friday; up another 2lb but he was as good as ever last time and he's respected.

runners.name: Serenity Dream
runners.comment: Sole win was as a 2yo but he went close on recent stable debut at Kempton; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Sole win was as a 2yo but he's dropped a long way in the weights and was a close second on recent stable debut at Kempton (7f, AW); should be fine on this step back up in trip and has claims if he repeat that form back on turf.

runners.name: Landlordtothestars
runners.comment: Out of sorts in final two runs last season and his best form is on AW; opposable on return
runners.spotlight: Triple Tapeta winner but his last success was 16 months ago and he was out of sorts in final two runs last season; has something to prove after 205 days off and his turf form lags behind his best AW efforts; cheekpieces added.

quotes.race: talkSPORT Powered By Fans Handicap
quotes.quote: Landlordtothestars is a big unit. He's just learned to get himself together, he's so big from his head to his feet. The penny's been dropping a bit and he was in the right company - Dougie Costello, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Daisy Roots
runners.comment: C&D winner who has finished close up in two AW runs for new yard; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Four wins for Adam West and latest was over C&D (good to firm) last September; still 5lb higher than for that success but she's made a good start for current yard with two close finishes on AW at Lingfield; usually races prominently and she's respected back at this track.

runners.name: Raqraaq
runners.comment: Both wins have been on AW at Lingfield and he's 0-13 on turf; others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come on AW at Lingfield and he had an excuse after a wide trip there on his return last month; only 2lb higher than for his last win in January but he's 0-13 on turf and others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Sweet Sister
runners.comment: Free-going filly who has yet to finish placed and has something to prove on her return
runners.spotlight: Free-going filly who hasn't progressed and she ended last season with a heavy defeat at Kempton (1m3f); now takes a big drop back in trip but she's yet to finish placed after seven starts and has something to prove after 241 days off; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Dollyana
runners.comment: Disappointing since her novice win last summer including in three handicaps; passed over
runners.spotlight: Beat a useful filly when landing a Ffos Las novice (7.3f, good) last summer, but she's been disappointing since including in three handicaps; mark is falling but she's now 1-7 and others are more convincing.

runners.name: Al Waseela
runners.comment: Hit a personal best when scoring at Nottingham and she's open to more progress; big player
runners.spotlight: Two soft-ground wins in blinkers for William Haggas in the autumn and she made it second-time lucky for new yard when scoring without headgear at Nottingham (8.3f, good to firm) last month; up 3lb but she hit a clear personal best last time and is open to more progress; leading contender.

runners.name: Ventura Dream
runners.comment: Flopped at Nottingham last time and he needs to bounce back in new headgear
runners.spotlight: Made a good start in handicaps when making all at Southwell (1m) in February, but mixed results in three runs since and he flopped at Nottingham two weeks ago; Thiscouldbefun took him on for the lead in that race but he finished tailed off and needs to bounce in new headgear.

runners.name: Ruling Master
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden who struggled at Yarmouth last time and headgear is now added
runners.spotlight: Respectable third on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) in December, but he's been well held in both runs since including a 13l defeat at Yarmouth (first run since gelded) ten days ago; record now stands at 0-7 and needs a major revival back at this trip; blinkers added.

runners.name: Thiscouldbefun
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore
runners.comment: Won at Bath on her penultimate run and still looks on a workable mark; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 13 starts but that came at Bath (1m, good to firm) last month; held in fifth in follow-up bid at Nottingham but she got involved in a front-running duel with Ventura Dream and was only beaten around 4l in the end; still looks on a workable mark and has claims if things go more to plan this time.

stable_tour.quote: Coulsty has been doing well and has produced a couple of nice two-year-olds. She's got plenty of size and scope like most of mine. She's only a couple of weeks off a run. The jockeys who have ridden her absolutely love her but she'll be your seven-furlong type of horse. 04-07-24

runners.name: Barrys Boy
runners.comment: 0-6 but he's run three promising races in handicaps and still has potential; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden but he's run three promising races in handicaps including when fourth on his Doncaster reappearance (1m, good) three weeks ago; that was an eyecatching effort from off the pace and he looks interesting off 1lb lower.

runners.name: Miss Calvados
runners.owner: Guy Pariente Hold & Tars Farm Equestrian
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but she needs a transformation back in trip with headgear added
runners.spotlight: Struggled in her three qualifying runs including when tailed off at Chelmsford (1m2f) in March; still early days and now goes handicapping but she needs a transformation back in trip after another break; headgear added.

runners.name: Blue Train
runners.comment: Had near-miss over C&D last month and he's a big player if he can recapture that form
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who never got involved at Doncaster last Saturday, but he had some traffic issues and that was after a near-miss in a C&D handicap (good to firm) last month; only 1lb higher and he's a big player if he can recapture that form.

runners.name: Live Each Day
runners.comment: Finished well to win on handicap debut at Southwell and she's only gone up 1lb; respected
runners.spotlight: Well held in first three starts but she looked a different proposition on handicap debut when finishing well to score at Southwell (7f, AW) last month; that was in a tight four-way finish but she's only gone up 1lb and is open to more progress at this new trip; respected.

6:30.race_name: Sporting Times Sri Lanka Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Risky Spin
runners.comment: Struggled in two bumpers and has plenty to prove now switched to the Flat for new yard
runners.spotlight: Disappointing at odds-on in his first bumper in November and was pulled up in the second one the following month; left Andrew Balding since and has plenty to prove now switched to the Flat for new yard.

runners.name: Leonidass
runners.comment: Some ability in his last bumper but that form is ordinary and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Tailed off and pulled up in his first two bumpers during the winter; returned after wind surgery with a better effort at Huntingdon (2m, good) last month but he still finished sixth of seven and that form is ordinary; best watched on Flat debut.

runners.name: Slack Alice
runners.comment: Some promise in bumpers but was well held at a big price on Flat debut (1m4f) last week
runners.spotlight: Mildly progressive in her first three bumpers before being well beaten at 125-1 in a Grade 2 at Aintree last month; sent off at another big price on Flat debut at Kempton (1m4f, AW) last week and she never got involved before finishing a well-held fifth of seven; opposable.

runners.name: Little Saver
runners.comment: Ran green at Chester but he showed some promise behind a smart prospect; interesting
runners.spotlight: Â£22,000 yearling; dam a half-sister to winners Sam Missile (1m-2m) and Marciano (6f-1m), out of 7f 2yo Group 2 winner; ran green when well-held fifth on recent Chester debut (10.3f, good) but he made some late gains and that was behind a smart prospect; should know much more this time and he's an interesting contender upped in trip.

runners.name: Maraaheb
runners.comment: Key player of his second at Lingfield (1m4f) last month and he's respected on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Improved on his debut fourth at Wolverhampton when runner-up at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) last month; didn't build on that at Chelmsford (1m2f) last time but he wasn't beaten far and he's a key player in this ordinary race; respected back up in trip on turf debut.

runners.name: Doddington Guy
runners.comment: Has shown ability but he has something to find here and handicaps are an option after this
runners.spotlight: No match for the first two when 33-1 third on Wolverhampton debut (1m4f) last month; got closer to the target at Catterick (1m4f, good to firm) next time but was still on fifth of six and he has something to find.

runners.name: Port George
runners.comment: 40-1 on Beverley debut (1m2f) last month and he finished tailed off in seventh of ten
runners.spotlight: 40-1 on Beverley debut (1m2f, good) last month and he finished tailed off in seventh of ten; passed over.

runners.name: Bomba Del Mundo
runners.comment: Half-sister to a useful middle-distance winner; needs watching in market on debut
runners.spotlight: 12,000euros foal, 18,000gns yearling; second foal; half-sister to 1m2f/10.3f winner Rebaatt (RPR 92); dam 7f/1m maiden (63), closely related to US 1m/8.5f winner Alsinaafy, half-sister to useful 1m winner Terwada, out of Irish 1,000 Guineas winner; doesn't have a great standard to aim at on debut and she needs watching in market; tongue-tie on.

runners.name: Masolar
runners.comment: Quite a bit to like on paper and interesting to see how she figures in market
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam 1m4f AW winner (RPR 80), closely related to Australian 1m/1m2f winner Auspirit, half-sister to 1m2f Listed winner Windhoek, out of Listed-placed 7f-1m2f winner; quite a bit to like on paper and interesting to see how she figures in market.

runners.name: Phaedra
runners.comment: Easy win when upped to 1m4f at Chepstow on Wednesday and she's well treated under penalty
runners.spotlight: Big improvement upped to 1m4f when justifying favouritism with a easy win at Chepstow (good; 2-1) on Wednesday; that was only her fourth handicap and she looks well treated under a penalty for that 6l success; strong claims.

quotes.race: DragonBet Proud Sponsors Of Chepstow Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Phaedra is very straightforward, so it just made sense to go forward and see what happened. As it turned out, I was in front, and nobody wanted to take me on - Sean Levey, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Pistrucci
runners.comment: Six-race maiden and he needs improvement with cheekpieces added at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has not really progressed and he's finished a well-held sixth in his two runs (8.3f/1m2f) this season; continues to drop down the weights but he needs improvement with cheekpieces added at this new trip.

runners.name: Squires Treaty
runners.comment: 0-11 but he's been placed in last two starts and looks worth a try at this new trip
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but was runner-up in two AW handicaps in January and he's finished placed on turf (1m2f, good to firm) in his last two starts; edging back up the weights but he got crowded out in the closing stages at Newmarket last time and he looks worth a try at this new trip; in the mix.

runners.name: Nelson Gate
runners.comment: Still early days but he needs a transformation on his step up to this trip; blinkers added
runners.spotlight: Struggled in his three qualifying runs in the autumn and same story when ninth of ten on recent handicap debut at Goodwood (1m2f, good; first run since gelded); still early days but he needs a transformation on his step up to this trip; blinkers added.

runners.name: Gretna Dreams
runners.owner: J Sarkar, D Sarkar, O Sarkar & D Sarkar
runners.comment: Made some late gains on Yarmouth reappearance and is a possible improver at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Caused a 40-1 surprise when dead-heating on nursery debut (9.5f, AW) last September; has not gone on from that in three runs since, but she made some late gains on her reappearance at Yarmouth (1m2f, good to firm) and looks a possible improver at this new trip.

runners.name: Queen Sansa
runners.owner: J W Parry And Mrs C Shekells
runners.comment: Rallying second on handicap debut Brighton and she's in the mix now upped to this trip
runners.spotlight: Favourite on handicap debut at Brighton (1m2f, good to firm) two weeks ago and she rallied to finish a respectable second of five; on unchanged mark and this unexposed filly looks interesting on her step up to this trip.

runners.name: Argentum
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but she needs plenty of progress upped in trip after a break
runners.spotlight: Struggled at big prices in three novice events at Chelmsford (1m/1m2f) early this year; this is more realistic on handicap debut but she still needs plenty of progress on this switch to turf.

6:00.race_name: Sporting Times Sri Lanka EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)

runners.name: Angel Of Anfield
runners.comment: Sets good standard on his debut fifth at Ascot and is open to progress upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Harry Angel colt who made a promising start when a close fifth of 13 in useful conditions event at Ascot (5f, good to firm) last month; sets a good standard on that form and he's open to progress on this step up in trip; key player.

stable_tour.quote: He's come out of Ascot [fifth behind Wise Approach] really well and I think it was a particularly strong race. That was a nice performance and he wants 6f at least. There's a restricted novice at York at the end of the month or a race at Windsor in June, both over 6f. I think he's crying out for that trip. Rossa Ryan was taken with him and I think he'll be a lovely horse. Of my juveniles, he's precocious and it nearly came off at Ascot. 14-05-25

runners.name: Born Slippy
runners.comment: Left his debut form well behind when runner-up at Chepstow; respected upped to 6f
runners.spotlight: Didn't live up to market expectations on Wolverhampton debut but he left that form well behind when runner-up at Chepstow (5f, good) 11 days ago; still looked inexperienced in that race but he kept on well in the closing stages and this step up in trip looks a good move; respected.

runners.name: King Of Chaos
runners.comment: 40,000gns half-brother to smart 7f-1m winner Rhoscolyn; market informative on debut
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns breeze-up 2yo; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Rhoscolyn (Listed-placed 7f-1m including 2yo; RPR 111), Piper Arrow (1m AW; 86) and La Feile (5f 2yo/7f; 76); dam 1m winner (88), out of 6f 2yo winner; has good target to aim at on debut but needs checking in market.

runners.name: Mwaki
runners.comment: Well-held fourth of five on Kempton debut and he's probably one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: Took a strong hold and he faded into a well-held fourth of five on recent Kempton debut (5f, AW); stablemate of Born Slippy and he's probably one for further down the line.

runners.name: Regional Rock
runners.comment: First foal of a Group-placed 1m winner; needs a close look on debut
runners.spotlight: February foal; first foal; dam Group-placed 1m winner (RPR 96), closely related to 6f Listed winner Great Ambassador, half-sister to 7f winner Snow Squaw, out of 1m/1m4f Listed winner; yard 24% with 2yos last year and he needs a close look on debut.

runners.name: Silver State
runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how he figures in market
runners.spotlight: February foal; 42,000gns half-brother to four winners including Dutch Kingdom (6f-8.6f AW; RPR 98), Seas Of Wells (6f; 92) and Kimblewick (1m AW 2yo; 85); dam 7f winner (82), closely related to 6f 2yo Group 1 winner Damson; plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how he figures in market.

runners.name: Superstorm
runners.comment: This looks a tough enough starting point and he could be a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: 46,000gns yearling; third foal; half-brother to 1m4f AW winner Trojan Storm (RPR 79) and a winner abroad; dam unraced sister to 1m Listed winner Solar Magic, half-sister to 7f 2yo winner/1,000 Guineas second Starscope (dam of top 1m/1m2f performer Inspiral); this looks a tough enough starting point and he could be a longer-term prospect.

runners.name: White Ladder
runners.comment: 60,000gns yearling; has plenty of speed in pedigree and he's an interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: May foal; 40,000gns foal, 60,000gns yearling; half-brother to winners Beautiful Diamond (5f including 2yo/Listed; RPR 107) and Brazen Idol (6f; 83); dam unplaced 5f 2yo (44), half-sister to Listed-placed 2yo winners Sabre (5f) and Wave Aside (6f); has plenty of speed in pedigree and he's an interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Steel Drum
runners.comment: Made a low-key start at Chepstow (5f) and he needs to leave that form a long way behind
runners.spotlight: Ran green after a slow start and was never involved at Chepstow (cheekpieces applied) 11 days ago; should know more on this step up in trip but he needs to leave that initial form a long way behind.

runners.name: Barry The Worm
runners.comment: Has good standard to aim at on debut and is best watched unless market suggests otherwise
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to Italian 6f 2yo/7.5f winner Quentin; dam Italian Listed-placed 7.5f winner, out of 1m winning half-sister to 5f 2yo Group 2 winner/good broodmare Superstar Leo; has good standard to aim at on debut and is best watched.

runners.name: Calabrian Soldato
runners.comment: Bred for speed but he will need to be useful to make a serious impact on debut
runners.spotlight: 12,000euros yearling; sixth foal; half-brother to 5f/6f winner Teddy Boy (RPR 67); dam 5f AW 2yo winner (71), sister to Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner Siena Gold, half-sister to 5f/6f Listed winner Balmont Mast; bred for speed but he will need to be useful to make a serious impact on debut.

runners.name: Torbay
runners.comment: Out of 6f 2yo/7f winner; stable in decent form but they aren't renowned for 2yo success
runners.spotlight: March foal; third foal out of a 6f 2yo/7f AW winner (RPR 95); yard is in decent form but they aren't renowned for 2yo success (0-14 in last last five seasons).

runners.name: Dubai Time
runners.comment: Made an encouraging start behind impressive winner at Chester; not ruled out upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Time Test filly who cost 20,000gns as a yearling; finished a 5l fifth at Chester (5.5f, good) two weeks ago but that was an encouraging start behind an impressive stablemate who went off at odds-on; should know more this time and she's not ruled out upped in trip.

7:00.race_name: Sri Lanka The Wonder Of Asia Handicap

runners.name: Pont Neuf
runners.comment: Won his first two starts as a 2yo but he's 0-7 since and others are more convincing
runners.spotlight: Won his first two starts as a 2yo but he's 0-7 since; has had some tough assignments but he's been in handicaps in last four runs and has not finished closer than fifth; mark continues to fall but he was disappointing at Doncaster last time and needs a lot more back up in trip; cheekpieces added.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Super Sprint [at Newbury on July 20] the obvious target for Pont Neuf. He's talented but a little bit quirky, so we need to manage him. It's difficult to give away a penalty but experience probably helped him on this ground - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet/EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C & D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mentally Pont Neuf isn't as straightforward as the one who won for me at Chelmsford on Friday. He has the ability to flip, but had never done that [was tricky before the race] at home. I've nothing in mind for him as I don't know if he'd cope with Chester's May meeting - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Far Above The Law
runners.comment: Generally consistent last season and could go well with Ripon reappearance under his belt
runners.spotlight: All turf runs have been on good/good good to firm; won a Chepstow maiden (6f) last July and he ran well to finish third in handicaps in his final three runs last season; shaped as though he needed the run on Ripon reappearance last month and he's in the mix on this drop back in grade.

runners.name: Kinswoman
runners.comment: Clear promise in maidens this spring and she's an interesting contender on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the Lockinge winner Audience; has shown clear promise in three maidens this spring, including with a front-running third at Doncaster (7f, good to firm) last month; looks on fair mark now switched to a handicap and she's an interesting contender back in trip.

runners.name: Toy Soldier
runners.comment: Record of 1-10 and isn't straightforward; comes with risks attached back in trip
runners.spotlight: Won a Musselburgh maiden (7f, good to firm) last August but holds weak claims on subsequent handicap form and isn't straightforward (can pull hard and he missed the break last time); record is now 1-10 and he comes with risks attached back in trip.

runners.name: Fleetwater
runners.owner: Ms H N Pinniger And Partner
runners.comment: Her win was over C&D and was an eyecatching fourth back here last time; dangerous
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D novice (good to firm) on her second 2yo run; 0-7 since but was runner-up at Kempton last month before an eyecatching fourth back over C&D last time; now drops back into a Class 5 event and she could have a big role play.

quotes.race: EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C-D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fleetwater was tough towards the line. Her experience definitely benefited her and she won well. She was still a bit raw and she'll keep on learning as she goes up through the grades. Six [furlongs] will be the bottom end of her trip as well - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She'll probably run within the next fortnight. With all trainers, not just me, the weather's played havoc. You'd have days when you thought, this is nice, the heat's coming, and then the next day it's like the middle of winter. It's played havoc with their routine and their coming in their coats. It's been a bit of a nightmare year with two-year-olds. 04-07-24

runners.name: Massimo Blue
runners.comment: Kempton winner who is still unexposed and he needs watching in market on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when landing a Kempton maiden (6f, AW) in February and he had some traffiic issues on his handicap debut at Southwell (fifth of ten) in March; still unexposed after only five starts and needs watching in market on this switch to turf.

runners.name: Dream Out Loud
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut at Kempton and he's open to more progress; respected on turf debut
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three novice/maiden events and he made an immediate impact in handicaps when scoring at Kempton (6f, AW) last month; up 6lb but that was a major step forward last time and he's open to more progress; respected on turf debut.

runners.name: Valsharah
runners.comment: 0-10 but he's found some consistency and was placed over C&D latest; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Free-going sort who is 0-10 but he's found some consistency having produced form figures of 44333 in his last five handicaps; on same mark as for his third in a big field over C&D (good to firm) last time and has each-way claims again.

runners.name: Claim That Smile
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but he needs a transformation with tongue-tie added on his return
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three AW runs, most recently when last of ten at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in February; still early days and now goes handicapping but he needs a transformation on his return; tongue-tie added.

quotes.race: Stockholm Cup International (Group 3) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We had a smooth start, but found trouble in running,  we got stopped turning for home, and Hard One To Please got me out of trouble - if he had been beaten it would have been my fault. With a clean run he would have won by two or three lengths. He is a very good horse - I hope I can come back and ride him again next year - Pat Cosgrave, jockey.

quotes.race: Prix Greffulhe (Group 3) (3yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Christophe was very happy with Greenland. He said he got there and waited a little bit. He said he'd like better ground and that he felt like a horse with plenty of class and he thought that he was a French Derby horse - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did well last season, winning a Group 3 at Saint-Cloud. He's in good shape and he's ready to start back now but we'll wait for some nice ground to get him going. 03-04-24

3:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Comanche Brave
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Mrs A M Obrien
runners.comment: Beaten 0.5l by Henri Matisse on return in 7f Leopardstown Group 3; plenty to find here
runners.spotlight: Big step forward from debut when bolting up on fast ground in 6f Cork maiden last September; second in 7f Listed at Dundalk next time; soundly beaten in Group 3 at Leopardstown in October; beaten 0.5l by Henri Matisse on return in 7f Leopardstown Group 3; plenty to find in this lineup.

runners.name: Cosmic Year
runners.comment: Looked a high-class performer when winning 7f Listed at Newmarket; form has been franked
runners.spotlight: One of three for Juddmonte; three wins from three, having recorded impressive wins in 7f novice events at Sandown (good) and Kempton (AW); looked a potentially high-class performer when overcoming quirkiness to win 7f Listed at Newmarket (good) on latest; both the third and sixth have won Listed-class races since; contender.

quotes.race: TrustATrader King Charles II Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The race didn't pan out exactly as you would have wanted ? the two to his right split right and Ryan [Moore] said he thought they were all going to go that way and they didn't. I wish Cosmic Year's had gone and followed them as I think he would have been more impressive if he had had that lead to the one pole. He has not handled the dip perfectly but Ryan liked the way he knuckled down in the final furlong - Harry Charlton, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was as good as we could have hoped for. They went slow and Cosmic Year has such a good temperament to take it all in his stride. We'll have to speak to the Juddmonte team about plans as they have a lot of other horses, like Jonquil and Field Of Gold. There's a few horses in the mix so we'll let the dust settle. I would be a little wary ? as I was with Newbury this weekend ? of running him on quick ground. The weather will change at some point but if it stays dry through the month it feels like it could be a bit of a tough ask. The French and Irish Guineas are other options, as well as different routes into Royal Ascot, but we'll see what the team want to do. It's massively important to have these kind of horses in the yard and to be able to deliver for a proper operation like Juddmonte is essential - Harry Charlton, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Sir Michael Stoute - Farewell And Thank You Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll go home and see what Barry [Mahon, Juddmonte's racing manager] wants to do. I'm sure Juddmonte are struggling to fit all their horses in the stakes races. We wanted to run Cosmic Year at Newbury in July but we took him out because the ground was too quick. He went away and lost a bit of weight going to the races so we didn't want to rush him. We waited for a couple of weeks, then there wasn't a suitable race, so we came here. Having not had a run, it would've been hard to enter him in those better races - Harry Charlton, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Expanded
runners.comment: Disappointed as Ballydoyle's sole contender for the 2,000 Guineas; too early to write off
runners.spotlight: Narrow win on debut here (7f, good) last October before mighty run in the Group 1 Dewhurst (7f, soft) at Newmarket just a week later, beaten only a neck by Shadow Of Light having raced apart from the winner; disappointed when Ballydoyle's sole contender for the 2,000 Guineas on return but it's too early to write him off.

quotes.race: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Expanded has run a great race considering we only ran him at the Curragh seven days ago but Ryan said that if James Doyle hadn't attacked him early on Ancient Truth he would have won. He was here for experience more than anything, to run against The Lion In Winter originally, but we've always liked him and he went to the Curragh on the back of five pieces of work. As we know he handles the track, he could be back here next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Expanded is a lovely horse with loads of class but still very raw. When he puts everything together he is going to be a smashing colt - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He got beat a short head in the Dewhurst having got kind of a raw deal. He was going into the race for experience mainly as second string behind The Lion In Winter, but that horse didn't run and he got put into the front line, so it was a massive run on his second start. He's being trained for Guineas weekend but he could go to the Curragh for the Tetrarch the day after the Guineas if he doesn't go to Newmarket. If Twain goes to Newmarket, he might take the easier option at the Curragh, given he's not a Group winner. 07-04-25

runners.name: Field Of Gold
runners.comment: Wasn't seen to best effect in 2,000 Guineas; now gets services of the Irish champion rider
runners.spotlight: Two wins from four in 2yo campaign, including Group 3 Solario Stakes at Sandown (7f, good); displayed considerable improvement on reappearance when impressive in the Group 3 Craven at Newmarket (1m, good) last month; wasn't seen to best effect when runner-up as favourite in 2,000 Guineas; now gets the services of the Irish champion jockey; the one to beat.

quotes.race: Betfred 2000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: The race wasn't probably run in the fractions of the Craven Stakes and we were sat some way back. The winner has kicked and gone and we ran out of racetrack. Given another 25 yards the race would have been ours.    You'll probably find Field Of Gold has run a better race than he did in the trial but a trial is a trial. When this track gets fast like this it can ride slick with a crosstail wind and they can get away from you. It just got away from us, I'm afraid, as we came into the Dip from where he was clawing the ground back. I could see it was lost going into the Dip as we were just too far back and the winner got first run. We'll talk with the family about where we go next but I think you're looking at a St James's Palace Stakes after that - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Craven Stakes (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: This is a trial, it's not the Guineas. You're not fully wound up for this, the race now puts them where you want them - that's the idea of the trial. He went to his girth and had a good blow, but then he's entitled to. Field Of Gold did it in splendid style and it's nice to race on some really good ground today and he just flew off it. It would be nice to win, but it's not something you necessarily worry about - I don't think about it at all. I suppose Kingman was slightly unfortunate as he went four lengths clear and thought he'd done enough and got caught late on by a very good horse in Night Of Thunder, who has become a top stallion. It's lovely to have a horse going for the Guineas and it's great for Juddmonte, because they have both the winner of the Greenham and this, so they're double-handed if they want to. But the family will decide whether one goes there and one goes to France or what we do - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Jean-Luc Lagardere (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (New Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Fields Of Gold ran a solid race. He was right up there and travelled well but got a little bit caught out by the ground. He's a big, strapping horse and very much a next-year horse - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Solario Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Field Of Gold is very exciting. He's always shown great potential at home and it's nice to see him finally deliver it on the track. He's a horse who will stay a mile but he has acceleration and a very good turn of foot. He's a big horse - 16 hands - and is going to be better as he strengthens and will hopefully make a better three-year-old. The LagardÃ¨re looks the obvious plan at this stage - Barry Mahon, Juddmonte racing manager.

quotes.race: Weatherbys British EBF Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Field Of Gold has taken a big step forward, albeit he probably ran in a nice race at Doncaster. He was slowly away that day but he was quick today and I was just trying to get a lead for as long as I could. We hit the front a long way out but he knew his job today and he's got a huge stride and plenty of scope. He really galloped out and he's no doubt going to stay a mile - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: Hotazhell
runners.comment: Talented & handles any ground but will need to be sharp on return tackling race-fit rivals
runners.spotlight: Second to Henri Matisse in last year's Futurity at this track but stepped up on that effort when winning the Beresford over C&D (good to yielding) and the Group 1 Futurity at Doncaster (1m, soft) when seeing off Delacroix (2-2 since) by a nose; clearly very talented and handles any ground but will need to be sharp on return tackling race-fit rivals.

quotes.race: William Hill Futurity Trophy Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Hotazhell is  a smashing horse, he's very tough and he loves a battle. I don't think he'll ever win races by large margins, he loves just looking at the other horse and saying 'I'm better than you'.  He's a little bit feisty, he ain't called Hotazhell for nothing.   I'd say he'll start off over a mile and take it from there. He'll probably stay a mile and a quarter. I'm not sure he'll stay a mile and a half but you never know, he's a very relaxed horse and he just might.  He's done very well, he's won a Group 3, a Group 2 and now a Group 1. That's just the start of his career hopefully and he'll go on next year and get better - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Montane Developments Beresford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I knew the step up in trip was always going to be an advantage to Hotazhell as was the slower ground - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.  He got a bit free coming down the hill but today Hotazhell came around a bend and did it well. When he gets to the front he pricks his ears and doesn't really do that much. He's straightforward at home but when we come racing we saddle him in the racecourse stables rather than the saddling boxes and keep a red hood on him just to keep the lid on him. He'll go to Doncaster - Jessica Harrington, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Japan Racing Association Tyros Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Hotazhell is a nice colt. They went a good gallop and he picked up well. He is tough and he just does enough. We might go for a nice race over 1m in September - Jessica Harrington, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's due to do a big bit of work in a few days and if all goes well he'll head to Longchamp for the French 2,000 Guineas [May 11]. He's got the most brilliant attitude - he hates being beaten and never wants to be passed. He's got lots of talent and I think Longchamp will suit him. He's been around a bend at Leopardstown and the Curragh, so he should be fine at Longchamp. He'll wear his customary red hood to the start. 23-04-25

runners.name: Officer
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Impressive winner of C&D Listed contest (good) 19 days ago; can improve; big player
runners.spotlight: Brother to last year's smart middle-distance filly Wingspan; dam Hydrangea top-class at up to 1m4f; snug winner of maiden here on debut (7f, good) last summer and acquitted himself well on seasonal return when third over same trip in Listed Gladness Stakes here in March; impressive winner of C&D Listed contest (good) 19 days ago; big player.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Henry Longfellow Irish EBF Tetrarch Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with Officer. He had a lovely run first time back in the Gladness and won very nicely here as a two-year-old. Ryan [Moore] was delighted they went a good gallop and he said he learned plenty about him. I'd think the Irish Guineas looks perfect for him. He's a great shape of a horse, really mature and strong - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud The Antarctic Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Officer is a quick horse and he relaxes. He looks like a nice colt, he is compact and strong. He did well, he got a position and quickens. This trip is a very comfortable one for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with his run when third in the Gladness, especially for a very green horse who had run just once last year. We'll have a look at the Tetrarch with him and possibly one of the Guineas. 07-04-25

runners.name: Rashabar
runners.comment: Twice second in Group 1s last year after Royal Ascot win but likely to come up short here
runners.spotlight: Developed well as a 2yo with runner-up finishes in Group 1 races at Deauville (6f, good to soft) and Longchamp (7f, soft), showing that his 80-1 success in the Coventry (good to firm) was no fluke; found an improver too good in Group 3 Greenham at Newbury (7f) on return; should relish the extra furlong but likely to come up short.

quotes.race: Watership Down Stud Too Darn Hot Greenham Stakes (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I think Rashabar needed the run a little bit. Sean said he was doing all the things he wouldn't have necessarily wanted to do. There was no real pace around us so we had to get on and go forward. - Brian Meehan, trainer.

quotes.race: Sumbe Prix Morny (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: No disrespect to the winner, you can never say anything like that, but if we'd had the rail I think Rashabar would have won. It was a really good, solid run and the horse is progressing, as it's one of the toughest Prix Mornys I've seen in a number of years. I've won the race twice and this horse is better [than Bad As I Wanna Be and Arcano]. What I really want to do is take him to the Breeders' Cup. I think he'll travel well and we'll work from that - Brian Meehan, trainer.

quotes.race: Coventry Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Rashabar is a lovely horse. Chester was a little disappointing but he missed the break and I think without that he'd have won. The form has worked out well, he'd been training so well at home and the team has done a tremendous job - Brian Meehan, trainer.

runners.name: Scorthy Champ
runners.owner: Rectory Road Holdings Limited & B Fowler & Mrs A M Obrien

prev_owners.owner: Rectory Road Holdings Limited & B Fowler & Mrs A M O'Brien
Rectory Road Holdings Limited & B Fowler & Mrs A M O'Brien

runners.comment: Possibly stretched by this trip when seventh in 2,000 Guineas on return, weakening late
runners.spotlight: Inexperience evident when 2l third of four in Group 2 Futurity here (7f, good) last August on his second start; more professional when winning Group 1 National Stakes here (7f, good) in September by a neck from Henri Matisse; possibly stretched by this trip when seventh in 2,000 Guineas on return, weakening late on; others preferred.

quotes.race: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: I thought it was very impressive and Dylan said Scorthy Champ idled in front, and that he is a top-notcher. I don't know what he will do next but if I was to guess, I'd say he will run again this season. I see him more as a miler so the Prix Lagardere or the Breeders' Cup are options - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Scorthy Champ is a horse we liked and is well-bred. I thought he was very impressive. Dylan said he was a bit green early so he took his time and when he got a bit of room he opened up really well. The obvious thing would be to return here for the Tyros Stakes - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was obviously a real high-class two-year-old, winning two of his three starts and putting in a high-class performance in the National Stakes. He was probably as good a two-year-old as we've had and the plan is to start off in the 2,000 Guineas at Newmarket. He has a very high cruising speed and we think there's a good chance he'll handle the track at Newmarket, which would mean he goes there as one of the realistic contenders in what it's fair to say is an open race. We see him as a miler at the moment, but he could drop back to seven furlongs at some stage if we wanted as he's got buckets of pace. 24-04-25

runners.name: Windlord
runners.comment: Runner-up in Classic Trial at Sandown on return; doesn't have the form to be considered
runners.spotlight: Significant improvement every time in four-race 2yo campaign, including landing York novice (1m, good to soft) and close third of five behind Hotazhell in Group 2 at this track (1m, good to yielding); hung left all the way up the straight when runner-up in Classic Trial at Sandown (1m2f, good) on return; hard to fancy; cheekpieces.

quotes.race: British European Breeders Fund Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Windlord has been delighting us in his bits of work at home and we were hoping he'd bring it to the track today, which he did. He really hit the line and it's lovely training well-bred horses for Juddmonte. A jockey riding like Oisin (Murphy) is at the moment is very helpful. He was very complimentary afterwards so I think we'll look for something better now. He's in the Royal Lodge, but we'll see about that - Anna Lisa Balding, wife of trainer.

3:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Big Gossey
runners.comment: All 8 turf wins here and Listed winner in March but Group 2 level probably too hot
runners.spotlight: All eight of his turf wins have come at this venue and as good as ever when landing a Listed race here in March; however, not as good twice since and Group 2 level is probably a bit hot for him these days.

quotes.race: Lester Piggott Gladness Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I thought seven furlongs might find Big Gossey out, if it was six furlongs I think he would have won easy. Billy said he was just hanging on desperately. An eight-year-old on that ground against three-year-olds, it doesn't matter how much weight they are giving away, it's very hard for young horses to take on a battle-hardened horse like him. Gary O'Brien, who leads him up, does 90 per cent of the work with him and he just occasionally gives him a pipe opener and lunges him and doesn't have to do much with him. When he arrived in the door, I never thought he'd be doing this! A Gutaifan that couldn't be sold without much of a pedigree. Apparently he might come back here! Today was his 40th start at the track - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavalor Equine Nutrition Race
quotes.quote: Big Gossey got in well at the conditions and it's a perfect sort of race for him. He is in terrific form and we might find a race for him at Dundalk before next year - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: David Power Memorial Premier Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey has been great for my career. I was delighted to see the rain as he thrives with a bit of an ease. He just loves it here. I would have loved something to bring me a bit further but I wanted to get rolling on him and not let something get first run - Robert Whearty, rider.

quotes.race: Sheehy Motors Volkswagen Race
quotes.quote: Big Gossey has been a great horse to me this season, he's a legend. He hit the line well when he won the Bold Lad, and over that ground and trip, I didn't think the seven would be a problem - Robert Whearty, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Bold Lad" Sprint Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey was a bit unlucky the last day when he missed the break. I travelled into it lovely and got a lovely run up the rail. He had a bit of a look when he got there but he stayed going - Robert Whearty, rider.

quotes.race: AK Bets "Higher Limits, Better Prices" Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey is getting better as the year goes on and he loves it up the Curragh. I'm delighted that he's after getting his head in front today. I always thought six was his ideal trip but a fast run five like that suits him down to the ground - Danny Sheehy, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Bold Lad" Sprint Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey travelled throughout and picked up well. I was probably there a bit early but he saw it out. He has plenty of speed and did everything right - Michael Hussey, jockey.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey came on from the last run. They went a good strong gallop which suited him and he settled lovely. When I gave him a squeeze he picked up really well. He toughed it out to the line so I'm very happy with him - Danny Sheehy, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey is a horse that's improving every week and there's more improvement in him again. He's an out-and-out sprinter - Mick Hussey, rider

runners.name: Grand Grey
runners.comment: Went close in Longchamp Gr 3; back to form on yard debut, narrowly denied at Newmarket
runners.spotlight: Went close in a Group 3 at Longchamp last season before a no-show in the Abbaye but ran a huge race on yard debut when beaten half a length by a well-backed French rival in the Group 3 Abernant Stakes at Newmarket; should be a major player if he comes on for that, although wouldn't want to get too far behind at this venue.

runners.name: Iberian
runners.comment: Ran around when 2nd in Cammidge Trophy; needs more and may want it softer
runners.spotlight: Ran around before getting a bump in the Cammidge Trophy at Doncaster, finishing runner-up and confirming he was back to his best; probably needs another step forward to prevail here and may want conditions a bit softer than what is likely.

quotes.race: Betfred Champagne Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: That's just what the doctor ordered, I think Iberian is a very exciting horse. Tom said he gave him some feel, he has an electric turn of foot. He put the race to bed very well. His work had been unbelievable at home and we just wanted to show what he can do on the racecourse and I think he's done that today. He learned plenty at Goodwood, he was drawn one there and William was conscious of teaching him to race properly. He got a little out of his ground that day and was a bit inexperienced, on and off the bridle, but he finished well. The ground is still pretty soft and when the ground's a bit quicker you might see a bit better horse. Hopefully he'll run in the Dewhurst and why shouldn't he be a Guineas horse? He'll get a mile no problem, there's plenty of stamina on the dam's side. And he has a great attitude, he does everything so professionally at home - Charlie Hills, trainer.

quotes.race: Nicholson Gin Vintage Stakes (Group 2) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Iberian is a really nice horse and William was very impressed by him. He was drawn nine and we were patient, but he's run a great race. We'll probably look at the Champagne Stakes now and, if he goes well there, we'll probably go to the Dewhurst. William said the softer surface just blunted his speed, although he did pick up. I'm just pleased he's stepped up to that level and I've always held him in high regard - he's a good horse for the future. He could be a Guineas horse all being well and it's nice to know he can compete in these races - Charlie Hills, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I wanted to run him in the Greenham at Newbury on Saturday but the ground will be too soft, so we'll bypass that and he'll instead go to Newmarket for a racecourse gallop this week. I've been delighted with him. He looks fantastic in his coat and has wintered brilliantly. He trains like a very good horse, so there should be exciting times ahead. He won the Champagne Stakes at Doncaster, where he beat two subsequent Group 1 winners on soft ground, but he's different class on a faster surface when he works at home. He's got huge potential and shows so much speed, so a mile will probably be as far as he wants to go. This gallop will take a bit of freshness out of him, but the day out will do him the world of good too. After that, I expect him to run in a Guineas somewhere, depending on the ground and weather. 17-04-24

He's a lovely colt. His work had been very encouraging in recent weeks and I felt he was good enough to start off at Newbury last week, although we considered the Chesham at Royal Ascot, such was the impression we had. I knew it would take a good horse to beat him last week and so it proved. He was very green in the early stages but really picked up when Rossa [Ryan] asked him to lengthen. We'll see how he gets over those exertions before making further plans, but he has a bright future and you'd expect him to get further. 21-06-23

runners.name: Jamess Delight
runners.comment: Listed winner last term; hasn't hit those heights in 2 runs this term
runners.spotlight: Listed winner at Deauville last summer and was only narrowly denied in a Group 3 back there in August; hasn't hit those heights in two runs this term and looks up against it.

quotes.race: Barriere Prix de Meautry (Group 3) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: James's Delight enjoys the soft ground and we have an entry in the Champions Day Sprint. We're forecast some hotter temperatures so we'll play our cards accordingly - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Churchill Tyres Supporting Macmillan Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: That was wonderful, I'm so pleased. It was a very confident ride from Ryan, as always. The way that he changed gear there today fills me full of excitement. James's Delight does appreciate the ground, although he won on good ground on Guineas day at Newmarket he prefers this end of the scale.  We'll see how he comes back before we think of the Wokingham but winning today means he'll have a penalty and that will be on top of a mark of 102 so we'll see. But he's clearly a three-year-old going places - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Bet In-Running Handicap
quotes.quote: James's Delight did that well. Last time over seven furlongs was a bit of a non event and he enjoyed this trip of six furlongs a lot better - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won the same Listed race at Deauville last year that Harry Angel won in 2022 and had a similarly progressive campaign. He ran well at Doncaster first time out this season when getting into a bit of a pickle in the latter stages of the race. He wouldn't want the ground too firm. 17-04-25

He put up a pleasing performance to win at Newbury last month on his debut in the colours of Paul and Clare Rooney, who we've had some great days with in the past. James's Delight is out of a Pivotal mare and I thought that may count on his debut where the ground was on the soft side. He showed a great attitude and I was impressed with his positive response in the closing stages. He has qualified for the Goffs sales race at Naas in Ireland later on and we will obviously seriously consider that option. He is a horse to look forward to. 02-08-23

runners.name: Lethal Levi

prev_owners.owner: J A Knox and Mrs M A Knox

runners.comment: Last season's Ayr Gold Cup winner; behind Grand Grey on return; beaten 1l in h'cap since
runners.spotlight: Last season's Ayr Gold Cup winner but was behind Grand Grey on return at Newmarket; only beaten roughly 1l in subsequent Heritage Handicap but this demands a career-best.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Lethal Levi has been unbelievable since we put the headgear on, that was at least a Listed performance if not a Group 3 performance. I'm delighted for Cliff and the owners - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: TPT Fire Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a great performance. It wasn't the initial plan to come here. Lethal Levi has been pretty busy. He got knocked over at Goodwood and would have been closer to the placed horses. He's jumping cleaner with blinkers on, having been giving races away. Clifford gets along with him well and when he had an easy lead like that, I knew he'd run well, but wasn't sure if he'd hang on like that. This time of the year, you don't have to overdo it with these older horses at home. He's a brilliant old horse and will probably head for the Ayr Gold Cup - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I was thinking of stepping Lethal Levi up to seven but I thought it was too good a prize not to have a go at. I thought my other horse (Aasser) had the better chance if I'm truthful. This horse is on an upward curve, he never runs a bad race and that was probably a career best for him. Jimmy said he was travelling so I don't know if it was rope they were giving him or if they couldn't travel with him. I don't think it was any fluke anyway. I'd say the handicapper won't be too kind with him but we will see what he does. He probably deserves an easy week. We will possibly step him up to seven next time - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's tough as old boots and has come back looking in great shape but he's up in the handicap now and will probably have a go at the Group 3 Abernant at the Craven meeting. I've no doubt his win in the Ayr Gold Cup was the performance of a Group horse but whether he can run to that level straight away this season, we'll have to see. 11-04-25

runners.name: My Mate Alfie
runners.comment: 3-time C&D winner inc' Gr 3; only beaten half a length on return; big player back here
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner including Group 3 in September and seems to appreciate a strong pace to follow; only beaten half a length at Listed level on return and big player back here if he comes on for that.

quotes.race: SBK Renaissance Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: My Mate Alfie has improved all season. We've been teaching him to sprint all year and he got what he deserved today. He is just very straightforward and we might go touring with him next year - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Bold Lad Sprint Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: My Mate Alfie is one of those fantastic horses. He has such a good heart. He is going to mature into a better horse next year so fingers crossed - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Jebel Ali Racecourse & Stables Dash Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: My Mate Alfie has been very consistent all year The blinkers have transformed him. The first furlong had me worried, I thought it was going to develop into a real sprint. He's in the Stewards Cup, I was fourth in the race a few years ago. It's massive prize money and if you're serious about that, you have to take part - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Storm Boy

prev_owners.owner: Cunningham Thoroughbreds Pty Ltd, A Bowler Et Al

runners.comment: Multiple Group winner down under; big player if fully fit for yard debut
runners.spotlight: Bids to follow in the footsteps of Starspangledbanner having won Group races down under before a switch to Ballydoyle; this is a stepping stone for Group 1 engagements at Royal Ascot but Australian sprint form is a cut above European in recent years and he's likely to be hard to beat if fully tuned up.

stable_tour.quote: He's a new arrival from Australia and he's fast. Before he came down, we didn't know whether he'd want six furlongs, seven furlongs or a mile but he's very quick and is definitely a sprinter - that was very apparent the minute he stepped up a gear. The plan is to go to Royal Ascot with maybe a run at the Curragh in the Greenlands Stakes beforehand. You'd be very happy with everything he's doing. 07-04-25

runners.name: Easy
runners.owner: Team Valor International Llc & Gary Barber
runners.comment: Listed winner on heavy on last season's return but likely best watched after 338 days off
runners.spotlight: Listed winner on heavy ground on last season's return before lesser run in France; probably best watched returning from 338 days off.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cork Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Easy is a Group 1 horse if I ever had one. I knew she would improve for this an awful lot. Hopefully we are heading for a Group 1 at Royal Ascot - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.name: Vespertilio
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Group 2 winner as a 2yo but didn't kick on and needs to improve on this season's efforts
runners.spotlight: Group 2 winner here as a juvenile but didn't really kick on last season and needs to improve on this season's efforts to have a say.

quotes.race: Emirates Poule d'Essai des Pouliches (Group 1) (3yo Fillies) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Willie McCreery has done a fantastic job to bring Vespertilio here in great condition. We had a doubt whether she would see out the mile but she's put that to bed and we'll see how she is. She's in the Irish 1,000 Guineas and the Coronation and I know the owner would love to go to Royal Ascot - Kieran Lalor, racing manager for owners Al Shira'aa.

quotes.race: Alpha Centauri Debutante Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: That was lovely. Vespertilio ran a lovely race the last day. She gets a free entry now for the Moyglare and we'll stick her in that now. We'll stay local, she actually qualified for a race in France today because she was bought in Arqana but I really wanted to come here instead of travelling at this time of year. She's lovely, gorgeous, and she has tactical speed as well - Willie McCreery, trainer

4:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Coeur Dor
runners.owner: Mark E Phelan & S P Oconnor
runners.comment: Fourth of 24 in the Irish Cambridgeshire over C&D last August; might need this on return
runners.spotlight: Ran well in some hot handicaps last year, most recently fourth of 24 in the Irish Cambridgeshire over C&D last August (1m, good; won that race in 2023), keeping on well and briefly short of room; might need the run but versatile ground-wise; contender.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Supporting Cancer Trials Ireland Irish Cambridgeshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Coeur d'Or is just a very tough, genuine and game horse. In his younger days he was a very immature horse but I gave him plenty of time and now it's paying dividends. He loves to come from off the pace and is very consistent. He will step up a couple of furlongs and come back here on Champions Weekend for the Northfields Handicap - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Mile Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Coeur D'or has been a very consistent all year. He is a very brave horse. We were a little worried about the ground, but this has been the plan and the horse delivered. He took a lot of time to come to hand but patience paid dividends - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Plusvital Speed Gene Handicap
quotes.quote: Coeur D'Or got an easy lead, they went no pace, and it worked out well. Chris kicked off the front end and he won well, it was a super ride - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Pride Of Place Maiden
quotes.quote: Coeur D'Or has done a few different things with him at home and we thought coming here might give him a new lease of life. He toughed it out well - Chris Hayes, rider.

runners.name: Indigo Five
runners.comment: Fourth to Orandi in the Lincoln; C&D win next time; poor at Gowran; could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Fourth behind Orandi in the Lincoln on return; produced career-best when comfortably winning over C&D (soft) 13 days later off 90; made little impression at Gowran (7f, heavy) on latest but has a chance if she can bounce back.

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee Available On Course Handicap
quotes.quote: Indigo Five won well and is a tough mare. She's probably Listed class but we might take on another handicap before that. She's won on good and heavy so she's versatile. She stays well and I think should get a mile and a quarter - John Feane, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Summer Fillies Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Indigo Five was very brave today and will be better with cut in the ground - John Feane, trainer

runners.name: Orandi
runners.comment: Lincoln win over C&D in March; just failed in British equivalent; probably needs some rain
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner in France; has won twice at this track for current yard, including the Lincoln over C&D on return in March; just failed when coming from rear to finish third in Lincoln at Doncaster (1m, good to soft) soon after; rain would be a big help for his chances.

quotes.race: Nua Healthcare Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Orandi was always missing the break, but Shane [Foley] rode him twice last year and was confident he would get him out sharp, which he did. Wayne Hassett was due to ride him but there were crossed wires, which was unfortunate for him and fortunate for Shane. I thought claiming 5lb [Hassett's claim] would be a big help, but it worked out well anyway. He's in the race [William Hill Lincoln], but I doubt he'll run. He was ready to peak here. There's always hope, but I'd be well below 50-50 about running at Doncaster - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.name: Blues Emperor
runners.owner: Mrs H M Keaveney & Mark Keaveney

prev_owners.owner: Mrs H M Keaveney & M Keaveney

runners.comment: C&D winner finished fifth in this race last year, beaten 2.5l; now 1lb lower on return
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-20, including over C&D in the summer of 2023; won over this trip at Dundalk in October but weakened out of things quickly in two subsequent AW runs; finished fifth in this race last year, beaten 2.5l; now 1lb lower on return.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Derby Festival Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Blues Emperor is very brave and when he gets his head in front he is hard to get past.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better Handicap
quotes.quote: Blues Emperor is a bonny little horse. We wondered would he handle this better ground but he is very tough and genuine. Hopefully he will make into a Premier Handicap horse - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: MAC Fuels & General Supplies Maiden
quotes.quote: Blues Emperor has probably done nothing but improve. He ran well at Dundalk and very well at Cork the last day. Ben (Coen) said he got into a pocket but he's very genuine, he tried his hardest when he got into the gap. We'll probably give him one more outing this season - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Skukuza
runners.comment: Runner-up at Royal Ascot last year; British challenger commands respect with Ryan Moore on
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the Britannia Handicap at Royal Ascot (1m, good to firm) last June; first run since when close fifth at Haydock (7f) last month; ran on late through beaten rivals on latest at Newcastle (7f); British challenger commands respect with Ryan Moore aboard.

stable_tour.quote: He's been very lightly raced and was second in the Britannia at Royal Ascot last year. He ran really well that day but picked up an injury and was out for the rest of the season. He returned in a posh handicap at Haydock over 7f on Saturday and finished fifth. We were very pleased with that. We took a chance on the ground but thankfully he's come out well. He should improve significantly as he hadn't run for a year. We'll see if he steps up to stakes races but we'll have a go at the Hunt Cup and races like that first. Physically he's a big beast and I hope he'll improve from three to four. 30-04-25

runners.name: State Actor
runners.comment: Won this last year; disappointed in Balmoral at Ascot; big player returning to this track
runners.spotlight: C&D maiden winner who followed up in this race (good) last year from 10lb lower; fair C&D fourth next time in June; improved form when going very close in Irish Cambridgeshire over C&D in August; disappointed in Balmoral at Ascot but big player returning to favoured track on return.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Emerald Mile Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: State Actor got a terrific ride. It was a messy race here last time but he grew up today. The handicapper won't be easy on us but he is a decent horse - Bill Farrell, trainer

runners.name: Akecheta
runners.comment: Hit the line well when second to Indigo Five on return; should be in the mix
