runners.spotlight: Debut win at Tipperary (7f, soft to heavy) last May; model of consistency in defeat since, last seen finishing second behind Indigo Five over C&D (soft) on return in March, hitting the line well; should be in the mix again.

runners.name: Perfect Judgement

prev_owners.owner: A Zevenbergen & Shamrock Thoroughbreds & A F O'Callaghhan

runners.comment: Completed 1m Dundalk hat-trick in the winter; will need a career-best to defy current mark
runners.spotlight: Completed 1m Dundalk hat-trick in the winter; fifth there next time after a further 8lb rise in the weights; has won on turf but will need a career-best to defy his current mark.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Perfect Judgement got a lovely ride and he travelled beautifully through the race. He needs horses to aim at and riding him cold is something we'll do in future - Stephen Thorne, trainer.

quotes.race: Aer Lingus College Football Handicap
quotes.quote: Perfect Judgement ran well on the Monday at Galway but the hustle and bustle later in the week didn't suit him. He is an improving young horse and the handicapper gave him a bit of a chance. We might freshen him up now and prepare him for the winter series at Dundalk - Stephen Thorne, owner's representative.

runners.name: Grey Leader
runners.comment: Galway winner last year; never involved on return 6 days ago; poor in this race last year
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in this corresponding race last year; four-time winner got a well-judged ride from the front when winning Galway festival handicap (8.5f, yielding) last August; slightly impeded from stalls when never involved on return at Naas six days ago.

runners.name: Exquisite Acclaim
runners.owner: Thomas J Oconnor & Ms Hazel Mcguinness
runners.comment: AW specialist is 6-23 at Dundalk and 1-22 on turf; mark looks too high at present
runners.spotlight: AW specialist is 6-23 at Dundalk and 1-22 on turf; stiff assignment when never a factor in valuable 1m Newcastle handicap last month; turf mark looks too high at present.

quotes.race: Group Deals Available At Dundalk Stadium Rated Race
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim travelled everywhere, was half-idling with me up the straight and I brought him over towards the rail. Once he did that he ran through the line well - Jamie Powell, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim has come back down now and he has got confidence. He's tough and he's hardy, and he's really putting his head down. He has a bit of class to him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim was good. He was giving weight to all rivals and still picked them up well. We've always held him in high regard at home and didn't think he'd have to wait until now to win his maiden, but he could be a nice progressive three-year-old next year - Shane Foley, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I was very pleased with him when fourth in the 2,000 Guineas Trial at Leopardstown. He might not be a top horse but is going the right way and could well be a nice Listed type. 14-04-22

runners.name: Presence
runners.comment: 14lb higher than C&D win; down the field in two comeback runs and must improve here
runners.spotlight: Dual winner last year at up to 9.5f, including an impressive victory over C&D (good) in October; 14lb higher now; down the field in two comeback runs and must improve here to figure.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Presence relaxed well today. She got a good tow into the race today and did it well. She wasn't really suited by the track at Bellewstown, she wants a nice track like this one - Keithen Kennedy, rider.

runners.name: Lord Church
runners.comment: Hat-trick last season for former yard; eyecatching run at Limerick; Oisin Murphy booked
runners.spotlight: Thrived in first half of last season for former yard, racking up a hat-trick of wins at Limerick, Cork and here (1m1f); eyecatching debut run for this stable when never-nearer third of 16 at Limerick (1m) last month; ground-versatile and Oisin Murphy booked.

quotes.race: Silken Thomas And Lock 13 Handicap
quotes.quote: Lord Church was quite buzzy at two and it took us a good while to get him to relax and switch off which he does well now. He's due a break now and then we'll see where we go - Michael Halford, co-trainer

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Handicap
quotes.quote: Lord Church did it well in the end. He's a smashing individual. He's a work in progress, he is going to go another furlong and will improve on better ground - Mick Halford, co-trainer.

runners.name: Serialise
runners.comment: Creditable third on Cork return 18 days ago; stable first string on jockey bookings
runners.spotlight: Won Naas maiden (1m, good) on reappearance last year; narrowly beaten here over 7f in June off 81; landed Cork handicap (7f, good to firm) off 80 in August; creditable third on return there 18 days ago; stable first string on jockey bookings; not discounted.

quotes.race: Twydil/Clovelly Irish EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Serialise has come forward this year and got her act together. She wants that quick ground and I've been waiting for about three weeks. I'd say we'll stay at a mile - Jessica Harrington, trainer

runners.name: Slieve Binnian
runners.comment: AW specialist; first try at this trip since June 2023 and might find it on the sharp side
runners.spotlight: Four of his five wins have been on AW but is capable on turf too; improved from seasonal/stable debut when third of 16 at Cork (10.5f, soft); first try at this trip since June 2023 and might find it on the sharp side.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Slieve Binnian did that well. He jumped and travelled and hit the line well, he is definitely on the up. He jumps quick and you can put him anywhere in a race - Ronan Whelan, rider.

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rental Handicap
quotes.quote: Slieve Binnian was in such good form all week that I let him take his chance. He's a lovely, gebuine horse and that's a good trip for him - Michael Halford, joint trainer

runners.name: San Aer
runners.comment: Dual-purpose performer is 4-41 on the Flat; midfield in the Lincoln; would be shock winner
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer is 4-41 on the Flat; midfield finish in the Lincoln over C&D (soft) in March; well beaten when last seen over hurdles at Tramore; would be a surprise winner.

quotes.race: KONE Handicap
quotes.quote: San Aer loves that ground. He's a very honest little horse and has won here before. He might go to the Curragh on Sunday - Tom Mullins, trainer

runners.name: Derry Lad
runners.comment: Wasn't beaten far (3.5l) on seasonal/stable debut at Leopardstown; market watch advised
runners.spotlight: One of two for the yard; 4-26 for Kevin Coleman; last won at Pontefract off 77 in June 2023; has since failed to make an impact off his revised mark but wasn't beaten far (3.5l) on seasonal/stable debut at Leopardstown (1m); market watch advised; tongue-tied.

runners.name: No More Porter
runners.comment: All three wins have come here; last success was over 7f last September off 82; 1lb lower
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come here, including over C&D; last success was over 7f last September off 82; now 1lb lower; not disgraced in pair of C&D handicaps since returning; not ruled out.

quotes.race: SBK Handicap
quotes.quote: No More Porter does not usually back up his races and we took a chance coming here after Listowel. He doesn't run a bad race here and he has been unlucky in the big handicaps - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Handicap
quotes.quote: No More Porter is just an improving horse. He showed us a little bit the last day and we thought he had a good chance here today - Johnny Feane, trainer.

runners.name: Enchanted Garden
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Sir Robert Ogden
runners.owner: Ms Olive Walsh & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo has won 3-4 handicaps; 2lb wrong but good chance again up in trip
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo has won 3-4 handicaps all over 7f; followed up AW success on handicap debut with Leopardstown win (good); scoped badly in hat-trick bid; another winning return when sent off favourite at Leopardstown last month, pushed out to win cosily; 2lb wrong but good chance up in trip.

runners.name: Eighty Eight
runners.comment: Third of eight at Ballinrobe (9.5f) on latest but faces a tough examination here
runners.spotlight: Won over 9.5f at Gowran in 2022 and gained his first win since on the AW in December (10.5f); respectable third of eight at Ballinrobe (9.5f) on latest but faces a tough examination here.

1:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Brussels
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett colt; 300,000gns yearling; yard won this with Henri Matisse last term
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt; cost 300,000gns as a yearling; half-brother to winners Arabic Charm (7f including AW; RPR 90), Love Affairs (6f 2yo; 85) and Lord Lovelace (7f AW; 84); dam French 6.5f (Listed) and 1m AW winner (97); yard won this with debutant Henri Matisse last season and this speedily bred newcomer warrants respect; market may provide clues; yard also run Kansas who has the benefit of a run but Moore seemingly prefers this colt.

runners.name: Canon Law
runners.comment: Beat one home when 150s for debut; stiff task on back of that; engaged here Friday
runners.spotlight: Only beat one home when 150-1 for his debut in a Navan maiden; stiff task on the back of that effort; engaged here on Friday evening.

runners.name: Cisterna
runners.comment: Mehmas colt; 65,000gns yearling; speed in pedigree; yard 6-189 with turf 2yo last 5 years
runners.spotlight: Mehmas colt; cost 65,000gns as a yearling; dam well held 10.5f in France only start, sister to useful 7.5f 2yo/1m2f winner Zucchini, half-sister to winners Zip Top (Group-placed 7f 2yo/2m hurdle) and Zorion (1m Listed), out of 6f/1m 2yo winner; yard 6-189 with 2yos on turf in last five years; probably up against it.

runners.name: Cool Azul
runners.comment: Blue Point colt; half-brother to Last Crusader (6f 2yo/5f Listed winner); check market
runners.spotlight: Blue Point colt; half-brother to winners Last Crusader (6f 2yo/5f Listed; RPR 106) and Game Breaker (6f including 2yo; 82); dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (98), out of half-sister to 5f 2yo Listed winner New Planet; yard capable of readying newcomers and worth a market check.

runners.name: Ennoble
runners.comment: Starspangledbanner colt; 62,000euros yearling; closely related to 5f 2yo Listed winner
runners.spotlight: Starspangledbanner colt; cost 62,000euros as a yearling; closely related to 5f 2yo winner Sirici (including AW/Listed; RPR 96), half-brother to 1m2f winner Copperknob (75); dam 6f 2yo winner (89), half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Silhuette out of half-sister to 5f/6f Listed winner Dazed And Amazed; speedy pedigree and yard get winning newcomers.

runners.name: Kansas
runners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg
runners.comment: Stuck to his task when 3rd a fortnight ago and should relish the step up to 6f
runners.spotlight: Stuck to his task well when beaten 1.5l by a stablemate on debut at Naas a fortnight ago; should relish the step up to 6f given his pedigree and yard's representatives often take giant strides from first run to second; Moore seemingly prefers Brussels but he warrants plenty of respect.

runners.name: Killourney Reigns
runners.comment: Respectable C&D 6th earlier this month having been slowly away; needs big step forward
runners.spotlight: Respectable sixth over C&D earlier this month having been slowly away; will need a big step forward from that to figure here though.

runners.name: Learntodiscover
runners.comment: Havana Grey colt; 140,000gns yearling; half-brother to winners Baby Gal (6f 2yo; RPR 75)
runners.spotlight: Havana Grey colt; cost 140,000gns as a yearling; half-brother to winners Baby Gal (6f 2yo; RPR 75) and Fillyfudge (1m2f including AW; 71); dam 7f-1m2f winner (94), half-sister to 6f-1m winner Miss Bootylishes and 6f 2yo winner Bow Wave; enough speed in his pedigree to suggest he could be involved for a yard that get winning newcomers.

runners.name: Maximum Scepticism
runners.comment: Churchill colt; 225,000euros yearling; half-brother to four winning sprinters
runners.spotlight: Churchill colt; cost 225,000euros as a yearling; half-brother to four winners including Stardevote (Group-placed French 6.5f/7f including 2yo; RPR 100), Hoof It Hoof It (6f including 2yo; 76) and Jaayiz (6f-10.5f including 2yo/AW/France); dam 6f winner (75), half-sister to 1m Listed winner.

runners.name: Sand Art
runners.comment: U S Navy Flag colt; dam 5f AW 2yo/6.6f turf winner (RPR 80); yard excel with sprinters
runners.spotlight: U S Navy Flag colt; dam 5f AW 2yo/6.6f turf winner (RPR 80), sister to German 1m1f Listed winner Cliffs Art, half-sister to Polish 5f winner Salien; yard excel with their sprinters and any market support worth noting.

runners.name: Slaudeen
runners.comment: Paid the price for being keen early when fourth of 10 over C&D having gone off a 10-3 shot
runners.spotlight: Paid the price for being keen early when fourth of 10 over C&D having gone off a 10-3 shot; may do better now for a yard that do well with juveniles but certainly needs to.

1:55.race_name: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Orby Stakes (Listed Race)
1:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Trustyourinstinct
runners.comment: Group 3 winner last term; as good as ever when 3rd over 1m2f latest; gives weight to all
runners.spotlight: Group 3 winner last term and as good as ever when third in a Group 2 over 1m2f earlier this month; won't mind return to further and while he has a Group 3 penalty to carry, he goes well here and gets his ground.

quotes.race: Tonybet "We're Here To Play" Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We weren't sure about the mile-and-a-half trip as his best runs had been at ten but Trustyourinstinct really got the trip well. He qualifies for a lot of big pots around the world as we get into the autumn so he could potentially end up in a race internationally - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballyduff Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Trustyourinstinct was a classy enough horse on the flat and it's probably taken him a while to get his act together over hurdles. It was a weak race and so we just kept it simple - Simon Torrens, rider

quotes.race: Bet Builder At Novibet Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Trustyourinstinct looks a nice horse. We thought he'd run well and he'll have learned a lot. He was green in the middle of the race there but I thought he went to the line well. It was a good performance on debut - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He showed some really good form last year, winning a Group 3 at Leopardstown over a mile and a half and just touched off in a Group 2 in Italy in October. We were happy with his run when third in the Devoy Stakes, but the set-up of the race wasn't ideal for him. Depending on ground, he could go for the Mooresbridge next. 24-04-25
He won two races on the Flat for us and he will start off in the next month in a juvenile hurdle. We're looking forward to getting him out over hurdles and his schooling has been good. 27-11-23

runners.name: Masoun
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.comment: Won back-to-back last summer inc' C&D success; back to form latest but has plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back last summer including a C&D success; back to form latest but has plenty to find in this company; tongue-tied.

runners.name: San Salvador
runners.comment: Dual-purpose performer; career-best latest over 1m6f but still plenty to find here
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer who produced career-best on the Flat at Killarney last time; however, still has plenty to find and drop back in trip probably not in his favour.

quotes.race: Ballymore Group Irish EBF Kilbegnet Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: San Salvador is improving and was good at Listowel the other day. He's rated 135 over hurdles, and he's going to be something similar over fences. Just niggly things held him up, but he's getting a clean run at it now. Stalking away seems to suit him and he'll have no bother getting two and a half miles - JJ Slevin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Strings & Things Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: San Salvador jumped better. He has always had plenty of ability and got it all together today - Sean Corby, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: tote.ie Never Beaten By SP Tara Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: San Salvador ran very well at Cork last time. The race worked out lovely for him today. He was able to get a lovely position, and apart from one mistake down the back he jumped very well through the race. He'll probably go up plenty for that, he might have to go up a bit to get into a race like the Coral Cup, but he will be going for another good pot somewhere in the spring - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: John J. Galvin Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward with San Salvador. He obviously won a bumper last time but it was a fair ask to win on his first run over hurdles ridden as positively as I was on him. I thought turning for home I was after overdoing it - and I probably did a bit - but in fairness to the horse, he didn't lie down and is hardy. He had good winter form last year, isn't slow and when he's in a good rhythm, he keeps going - JJ Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: San Salvador is quite a tall horse and still quite weak, but I thought he had every right to win that. He jumps very well so I would say he will go straight over hurdles - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well on his first start over fences at Limerick in May and will come back for a novice chase either next month or in the new year. He'll definitely be capable of plying his trade well in novice chases this season. 27-11-23

runners.name: Magical Hope
runners.owner: S I Weston & Ballylinch Stud & Mrs P Shanahan & P J Obrien
runners.comment: Listed winner in Germany; needs to take form to new level to compete here; new trip
runners.spotlight: Listed winner in Germany but would need to take her form to a new level to compete here and entitled to need this yard debut after 195 days off; yet to try this far.

runners.name: Drawn To Dream
runners.comment: Listed winner in Germany in 2023; couldn't kick on in Britain last term; new yard
runners.spotlight: Listed winner in Germany in 2023 but couldn't kick on in Britain last term and entitled to need this after 192 days off; new yard.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a great race at Royal Ascot in the Copper Horse Handicap but has been disappointing since. She has dropped down to a mark of 101 and I think we can use that rating throughout the autumn. She probably wants a stiffer test of stamina than she's had in her last two runs and some softer ground, and hopefully that'll improve her. 11-09-24

runners.name: Riviera Queen
runners.comment: Just maiden win to her name and this looks tough for the grade
runners.spotlight: Just a maiden success to her name; nearly got black type at Naas last autumn but beaten 8l at Gowran earlier this month and this looks tough for the grade.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly. She ran very well when third at Leopardstown earlier this month and has really strengthened up over the winter. She should be a nice staying filly as she's bred to get a mile and a half, maybe a mile and six furlongs. 24-04-24

runners.name: Romzina
runners.breeder: Haras De Son Altesse L'Aga Khan Scea
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Followed Cork win with 2 placed efforts last autumn at Listed level; too keen on return
runners.spotlight: Followed up Cork debut win with two placed effort at Listed level last autumn; sent off favourite for her return at Gowran but was too keen; that run may help take the edge off her and she's less exposed than most of these; warrants respect back down in trip.

runners.name: Sea The Boss

prev_owners.owner: John G Hennessy & C Acheson & Mrs John Harrington

runners.comment: Won fillies' Gr 3 a year ago but last 2 runs haven't been encouraging; questions to answer
runners.spotlight: Won fillies' Group 3 a year ago at Naas before a respectable effort in a Deauville Group 2; however, signed off last term with a poor run at Longchamp and it was a low-key return at Cork too; questions to answer now.

quotes.race: Al Shira'aa Racing Irish EBF Jannah Rose Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Sea The Boss was good last year and I ran her back too quick after Champions Weekend on soft ground. She doesn't go on soft ground. It was a big ask for her today as she hasn't run for seven months and there were three in there who had run. I thought her fitness might catch her out, but she was good and stayed well. She got the trip very well and she has that turn of foot. This was just her fourth run, so she should come forward a good bit from that. I don't think we'll drop back to a mile for the Guineas; she'll move up to a mile and a half at some stage - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden
quotes.quote: We've always liked Sea The Boss. We liked her a lot in the spring and she grew a lot. She is only really a frame of a filly and is next year's model. We'll see what we do and there is the final series of this race for her - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I'm happy with her and she seems in great form. All being well, she'll head for the Salsabil Stakes at Navan and I think the step up to a mile and a quarter will suit her. She's grown nicely over the winter and is in good form. 24-04-24

runners.name: Siege Of Troy
runners.comment: Course winner; placed at Listed level in US and return was encouraging
runners.spotlight: Course winner who placed at Listed level in US last September; return at Gowran was encouraging and may appreciate the step back up in trip.

quotes.race: O'Dooles Restaurant Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Siege Of Troy  is a nice filly and I think she will keep improving. She's big and she's raw, Ben says she should get an extra two furlongs no problem. I'm a bit happier today than at Gowran - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

2:30.race_name: Tulfarris Hotel And Golf Resort Handicap (Premier Handicap)
2:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Westminster Moon
runners.comment: Group-placed at end of last term in Europe but probably on a stiff enough mark here
runners.spotlight: Group-placed in Europe at back end of last term; nowhere near that level on yard debut last month; probably on stiff enough mark for now.

runners.name: Star Harbour
runners.comment: Gained 3 wins last year and back to form latest; down to a workable h'cap mark
runners.spotlight: Gained three wins last year including a course success and back to form when beaten half a length over 1m4f at Cork earlier this month; return to this trip is fine and down to a workable mark.

quotes.race: Happy 60th Birthday To Ger Dunne Of Punchestown Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour was running over a trip well short of his best. We had him entered at Chester last weekend but we took him out because of the ground and because this race was there for him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish EBF Ragusa Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Star Harbour has been very consistent, he won a good one last year in the Racing League as well. He's a great horse. We were to go to Yarmouth for the Racing League but that could put him out of the ratings. if it does he could go to Galway - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Castleisland Rated Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour got a top class ride. He is entered in the Galway Mile and if the handicapper isn't too hard on him he will go there instead of the Curragh on Sunday. He probably didn't quite stay at Down Royal but in time I think he will - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal County Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We put blinkers on Star Harbour last time but he missed the break and got caught in behind. He has a lot of ability and he wasn't a cheap colt. We have castrated him as he was a bit of a boyo and wasn't giving us everything. We did feel he had a lot of ability and I said I'd run him in this even though we were a couple of pounds out of the handicap as he'd have a light weight on his back. He put it to bed fairly quickly. He'll be nice for a mile-and-a-half handicap at Galway or as regards closer plans I was talking about the Ulster Derby - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Aeronautic
runners.comment: 2-4 last season and only beaten 2l at Listed level when last seen; that form worked out
runners.spotlight: Left debut behind with a Dundalk maiden win and then bolted up at Leopardstown on his third run of the campaign; signed off last season with a 2l defeat in Listed company back at Leopardstown last August and that form has worked out; warrants respect despite 275-day absence; gelded since last seen.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Best Odds Guaranteed Rated Race
quotes.quote: Aeronautic won nicely in Dundalk the last day and it was an impressive performance today, he quickened up well and he's a progressive horse - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: PD Lift Trucks Ltd Maiden
quotes.quote: Aeronautic is a big boy and he is only going to get better, there is plenty of improvement to come. He'll get 1m4f too - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He put in two good performances at Dundalk and Leopardstown last year and ran well when fourth in the Vinnie Roe on his fourth start. The plan is for him to reappear over the Guineas weekend at the Curragh and he might go to Ascot for a handicap afterwards. 24-04-25

runners.name: Longbourn
runners.comment: Gained 3rd win last term from 2lb lower; has run well on previous seasonal returns
runners.spotlight: Gained a third win on turf at Leopardstown last season from a 2lb lower mark; two lesser runs followed but he's run well without winning on previous seasonal reappearances and not ruled out despite his 251-day layoff.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Red God" Premier Handicap
quotes.quote: Longbourn can target those good handicaps and has been really consistent - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

quotes.race: TRI Equestrian Handicap
quotes.quote: Longbourn is such a consistent horse. He takes his racing well. It suited him to be in front, he got into a lovely rhythm and the ground was perfect for him. It's great to have him - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

quotes.race: Meadowview Stables Maiden (Div I)
quotes.quote: Longbourn is ground-dependent, needs good ground and we had him in last week, but the heavy rain at Limerick changed everything. He could keep going forward now. I thought giving the three-year-olds 6lbs might be a hard task especially in September, but he stuck to it very well - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer

runners.name: Mashhoor
runners.comment: Struggled last term with tough assignments; didn't give impression turn was near on return
runners.spotlight: Struggled last season, albeit given some tough assignments; didn't give the impression a return to form was near at Cork last month though.

quotes.race: Paddy Power International Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: You'd have to say Mashhoor has improved immensely. He's been very straightforward this year. There was no pace today so I said to Ben (Coen) to just let him roll along as he leads the string at home. I knew when they turned in that they weren't going to get to him, as he wasn't going to stop because he won over a mile and a half last time - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels & Resorts Orby Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was great. Mashoor has been training really well at home and showing all the right signs that he had improved. I'm really delighted the way he won today. He can win at 1m2f and now he can get 1m4f so there are plenty of races for him - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Mashhoor ran very well in Cork on his first run and he had a very good draw today, and was given a very good ride by Shane. He's mentally immature but is toughening up now and being by Kingman I'd say he has loads of class - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Bet 10 Get 20 Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Mashhoor ran well on debut last year and learnt plenty from that and will have done the same today. He's a strong traveller but picked up nicely and showed a good attitude to go through the gaps - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: Himalayan Heights
runners.comment: Went close on h'cap debut last season and bounced back to form on this year's return
runners.spotlight: Tipperary maiden winner a year ago and went close on handicap debut at the Galway festival; form dipped subsequently but returned with a facile Leopardstown success on first run since a gelding procedure and an 8lb rise is fair; may come on for that run and has to be high on the shortlist.

quotes.race: "Domin OH HOO HOO" Handicap
quotes.quote: Himalayan Heights is a massive, beautiful big horse. He was just a little bit raw and immature last year and we thought that [the gelding operation] would do him the world of good, between that and growing up. Hopefully there's a nice pot in him somewhere along the line - Ger Lyons, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Racing Again On July 2nd At Tipperary Maiden
quotes.quote: Himalayan Heights is a big horse and Colin said he didn't enjoy that ground either. He wants just a nice ease. He is an autumn horse and is definitely a next year horse - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Nurburgring
runners.breeder: A O'Brien,M Al Monsour& K Al' Attiyah

prev_owners.owner: Al Mamoura Partnership/Mrs A M O'Brien
Al Mamoura Partnership/Mrs A M O'Brien
Al Mamoura & Mrs A M O'Brien

runners.comment: Dual-purpose performer who remains well treated but surely needs further than this
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer who remains well treated but surely needs further than this trip and this may be a pipe-opener for the Flat season.

quotes.race: Guinness Galway Hurdle Handicap (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: When Nurburgring ran well at Punchestown, we decided this was a good mid-summer target. He had a little holiday and then had a nice run over a shortish trip on the Flat at Leopardstown to blow the cobwebs away - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Price Boosts Across All Channels" Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Nurburgring had been gelded since his last run. He travelled like a dream and jumped well. He had a little look around him after the last but he did it well - Richie Deegan, rider.

quotes.race: Larkin's Bar & Francie Sheahan's Bar 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Nurburgring was a bit careful but he should improve. With his Flat rating we were hoping he could do that. He coped with the ground well. We'll probably try to find a winners-of-one for him - JJ Slevin, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Racing Next On Saturday May 13th Maiden
quotes.quote: Some of mine have needed a run this year and I thought he might get a bit tired, but he came home well. He is a big horse with a lot of scope and is a smart type. He will be a lovely middle distance/stayer hopefully. Joseph O'Brien - trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll probably go to Fairyhouse for a juvenile hurdle. He obviously lost the race in the stewards' room at Listowel but the form of that race has worked out well. He's a lovely, big horse and he seems to have taken well to hurdling. He has been gelded since Listowel. 27-11-23

runners.name: Apercu
runners.comment: C&D winner; best runs with cut in the ground; recent winner before lesser Gowran run
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who produces her best performances with cut in the ground and she got her head back in front at Cork before lesser run at Gowran earlier this month; needs rain to arrive to be of interest.

stable_tour.quote: She will probably go for the Northfields Handicap. She won nicely at Naas and she stepped up to a mile and half at the Curragh and finished sixth, which I was a bit disappointed with as I thought she had a great chance. I'm not quite sure she got the trip, so we're bringing her back in distance. She'll be near the bottom of the handicap but she has a fair chance of getting in. 11-09-24

runners.name: Final Voyage
runners.comment: 7-time AW winner yet to score on turf; respectable runs in defeat lately; stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner who is yet to score on turf (first run on grass since 2023 here); quick ground would probably help and respectable efforts in defeat this winter but needs to prove he can be at his best at this trip.

stable_tour.quote: This colt is so genuine and has given everyone a lot of fun with five wins from nine starts, which reads even better on the all-weather having a five from seven record. He does not go well on the grass so we will continue to race him on the artificial surface. He has risen through the ranks where he now finds himself with a rating of 93. There is a race at Wolverhampton on May 18 while there is a 1m2f option at Lingfield in mid-June. I would love to try him over 1m2f soon as I feel the extra trip could bring out improvement in him and add to his already commendable winning record. 28-04-21

runners.name: Soaring Monarch
runners.comment: Won from 2lb lower in Sept' but tailed off on return and may want a bit further
runners.spotlight: Won from 2lb lower over 1m4f at Listowel last September; however, tailed off on reappearance and may want a bit further than this trip.

quotes.race: John McGuire Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Soaring Monarch is a very nice horse and did it well. I'd say we'll keep him going for the season as he doesn't mind soft ground - Alan McIntyre, trainer.

quotes.race: Rockshore Handicap
quotes.quote: That's as quick as Soaring Monarch wants the ground and as the ground gets slower later in the year you'll see a better horse - Peter Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Knockcroghery Handicap
quotes.quote: Soaring Monarch is a nice horse and it was great to win first time today. He finishes out his races very well. The plan is to go back to Galway, he ran twice there last year and was maybe a little unlucky not to win one. We'll see what the handicapper does - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Cloud Seeker
runners.comment: Highly progressive winning 5 of last 6 and only defeat came on reappearance; 4lb rise fair
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive, winning five of his last six and the defeat came on his seasonal reappearance; 4lb rise for recent Leopardstown win is fair and he's clearly a tough sort to pass with some of those wins coming from the front; there's not too much pace in this and has to be respected in his current mood.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Golf And Driving Range Handicap
quotes.quote: Cloud Seeker won four last year and had a blow in Tipperary, he just needed the run. We'll give him an entry at Royal Ascot or he could be one for something like the Ragusa at the Curragh. He jumps hurdles well so he has that option as well in the future - Andrew Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Zoffman
runners.comment: Promising start to life over timber since last seen on Flat; all best Flat form over 1m4f+
runners.spotlight: Promising start to life over timber since last seen on the level a year ago; all his best Flat form is over further; well held in this last season.

quotes.race: Leopardstown October Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I think going up in trip and getting on to easy ground has been a help to Zoffman. Today he even looked like getting further. He's very small and I thought with a low weight he had a great chance. You're always surprised when they win as easy as that, but you're probably getting a free 7lb with Jamie Powell. He jumps quite well but won't be going hurdling at this time anyway. I couldn't imagine he'd make a jumper being so small - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly Maiden
quotes.quote: Zoffman has run some very good races and it's only clear to us now that he wants ease in the ground, and maybe 1m4f. He really quickened for Dylan too. He might win a good handicap on soft ground - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Ceallach
runners.comment: 5-time AW winner; cracking run behind Cloud Seeker; best form at 1m4f but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Five-time Dundalk winner with the last four wins coming over 1m4f; cracking run behind Cloud Seeker at Leopardstown (1m2f) earlier this month; up 1lb but may have more to give for his new yard and not ruled out, despite ideally needing a bit further.

runners.name: Dutch Gold
runners.owner: Albert Dravins & Exors Of The Late Eamonn Scanlon
runners.comment: Losing run since C&D success on testing ground in 2023; stayed on well latest
runners.spotlight: Losing run since a C&D success on testing ground back in 2023; stayed on well over 1m4f at Cork last time and probably needs further than this, or slower conditions; now tried with first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Dylan Browne McMonagle rode DUTCH GOLD last time over a mile and we were thinking about going back to 7f but he said he needs a trip. I was worried about the ground but he seemed to like the ground and the trip. He had some very good runs as a two-year-old and we were getting a little bit frustrated so that was nice to get. I had a notion we were going to geld him after today's race but we might leave him now as he settled well - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Retracement
runners.comment: Pontefract maiden winner; 2nd on h'cap debut back there when last seen; may need this
runners.spotlight: Won Pontefract maiden for William Haggas and hit the crossbar back at that venue when last seen on handicap debut; doesn't look well treated on anything he's done so far and may need this on yard debut returning from 229 days off.

runners.name: Mr Rango
runners.comment: 4th in this last season; recent return wasn't encouraging; 5lb lower but wants it slower
runners.spotlight: Fourth in this last season; didn't take to life over hurdles and his Limerick return wasn't encouraging; 5lb lower this year but others look more likely with all of his best efforts coming on slower ground.

quotes.race: Play Novileague At Novibet Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Rango is tough and loves the ground, he just stays and gallops all day. He might jump a hurdle on the back of that - Katie O'Sullivan, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Gormanlough Apprentice Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We were waiting on the rain all year, he is a grand type but he needs the rain for his stamina to kick in. It is great for his owners and hopefully he can do it again - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer Mr Rango

runners.name: Jungle Cove
runners.comment: Laytown winner in September; never involved after slow start at Leopardstown; tough ask
runners.spotlight: Laytown winner in September; never involved after a slower start at Leopardstown on return behind Cloud Seeker and hard to see him turning that form around.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Shergar Cup Mile (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Jungle Cove is a star. He's basically my lead horse at home. Emma-Jayne gave him a fabulous ride and said she knew he was going to win a furlong out; that she had so much horse underneath. I knew he'd pick up. He goes on any ground - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Nasrullah" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Jungle Cove is a brilliant horse. He's my lead horse at home and works like a Group horse. Dylan gave him a great ride, full of confidence and stuck to the inside. He doesn't interfere with the horse. More senior jockeys get on him and kind of bully him, which he hates. He just loves tooling around and feeling as if he's in charge - that's him. It's a fantastic pot to win. It's brilliant for Dylan on his first ride - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Borris Handicap
quotes.quote: Jungle Cove has won well. He works like a good horse and is a good lead horse at home. It's good for him to be paying his way - Shane Foley, rider.

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets Racing & Sports Betting Maiden
quotes.quote: Jungle Cove travelled through the race well, he won well. He's going to have a busy summer, he's a very good work horse so he'll be leading all them good ones at home - Shane Foley, jockey.

runners.name: Cheers Again
runners.comment: 3 wins on AW but 0-15 on turf; stamina to prove at this trip and well below form this term
runners.spotlight: Three wins on AW but 0-15 on turf; stamina to prove at this trip and well below form this season.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Cheers Again won't run again until the turf. I was going to go to Leopardstown in April but he won't get into that now. He's improving though and he could be a good horse - Paul Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Cheers Again came back last time and he was all wrong and I gave him a break. I honestly thought he wanted further because he was maybe a bit weak. When we brought him back, the more we did with him, the quicker he was getting - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Molto Amichi
runners.comment: Promise in maidens last term and only beaten a nose on return; 1m2f likely to suit
runners.spotlight: Promise in maidens at the end of last season and only beaten a nose at Ballinrobe on return; 1m2f likely to suit and looks like a major player, despite being 1lb out of the weights.

4:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Transcending Glory
runners.owner: Kildare Racing Syndicate & Kilmichael Racing Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Kildare Racing Syndicate & Kilmichael Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: Second over C&D on this card last year; had excuses for Chester run on return, caught wide
runners.spotlight: Front-runner was second over C&D on this card last year off 87; won good Leopardstown handicap (7f, good) last July off this mark; had excuses for below-par effort at Chester on return when caught wide from high draw; contender; hooded.

runners.name: Merlin The Wizard
runners.comment: No show over inadequate 5f at Navan on seasonal/stable debut in first-time hood (left off)
runners.spotlight: Won three times in Britain from 7f-1m in 2023; not as good in three starts last year; never a factor over inadequate 5f at Navan on seasonal/stable debut in first-time hood (left off) last week; could improve.

runners.name: Chicago Fireball
runners.owner: Samuel M Mencoff & Anthony Paul Smurfit
runners.comment: Beaten 0.5l in C&D handicap off 90 on final start last year; 4lb lower; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-13 on turf; beaten 0.5l in C&D handicap off 90 on final start last year; 4lb lower now; raced too freely when well beaten on seasonal comeback at Naas; led much of the way on latest at Cork; each-way possibilities.

quotes.race: Bingo Loco After Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Chicago Fireball is a versatile horse. I probably asked him to pick up soon enough but I was not expecting him to pick up as well as he did. He's an improving horse - Ben Coen, rider.

runners.name: Plume Noire
runners.comment: Unlucky over C&D last June; goes well fresh and looks well treated on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won Naas handicap (1m, good) on return last May; unlucky not to get up in C&D fillies' premier handicap (good) in June off 87; soundly beaten in Galway Mile and Irish Cambridgeshire but goes well fresh and looks well treated on stable debut.

runners.name: Four Blondes
runners.comment: Found 6f too sharp when weak in the betting on return last month; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won Fairyhouse maiden (7f, good) last summer and some fine runs in defeat at up to 1m; found 6f too sharp when weak in the betting on return last month; others preferred.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Four Blondes deserved that on last year's form. She's by Gleneagles and wouldn't mind a little bit more ease in the ground. She's out of a six-time winning Exceed And Excel mare but seven furlongs to a mile would be fine. She can be a little bit saucy and has a little bit of a funny head carriage but she could be progressive - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer

stable_tour.quote: There's a fillies' handicap over 7f at Fairyhouse coming up which should really suit her, as she won her maiden around there. She was just collared close home at Gowran the other night. She just had to use up a bit too much petrol early there and it cost her. 11-09-24

runners.name: Shavasi
runners.comment: Heavy ground possibly to blame for poor comeback run at Gowran; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Killarney maiden (1m, good to firm) winner who won her second handicap start at Punchestown (1m1f, good) with a nice bit in hand under prominent tactics; heavy ground possibly to blame for poor comeback run at Gowran; in the mix.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Daily Irish EBF Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: Shavasi  jumped well, travelled strongly and quickened up well around the turn. She was strong at the line. We always thought plenty of her - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

runners.name: Merisi Diamond
runners.owner: David Brennan & J Tuite & Ms Joanna Morgan & Jeremy Greene
runners.comment: Fourth from tough draw at Limerick (1m) last month but hopes rest on the heavens opening
runners.spotlight: Four wins on soft/heavy divided between here (6f-7f) and Roscommon; ran well in fourth from tough draw at Limerick (1m) last month but hopes rest on the heavens opening.

quotes.race: Follow @ToteRacing On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Merisi Diamond did too much here last time so we were anxious to get him to switch off today. For a big horse he is still babyish and timid so you would like to think there is plenty to come - Ronan Whelan, rider.

runners.name: Genuine Article
runners.comment: In and out of form last season but some of better efforts came under this rider; absence
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; no win since Killarney maiden (1m, yielding) success in July 2023; in and out of form last season but some of better efforts came under this rider; nearest at finish when third over C&D when last seen; absence to overcome.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Genuine Article took his time to come to hand and he will improve a ton. He seemed to be doing things well at home. There is a three-year-old handicap at Galway which might suit him - Chris Hayes, rider.

runners.name: Marakesh
runners.comment: Outran odds when runner-up at Gowran (7f, heavy) on handicap debut; unchanged mark; player
runners.spotlight: Won Gowran maiden (7f, good) with plenty in reserve on debut last September; never landed a blow in Naas Listed a month later; sent off 28-1 for handicap debut, outran odds when runner-up at Gowran (7f, heavy) on return; unchanged mark; player.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Marakesh was good and straightforward. She got me into a lovely position and when the gap opened she quickened out nicely. She was green but she put it to bed nicely and you would hope there is improvement there - Billy Lee, rider.

runners.name: Pinar Del Rio
runners.comment: 2nd of 13 at Naas (6f, good) two weeks ago, headed close home; shortlisted from 1lb lower
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back last season, including here (6f); all wins on testing but ran a cracker on stable/seasonal debut when second of 13 at Naas (6f, good) two weeks ago, headed close home; shortlisted from 1lb lower.

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Handicap
quotes.quote: Pinar Del Rio is improving. We got him right over the winter and got him right, he's paying us back. We'll try and run him as often as we can for now because he does want t bit of juice in the ground - Joe Conlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rentals Handicap
quotes.quote: Pinar Del Rio has plenty of ability but is a bit of a rogue. On a good day he's a grand horse - Joe Conlon, trainer

quotes.race: Tally Ho Stud Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Pinar Del Rio had a lovely first run, and I was hoping coming today that he would do something like that. He did it well, he'll have no trouble getting further than that and he will improve on nicer ground - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Verhoyen
runners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & M C Grassick

prev_owners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & M C Grassick
Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & M C Grassick
Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & Patrick Pearse

runners.comment: Won this race in 2022 and 2023; Billy Lee (6-time winner on him) is on Merisi Diamond
runners.spotlight: Six of his eight wins have come at this track; won this race in 2022 and 2023; well below form since Fairyhouse win last summer; Billy Lee, who has ridden him to victory six times, is on Merisi Diamond; best watched for now.

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Handicap
quotes.quote: Verhoyen is competitive off this sort of mark and he wears his heart on his sleeve. We put the blinkers back on him today, the conditions suited him and I told Billy to ride him like it was a 6f race - Michael Grassick, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Verhoyen broke very quick today and he was gone. He's not that well-handicapped, so the fresh ground and the draw really came good for him - Michael Grassick, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Scurry Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm surprised how well Verhoyen stuck at it but he's well handicapped from what he's doing at home and on his two-year-old form in the Listed race. He's shown a level of ability but just hasn't been consistent. He just lost his way a bit last year but sometimes you see that with sprinters as three-year-olds. The Bold Lad could be a target for him. He only ran on Wednesday night so I'll give him a couple of easy weeks now. He deserves it - Michael Grassick, trainer.

quotes.race: Curragh Where Champions Are Made Handicap
quotes.quote: He hit the stalls right today. He has that level of ability that he's able to carry weight in these sort of handicaps and when nothing got to me at around half way I was still almost coasting away. I thought a little bit that the game might have been up when I was joined by the runner-up after being out on my own that long, but he's a clever old boy and was saving a little bit for himself and he dug deep when I needed him - Billy Lee, rider of Verhoyen

runners.name: Eyema Candy Girl
runners.comment: Won on debut at Dundalk (6f) in November; well beaten over 1m there since; watch market
runners.spotlight: Daughter of Justify made a belated winning debut at four over 6f at Dundalk in November; the form of that race hasn't worked out; well beaten in 1m AW apprentice rated race there in December; market will reveal expectations on handicap debut.

runners.name: Port Louis
runners.comment: Won Cork apprentice handicap 18 days ago; 4lb higher now; engaged 8.25 Curragh on Friday
runners.spotlight: Roscommon maiden (7.5f) winner; did good work late after sluggish start on Leopardstown return; built on that promise when winning Cork apprentice handicap (1m, good) 18 days ago; 4lb higher; engaged 8.25 Curragh, Friday.

quotes.race: Racing Again Saturday, May 10th Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Noel (Meade) told me Port Louis can be quirky and keen, and I didn't want to interfere with him too much. I gave him a little rein, didn't touch off his mouth, and it worked out lovely as we went a good pace - Wayne Hassett, jockey speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Goal Exceeded
runners.owner: Ms H Mcguinness/Martin W White/Declan Sheridan/Breen White

prev_owners.owner: Hasan Mefareh Alajmi & Fawzi Abdulla Nass

runners.comment: Beaten 1.25l into fourth of 14 in 7f Dundalk handicap in October; first run for yard
runners.spotlight: Landed Naas maiden (6f, soft) in October 2023; hasn't kicked on since, although rattled home when beaten 1.25l into fourth of 14 in 7f Dundalk handicap when last seen in October; first run for Ado McGuinness; others hold stronger claims.

runners.name: Rappell
runners.comment: A real threat when he gets a decent pace to aim at but has to prove he stays this far
runners.spotlight: All three wins at 6f, including at this track last August off 66 (good); midfield at Naas two weeks ago; he's a real threat when he gets a decent pace to aim at but has to prove he stays this far.

quotes.race: Castle Arch Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Rappell is a fine, big horse and learning away. He jumped and travelled and always had something to aim at. Once he gets to the front he thinks he has done enough - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Friday Fairynights 7th June Handicap
quotes.quote: Rappell  was green and ran really well. He's definitely come on a lot from it. I think he's a grand horse, his mother was very good - Paul Flynn, trainer

runners.name: Black Storm
runners.comment: 2nd to Listed-placed horse on sole turf outing at Cork on debut; could improve
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on second start in Dundalk maiden (7f) in October (form franked); disappointing in three AW starts since but chased home Listed-placed Rubies From Burma on sole turf outing at Cork on debut; could improve for switch to grass.

runners.name: Gordon Bennett
runners.breeder: Aj Groundworks Ltd & P F Kelly
runners.comment: Encouraging runs here over 6f since returning but struggled over this trip in the past
runners.spotlight: Last win was in 5f premier handicap at this course in September 2022 off 90; encouraging runs here over 6f since returning but struggled over this trip in the past; player if he stays.

quotes.race: William Hill Joe McGrath Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We've decided that's it for the year for Gordon Bennett. He's had a great time and there is nothing left. These sprinters seem to get better with age and he's not heavily raced. We'll spend the winter building him up and he could just be stronger again. The great thing is that he's learning to behave a bit. Gary [Carroll] said he was never as calm as today and we noticed it in the yard too. A lot of the quirkiness might be going out of him - Dick Brabazon, trainer.

quotes.race: Sean Barrett Bloodstock Insurances Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Gordon Bennett has had a fair bit of bad luck since his last win. He should have won at the Curragh last month and should have won at Fairyhouse. He nearly always runs a race - Dick Brabazon, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilberry Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Gordon Bennett was always a lovely horse and I asked Nathan to try and get some cover and he did it well. He settled beautifully and looking ahead we can manage him a bit now. He has a fair engine - Dick Brabazon, trainer.

runners.name: Genesis
runners.comment: Can be slowly out of the stalls; needs to find major improvement to have a squeak
runners.spotlight: Dundalk maiden winner (6f) over a year ago but without success since; can be slowly out of the stalls; needs major improvement to have a squeak.

runners.name: Just For One Day
runners.comment: Won 6f maiden here last year; will appreciate return to turf but absence to overcome
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo returned from a break to run well at big odds in 6f course maiden last August before winning over that C&D the following month; poor on AW/handicap debut in October; will appreciate return to turf but absence to overcome.

runners.name: Penny Mountain
runners.comment: Eyecatching run after tardy start when fourth in course maiden on return; interesting
runners.spotlight: Reared up in stalls here (6f) on debut last September, staying on well late; showed promise next time at Naas; eyecatching run after tardy start when fourth of 11 in course maiden (6f, soft) on return, beaten 1.25l; interesting handicap debutante; 2lb wrong.

runners.name: Secret Magician
runners.comment: Not at best of late; well treated on pick of form and Wayne Lordan an interesting booking
runners.spotlight: Won at Naas (7f, good) last summer off 63 before narrow defeat here (6f) from 5lb higher; not at the same level this term but is well treated on pick of his form and Wayne Lordan an interesting booking; 6lb wrong.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Secret Magician was caught for a bit of toe at one stage, and he got stuck into him. He's as tough as nails - Martin Hassett, trainer.

5:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: East Hampton
runners.breeder: Manor Farm Stud & J E Rose
runners.comment: 6f maiden winner here last term; returned with win on h'cap debut; quicker ground concern
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner here last term and returned with a testing ground success on handicap debut; 7lb higher mark is fair but suspicion he wants slower ground than what is likely.

quotes.race: Irish Racing Writers Association Ron McKnight Memorial Madrid Handicap
quotes.quote: The only time East Hampton encountered ground that resembled soft, he won on it. We brought him to Dundalk the last day but he didn't like the surface so we put him away for this. Obviously six furlongs was as far as he'd gone so the trip was a worry but I was delighted to see the low draw. Luke gave him a fabulous ride, dropped him in and switched him off as much as he could. He will learn from it, he was fresh today. He saw it out well, though and didn't stop galloping. As long as the ground has an ease, we'll keep going - David Marnane, trainer.

runners.name: Nancy J
runners.comment: Gowran maiden win on debut before big run at Listed level; not as good since; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Gowran maiden winner on debut before 2l defeat at Listed level; has gone backwards in two runs since but may have needed her return here and first-time cheekpieces may help her get back on track.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It's always good when they win here first time out. Nancy J has always been very professional at home and she seems to do her work easy. I had a nice draw, I winged the gates and I slipstreamed Dylan [Browne McMonagle] all the way. She picked up like she was going to go away and win well but she had a good look and was quite green. She should improve loads and she's a nice prospect - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden first time out at Gowran Park. We ran her in the big Goffs race over six furlongs at the Curragh in September and she just got no luck in that. She was entered in a Group race at Leopardstown a few weeks ago but wasn't quite there yet. She's going to be a smart filly this season over seven furlongs or a mile. 23-04-25

runners.name: Jagged Edge
runners.comment: Only beaten 1l in a maiden on debut before Cork maiden win which has worked out nicely
runners.spotlight: Only beaten 1l in a Dundalk maiden on debut in February before landing a 17-runner Cork (1m) maiden last month and that form has been boosted by the runner-up since; possibly has the speed for this shorter trip and not ruled out with more to come.

runners.name: Shameful
runners.comment: Newbury maiden winner in Sept'; shade disappointing when odds-on for Kempton novice since
runners.spotlight: Newbury maiden winner in September but was a shade disappointing when odds-on for Kempton novice in March; gelded and may do better.

stable_tour.quote: He won his only start at Newbury last year and we thought enough of him to give him a 2,000 Guineas entry. That was always a bit of a pipe-dream and, after he was beaten at Kempton on his return this year, we had him gelded as he was getting heavy. However, he still excites me with his whole physical build and we'll be talking about plenty more nice races for him in the future. I'm looking forward to some rain for him. 17-04-25

runners.name: Glyndwr
runners.comment: Off the mark at 3rd attempt in AW maiden; form knocked and finished last on his return
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at third attempt with Dundalk maiden win but that form has been knocked since and he finished last of eight at Roscommon on return 12 days ago; needs to leave that behind and Keane rides Shameful.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: He is a horse who doesn't do anything quick, really Glyndwr would like to go 1m. Seven was our only negative today but he broke well and got to the line well. He'll be a 1m2f horse next year - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Iceford
runners.comment: 2nd in 3 of last 4 and form of Cork h'cap 2nd working out nicely
runners.spotlight: Hit the crossbar in three of his four starts since making his debut and the form of his handicap second at Cork last month has worked out nicely with the winner and third both going in since; ought to be a threat from this sort of mark and less to prove than some.

runners.name: Monotone
runners.comment: Cork maiden winner second time out at 2; didn't kick on but back to form with narrow 3rd
runners.spotlight: Cork maiden winner second time out as a juvenile and while he didn't kick on last season, he got back on track with a narrow third over this trip at Gowran last month; feasibly treated if he can build on that.

runners.name: Scott Key
runners.comment: Came on from return with heavy ground 1m win; too keen at Naas since; this may be sharp
runners.spotlight: Came on from return with heavy ground Gowran success over 1m; too keen at Naas since and suspicion this is sharp.

runners.name: Far From Dandy
runners.comment: Yarmouth maiden winner; not beaten far when last seen; needs more on h'cap debut; new yard
runners.spotlight: Yarmouth maiden winner who was only just touched off at Brighton when last seen; however, will need to improve to defy this opening mark and entitled to need the run on yard debut returning from 219 days off.

runners.name: Powerful Lady
runners.comment: Won fillies' maiden on AW but not as good twice since and may want a step back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Won fillies' maiden at Dundalk in January but not as good twice since and may want a step back up in trip.

runners.name: Gangsta Man
runners.comment: Off the mark at 12th attempt latest and may dominate from the front again
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 12th attempt in a Roscommon handicap on return 12 days ago; 4lb rise looks workable and may be able to dominate again from the front.

5:55.race_name: Finlay Volvo Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
5:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Bear Creek
runners.comment: One of two runners for the yard; no encouragement to take from his three runs so far
runners.spotlight: One of two runners for the yard; no encouragement to take from his three runs so far; 100-1 and beaten 28l when last of 12 at Gowran 17 days ago; passed over.

runners.name: Cezarro
runners.owner: Thomas B Breen & Mrs C Cashman & Steve Boorman
runners.comment: 40,000gns yearling; dam 1m4f winner, half-sister to 7f Listed winner Escobar; watch market
runners.spotlight: Cost 58,000gns as a foal; 40,000gns yearling; dam 1m4f winner (RPR 69), sister to 6f-1m winner Bobbi Grace, half-sister to 7f Listed winner Escobar, out of Group-placed 6f/6.5f 2yo winner; market will reveal expectations.

runners.name: Crosshaven
runners.comment: Dam 1m6f winner, sister to Derby winner Australia; 13,000gns yearling; Colin Keane booked
runners.spotlight: Closely related to winners Born Ruler (7f AW/1m2f; RPR 96) and Zoran (1m2f/2m Flat including AW, 87/2m4f hurdle/chase); dam 1m6f winner, sister to Derby winner Australia; 13,000gns yearling; Colin Keane booked.

runners.name: Esherann
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Runner-up at Leopardstown (7f, good) on debut; should relish the step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Looked in need of a sterner test when runner-up of 11 at Leopardstown (7f, good) on debut 13 days ago, keeping on well in the closing stages but no match for the winner; leading candidate.

runners.name: Our Friend Mouse
runners.comment: Fourth foal; half-brother to two winners; looks best watched on his debut
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to two winners including La Sapienza (French 7.5f 2yo; RPR 95); dam French winner, half-sister to Listed-placed 1m1f/1m2f winner Bright Melody, out of Fillies' Mile winner; best watched.

runners.name: Propose
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Runner-up in Dundalk maiden in March; Irish Derby entry should play a major role here
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt never landed a blow on debut in end of season course maiden (1m) last year; stepped up massively on that when runner-up in 10.5f Dundalk maiden in March; Irish Derby entry should play a major role here.

runners.name: Rizal
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Slow start cost him on debut; entitled to improve and in the mix with a better break
runners.spotlight: Lovely pedigree; well-backed 7-4 favourite but slow start cost him when remote fifth of 12 on debut at Gowran (1m) 17 days ago; entitled to improve and in the mix with a better break.

runners.name: Sears Crossing
runners.comment: Entitled to improve but cheekpieces are reached for already which is a negative
runners.spotlight: Well-bred son of Sea The Stars failed to make much of an impression on debut at Tipperary (12.5f, yielding) last month; entitled to improve but cheekpieces are reached for already which is a negative.

runners.name: Steel Cut
runners.comment: 23,000euros yearling; half-brother to Pearl Glory (Group-placed 6f 2yo); watch market
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; 28,000gns foal, 23,000euros yearling; half-brother to winners Pearl Glory (Group-placed 6f 2yo; RPR 98) and Guiteau (7f including AW; 78); market will guide on debut.

runners.name: Tracker Issue
runners.comment: Cheap purchase; remote third behind promising type at Cork (10.5f) on latest; more needed
runners.spotlight: Quite a cheap yearling at 8,000euros; 66-1 when down the field in course maiden (1m, soft) on debut; remote third of five behind promising type at Cork (10.5f) on latest; more needed.

runners.name: Valorous Power
runners.comment: Step up in trip on a more galloping track should play to his strengths; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Made a highly encouraging debut at Killarney (1m, good to yielding) 11 days ago when a staying-on fourth of 10; step up in trip on a more galloping track should play to his strengths; shortlisted.

runners.name: Fawkner Park
runners.owner: Bennett Racing P/L Syndicate, Gaire P/L Syndicate Et Al

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Maiden
quotes.quote: Fawkner Park is off to the sales next week, he's in there anyway so I suppose that is up to Joseph and to Lloyd and Nick Williams. He has (loved the surface) but he likes soft ground on the grass. He'll go with plenty of cut in the ground as well -Brendan Powell, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: Bois Dargent
runners.breeder: Sarl Elevage Du Haras De Bourgeauville
runners.owner: Ontrack Bois Dargent, Fourmour Racing Et Al

runners.name: Militarize
runners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.name: My Oberon
runners.owner: D F Degenhardt, Hirecha Racing Et Al

quotes.race: All-Weather Mile Championships Conditions Stakes
quotes.quote: My Oberon gave me a moment of fright, I thought I was going to win by half a length when I took him off the bridle but he knows how much he has to do and he won't do an inch more. He's done really well to win because he's had a busy time being in Dubai and coming back and it takes its toll. It was a great training performance to get him here today and get his head in front, it's a tough one to judge when horses are travelling - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Earl Of Sefton Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: My Oberon is a lovely horse who's had plenty of work but he's a big horse so takes a bit of getting ready. Hopefully he'll have a good season as he's not many miles on the clock - Maureen Haggas.

quotes.race: William Hill Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: I don't know what My Oberon beat. He's a lazy horse at home but William has always liked him since he was a yearling. He was a bit backward as a two-year-old but he's getting his act together now. He still looks quite green and quite babyish, he's a long way off the finished product - Mareen Haggas, trainer's wife.

runners.name: Kovalica
runners.owner: N Morgan & D H T Devine

runners.name: Eliyass
runners.owner: Seymour Bloodstock Syndicate, L Le Metayer Et Al

runners.name: Osipenko
runners.owner: C J Waller, I Bruce Et Al

quotes.race: Prix de Reux (Group 3) (3yo+) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Klondike got stuck in soft ground at York and he's clearly better on this quicker ground. He won his very first race when it was heavy and, although he is a good mover, I always thought he would handle soft ground, but I'm wrong about that. He's a Group winner now, so hopefully he'll go onwards and upwards, he's going to have to. But he's from a family that improves with age. We all know what his father's horses do. Hopefully, he'll keep going - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Race To The Ebor Grand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was a very nice performance. Klondike made Ryan work for a little bit but he was in front a long way out and to keep going like he did was great. The ground may be a little sticky for him as well - Issy Paul, assistant trainer to William Haggas.

quotes.race: Too Darn Hot Darley Maiden Stakes (Horses That Have Run No More Than Twice) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Klondike is a well-bred horse and Luca trained the dam who stayed well. We'll go slowly slowly - William Haggas, trainer.
